ct2h8w-nrPOr6yhY75filw.text: Amazing customer service by Eduardo the manager. We had the fish tacos and mushroom enchiladas. The enchiladas are maybe my favorite Mexican thing I've ever eaten. We'll definitely be back.

HvhmZDvXqRGQWJdpQ7FLYw.text: I was looking for a new place to eat. What a great find! (thanks Yelp) Cocina Madrigal is the spot to go grab a bite  and some drinks . I won't lie, I was a little concerned about the location. (pretty shady area) but seeing all the good reviews and the five star ratings. I had to go see for myself. Let me tell you, the service was great the staff makes you feel welcomed and make sure that you are properly taken care of including the owner who is also the chef. The food was delicious  everything was great from the appetizer all they way to the dessert. Oh and lets not forget the drinks... the bartender he knows what's up!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IpgT7FQBdiFLBPtuHd5srw.text: Excellent service! Went for lunch on a weekday and had some of the best service I've ever experienced in a restaurant.  I had the tacos: fish, steak and al pastor. All very tasty and would get again. The guacamole was very fresh and the addition of pineapple was delicious! For dessert, we had the churros and they were out of this world! Hands down the best part of the meal! We met Mr. Madrigal, very nice man and he went out to every table to ask how their meal was and personally thank them for coming in.  Great addition to Phoenix, always looking for new restaurants and they did not disappoint! We will be back, that's for sure!

-O5_NyOqosFFP1r8UusyBg.text: Ok luv luv luv this place.... check it out  Great service  Great food  Reasonable prices

tgQ3QWQIRM1NYgDEN3uAVA.text: I can't recall having Mexican food this good. Everything was exceptional. A True diamond in the rough, I hope people make the drive to experience Leo's creations. He even took the time to go around table by table thanking everyone for coming. Truly a class act. Thank You Leo - keep doing you!!!

nA5yGwnN3yq6WKn8QwtPBw.text: Out of this world little hole in the wall restaurant. Fantastic work by the chef, his wild mushroom enchiladas were out of this world. Reminded me of risotto but still distinctly Mexican, and cooked to perfection. The staff was helpful and friendly, our waiter Eduardo was kind enough to go through all of the specials and gave us the background on the restaurant and the chef, and we just had a fantastic experience. You can't go wrong with a late lunch or early dinner from this fantastic little restaurant. Go early and beat the crowds for Happy Hour ($2 off appetizers and drink specials can't be beat). We were just driving through but if we could, we would eat here all the time. As an added bonus, the chef came out and personally visited with each of the guests dining in the restaurant. It was great to be able to talk to him and compliment his cooking in person. 5 Stars!

mRrM11kORiNLSLjEavsbnA.text: Disappointed! We were excited for some good Mexican food based off of all the good reviews. We went on a Sunday evening. There were several empty table but we were rushed to order our food and told that they were really busy so we needed to hurry up. I ordered a drink from the bar and the waitress told me it would be a while because they we too busy. The service was terrible, the atmosphere was very loud and the food was average at best.

0MkKp6Hzbe9W_hXhSzjOTQ.text: Wow. Knock your socks off Mexican food not to be confused with chain restaurants. We had lunch there today and the food was excellent. We both had the taco plate, mine was the anchiote chicken, tropical fish and a shrimp taco all on flour tortillas. My wife had the  the tropical fish and a shrimp taco. The tacos are stuffed full of ingredients and well seasoned.  The atmosphere is just plain restaurant which should be overlooked because of the quality of the food.

rbMEfuhal44wyi8sPKD4rw.text: Driving to this little Gem, it feels a lil scary, whether you should try it or not. It's in an area that is not populated with other restaurants or strip malls. It's a little hole in the wall. We noticed as we drove by, several people sitting in the patio and thought we would give it a try.  Parking could be better, but we found a spot easy enough.  When we walked in we were welcomed and seated. Eduardo (I hope I got the name correct), greeted us right away. We ordered a Margarita and the guacamole and chips.  Both were delicious! The guac tasted homemade and the chips,  which was a big portion, were fresh.  We were undecided between a few things, Eduardo recommended that we could order the barbacoa enchilada and wild mushroom enchilada, one of each with rice and beans. Amazing! The barbacoa was delicious but the wild mushroom enchilada was absolutely the best enchilada I think i've ever had! If you like mushrooms,  order this!   We were so full there was no way we could eat dessert,  but seeing it go by our table, we new we were missing out.  Definitely,  next time though!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guac and Chips tastes homemade
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbados and wild mushroom enchilada delicious

VeP6GS7hX2vyWBn6J-lDkA.text: Wow! Just wow! The food, and the service is absolutely amazing! I've had jerk chicken in Jamaica and Madrigals is better. Their green sauce is better than mom makes, and they have a habanero salsa that they need to bottle and sell. This is a place that I will gladly travel from Tucson regularly for.

51XJyNIOFlKl_cBj5jDcvQ.text: Delicious!  Best steak tacos I've had. Our server was friendly and personable. Food service was quite fast  We ordered the fresh gucamole and the taco trio.  My only regret  was not ordering more steak tacos.

ztKlWKCE3FZcqTTR8I68Jw.text: Wife and I just coming in from Hawaii, we both were craving for Mexican food. We came across Cocina Madrigal, this place is the standard of Mexican grinds! People are friendly... we love it

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jskAm6IQkVJBHI7OHNpJfQ.text: I drive by this area everyday and saw the new restaurant sign    decided to look on Yelp and see what the reviewer were saying. I saw excellent reviews and decided to bring my whole family in for dinner tonight. We were greeted by the sweet and helpful hostess Yazmin (not sure on the spelling). She seated the 6 of us. We told her we came in because of the Yelp reviews and we excited to see a mom & pop place in south Phx. She was the daughter of the Chef. Her lovely mother brought us homemade guacamole and chips to start off our meal. The guac was so thick and flavorful. We ordered a round of margaritas on the rocks and also order the Trio!! Then on to our entrees . The food came out looking amazing and each bite was full of flavor.  The Beans & Rice were delicious ..You can mix and match the Tacos too. One of the owners offered for us to try the frozen margaritas. They offered a powerful kick and made without ice. Absolutely amazing and gave you a nice buzz. After we finished our main course we had to try all the desserts. I honestly enjoyed each one and can't even give you a favorite . Each one was delicious in its own way. We finished everything !!! The Chef stopped by to say hello and it really felt like he cared about his customers.. This will be a staple for us to visit. Welcome to the south mountain family Cocina Madrigal.. love this new place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chipotle Chocolate pie- so good!! It&#39;s like a brownie but so much better
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Frozen margarita made with no ice. Has a great flavor and kick!!
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros- best I have ever had and filled with some heavenly Goodness!!

NOVXnN8E-PRmgsvKDYipbw.text: Delish! We stopped here before heading to the airport. Everyone working here is so nice, the food is fresh and yummy, and the service was quick. Mr. Madrigal also stopped over to our table to check that we were enjoying our food. We were hesitant when we pulled up because from the outside it doesn't look like much, but go in! You won't regret it!! The enchiladas and tacos are two thumbs up!

ooJBHnEVYNihm3OjtemyBA.text: New restaurant in South Phoenix that we have already been to twice. The crispy salmon is delicious.  We also had the guacamole and it is very fresh and made to order.  The staff is very friendly and service is great.  On our 2nd visit we came close to closing and everything was fresh and hot!  The only negative would be the A/C both times we went it was not very cool.  Not sure if they have an air conditioner or a cooler. I still will come back for that salmon!

1mq1wsV2FWkWwKIkMrNDKg.text: This restaurant is so cute and the food is delicious! Had the great pleasure of meeting the head chef and learning about the place. Tortillas are made fresh and fresh ingredients! Definitely recommend this place! Amazing service and food. Will be returning and referring all my friends to this place!

wNQDvRPlufkE3Xr1AfezRQ.text: we were craving Mexican and salsa. this is the spot to go to. great service. yummy and delicious Mexican food. the guacamole and chips was fresh  we are definitely coming back. thank you for the good experience my wife and I enjoyed it. plates empty

f13UdvbuXDPJCVBJqUdX5Q.text: Everything was great! We will come again.. mushroom enchiladas, steak salad and churros to die for.

huVM8zCVtfzczqWOdfKjjA.text: Loved it!! Amazing handmade corn tortillas. Literally, the best tortilla I have EVER had. Tacos, street corn and churros were awesome. Service was top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YucQmLlWCH7lDURpvqQiIQ.text: Don't overlook this place! Humble on the outside but the food is great! This isn't "taco shop" style Mexican that you can find on literally every corner (but is delicious in it's own right!). This is True master chef Mexican cuisine! I ordered the Mesquite Grilled Romaine - so good! My coworkers who tried it loved it too. Everyone else got the tacos and really loved them. The service was excellent and the food was promptly delivered. Everything also tasted really fresh too. I will definitely be back!

tAjd0SpQDoV4-waSnJbDYA.text: My fiancee and I just had dinner here and it was absolutely wonderful.  The staff was incredibly friendly and the food was fresh, flavorful, and well-presented.  A massive platter of chips with a large bowl of homemade salsa was quickly brought to the table, and was one of the more enjoyable chips and salsa experiences I've had.  My fiancee ordered the chicken enchiladas and I had the beef birria enchiladas.  Both were made using freshly prepared tortillas and filled with succulent meat bursting with flavor.  The rice and beans were also very good and a welcome reprieve from the greasy versions that accompany dishes at most  Sonoran-style restaurants here in town.  The churros were desert were to die for.  All in all, a great restaurant and well worth stopping in--I know I'll be back.

6u7JXkVn8SE31LfotJ91ZA.text: This is truly a gem, little hole in the wall restaurant! The service was fantastic from the greeting to the check, they were always on top of making sure we had everything that we needed. I like that the menu was small, to me that means they spend time and extra care on the dishes they do make. With that said, everything that we ordered was amazing! The food was flavorful and fresh -- from the spices in the beans to the tender beef, you can really taste the difference! I look forward to coming back here so I can try a few of the other items on the menu (especially the elote). I also love that the owner/chef himself stopped by our table to make sure that we were satisfied with our meal - it really leaves a lasting impression. If you're in the area and looking for something authentic, you should definitely stop here, you won't regret it!

MllkzFWu8Ka2D5uBJzS7PQ.text: This place is a little gem of a restaurant.  Ridiculously good food throws a party in your mouth.  And the staff are all very friendly and accommodating.  Worth the extra drive no matter where you're coming from.

M8nlWO1czfM_dhvUXMicpg.text: Just a short drive from PHX and even quicker from the business aviation terminal, this gem of a Mexican restaurant might not catch your eye as you drive down 16th street, but don't pass it if you are hungry for one of the finest South of the Border cuisine in Phoenix. Cordial welcome, inviting dining room by the bar, or outside on the patio, their prompt service will quickly deliver your order before you are done with the chips and habanero salsa. Tortilla soup, fresh guacamole, and scrumptious burritos with a variety of fillings, their 3 tacos plate is a favorite, tropical fish, barbecued meat or fresh crunchy vegetables. Chef Madrigal will approach every table with the genuine concern of a 3 Michelin for his customers satisfaction and a warm thank you for patronizing his wonderful kitchen. And we keep coming back for more.

CiWAaeAMnt8a4TsH0hLZ3w.text: Food is amazing! Drinks are amazing! Even the coffee is good! Can't go wrong here tacos, salad, all the appetizers are yumo

ufgXqL-XD3zUsGacISObJA.text: It's a new place as very very nice very clean the employees are very nice the chef came out and asked how was the food you can go for a date take your wife for a day your girlfriend for a date they did recommend to eat mushrooms and chiladas that's the great plate but I did try the green pork chili it was awesome you can lick the plate great margaritas

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy looks go it was the best
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos yummy
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good Place  delicious pork chili

Awb2l25EOrG9cpWhpHorRA.text: As a resident of SoPho for the past 8 years I was heart broken when Amano Pizza Bistro left the neighborhood. We have so few non chain restaurants here and their departure left a huge void. That's why I was so happy to spot Cocina Madrigal as I headed north on 16th street one fine morning. My husband and I had the chance to dine there last night and we will most certainly be back. Don't let the less than glamorous street corner (16th and Wood just north of Broadway) discourage you. Inside this restaurant the chef creates some of the best Mexican food you'll ever have.  We started with the appetizer sampler - delicious made to order guac and queso fundido with mushrooms and caramelized onions - insanely good. Although not a vegetarian I ordered the mushroom enchiladas - oh my ....... incredible, rich, earthy and satisfying - even their beans are incredible. My husband got the mammoth steak burrito - the meat was tender and had a nice tang to it. Topped off the experience with their hot, crunchy churros - not to be missed.  Oh, and did I mention the margaritas? Potent and yummy. A hidden gem in an area that is crying out for quality non chain restaurants.

_XnVBlzQNLLM3LzZcm_aTw.text: Was on vacation and stopped in for happy hour margaritas and some late lunch. Service was so friendly and fast, and the owner/chef even came out a couple of times to talk to people on the patio. I really enjoyed the food: I had chips & guacamole, a trio of tacos (roasted vegetable, ancho chicken, tropical fish) and a few margaritas. The strawberry margarita was the best of all. Definitely come to this place if you want mouthwatering food, delicious drinks, and exceptionally friendly service. I will definitely be back the next time I visit Phoenix.

YOeoT2WN5kbUpJFTebFvMw.text: I can't rave enough about this place but at the same time I want to keep this gem a secret so it doesn't get overpriced and over crowded. I was taken here as a surprise for my birthday and it was amazing. We ordered the guac and two entrees as well as a dessert which was delivered after a visit personally from the chef.  How cool to have the chef and owner of a business come greet you.  You rarely find that these days. On top of all that the food itself was something to write hime about DELICIOUS and the  service was impeccable. YOU GUYS KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK . See you soon.

9smXC-aRiv2gpiLfhBwBww.text: This is the BEST authentic Mexican restaurant in the Phoenix area. I would give 10/10 stars if I could. Stumbled upon this joint a few months ago and had to come back during our next trip to Phoenix. We always receive exceptional service, but Eduardo is especially phenomenal! The food is out of this world! I simply cannot recommend this restaurant enough. I will gladly be coming back on every trip to Phoenix. Cocina Madrigal is definitely a hidden gem. Everything on the menu will knock your socks off. Do yourself a favor and stop by, you can thank me later.

aTtJ7W7GbZtF6uu9A7MnHA.text: Great food good service. Love the steak tacos and the mushroom enchiladas. The prickly pear margarita was real good. The chef came out and talk to us. Would definitely go there again.Recommend strongly

94LHu0WuLMkVJkdcCH6aOQ.text: These were the best tacos ever. Amazing flavors that are a little unique. Pineapple guacamole is not to me missed. Highly recommend.

NapOsZcSwY4kZtcuMPA2Uw.text: Unbelievable enchiladas and super friendly service. We will drive long distances for this place because the mushrooms and tacos are that good!! We suggest the mushroom enchiladas and the Oaxaca.

4uksjLNd4BEUjEaMuB-qFA.text: Amazing place for lunch or dinner. Tacos were amazing and the churros simply awesome. Staff was incredible. Highly recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Listen...if you are in the area look no further. For lunch or dinner this place is amazing. I enjoyed the tacos and the churros and amazing.

oN_P1_j3OGMXs1YH-IclxA.text: The freshest and most flavorful Mexican food on the south side if not the entire valley. The service was very friendly also.

B1m8tFjCk4Ckijz10MGE2w.text: Delicious!  The service was top notch, the drinks were excellent, and the food was exceptional. The white sangria was so good it was dangerous. Everything was fresh and delicious I got the vegetarian tacos and I was blown away. My husband couldn't stop talking about the steak tacos with the pomegranate sauce. Their salsa and chips were house-made and just the right amount of spicy.

J33xVgeMNkl4iNFz0X5d4Q.text: we stopped here on our way back to san diego. we looked up Mexican food and although this place only had a few reviews it had 5 stars and we decided we wanted to try out this new to town restaurant. IT WAS ALL AMAZING. the staff is incredibly nice. the chef came out to check on how we liked the food which I thought was awesome, the owner of the place took time to come say hi and ask for feedback on our experience. being from san diego we have lots of great mexican food and this place is right up there with them. we ordered the al pastor make it your way burrito, Barbacoa green Chile enchiladas, the corn on the cob, chips and salsa and the churro. the meat in both entrees was so tender with tons of flavor. the salsa was amazing I feel like it's hard to find a great salsa. THE CHURRRO IS A MUST! cream filled with caramel drizzled on top and then some kind of cream glaze to dip it into omg heaven. you have to give this place a try.

W28Z8G9Xjw0bvS4gwwMu8w.text: Very good. Tacos al pastor were . Chicken enchiladas are the best compared to any other restaurant. Definitely coming back.

77nNPZDqNFKGnj0UgOfjsg.text: This restaurant is truly a diamond in the rough!  I read all of the 5-star ratings given on Yelp and so glad we chose to spend our time at Cocina Madrigal!  Even though they have only been in business a short time, they shine!  They are winners just through the personal attention given to each guest.  But the food is such a standout among others, and meeting Chef Leo, the owner, was such a special treat!  I had the grilled romaine salad with olive oil and marinated beef tenderloin and my husband had the Barbacoa and wild mushroom enchiladas.  We also had the bacon jalapeno guacamole that was freshly made for us and their already famous margaritas that are perfection!  Here's a picture of my salad!  All I can say is I wish this restaurant was in Houston!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_647IYjuQrK4ClTTH0NlGA.text: Amazing food. Perhaps some of the best tacos I have had, ever. Nice people to boot. Worth coming by, especially if you are on your way in or out of the airport. Delicious.

E34i6MkCA9FINBhJKLWGmQ.text: Delicious!  The taco trio can be mixed and matched! Nice choice of lettuce cups instead of flour or corn tortillas. As well as grilled vegetables instead of rice or beans!  I tried the steak,  shrimp and fish. All Very flavorful! I enjoyed the steak the best!  Just ask for  chips and salsa. Highly recommend the guacamole it was the bomb! Fresh!  There's no taco Tuesday specials.  Service was excellent. Price was $21 for three tacos and shared guacamole.  I will definitely go back!

X08BXRSkoZQuRiJ5oblwhA.text: Came here for dinner on a work trip to Phoenix and so glad we did! The prickly pear margarita is great, fresh guacamole, delicious al pastor tacos, and the elote is truly one of the most amazing things I've ever eaten!

mpeynFPMIEioqDOd5ILkNw.text: This is the best restaurant we have been to in a long time. The service is stellar, the food is exquisite and the overall experience was simply amazing! Our new go to restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chipotle chocolate pie! My husband doesn&#39;t like desert and he ate almost the entire piece.

Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled romaine salad!! Unbelievable-best EVER!

7_h8DOzofnBV0qH9LMGneQ.text: I had dinner here with my husband this evening and the food was excellent.    Really attentive and genuine customer service as well.   I had the shrimp tacos (which were so, so good) and my husband had the steak burrito.   He had a chicken quesadilla as a starter.   Music and ambience were on point.   We will definitely be back.   It's a new favorite for us!

4IthxFKR8VH9qLMOoGI9lw.text: Came here because of the already amazing reviews and this restaurant did not disappoint! My wife and I were in town visiting friends and decided to stop in for lunch before we left on our flight back home. The owner/chef immediately greeted us when we walked in the front door. This place is truly a hidden gem and some of the best Mexican food I've ever had, and I'm originally from San Diego lol. Great atmosphere, tacos, and very professional and kind staff. I will recommend this place to any and everybody!

cyyvEXHvKI7ex97-r6aLug.text: Hidden gem, landed from being out of town and my son and I found this place!!  Outstanding guacamole, taco's, corn and the best churros I ever had!!!  Everyone that works there are so nice!  Our new favorite place!!!

rHOmFoqgaL9I5xBn1SKOYQ.text: Food here is unbelievable everything tastes good. Owner is very personable and service is excellent and efficient  Place is clean. LOVED it

8OL69eQzsUy4Y4qccbq84w.text: This is one of my favorite spots. Have been there multiple times and it never disappoints. The margaritas are awesome and the green chile pork appetizer comes with fresh tortillas and is one of the best dishes I've ever had.

RTm4SHpCloZV6mK_uLYKjQ.text: The food here really is worth 5 stars. We started with the elote and chips and salsa and they were really tasty. Lots of good, fresh flavors. For our entrees, I got three different tacos and my boyfriend got the Barbacoa enchiladas and everything was absolutely delicious. The fish taco was probably the best I have ever had in Phoenix. Very impressed by ALL the food. The only negative thing I would say is that the house margaritas were overpriced at $9 each and had virtually no alcohol in them. We each had 2 and no buzz at all. Usually one margarita is plenty for me, so I was a bit underwhelmed. Even with the margs, I still give this place 5 stars because the food is THAT good.

uL-j9RpejY0DNLBPqK8evQ.text: Wonderfully flavorful food, generous drinks, and brilliant service.  I love coming here!  My current favorite dish is the wild mushroom enchilada, and the churro is so yummy!

1BD08o_peZE_py6Nb_av_w.text: I went to this restaurant because it was five stars... I don't agree. If I could put zero I would. I ordered the fish tacos. Visually the tacos looked great. The combination of ingredients sounded interesting and in theory it would have been but there was a very bitter aftertaste of rubber... I don't know if it was bc of the gloves they used to prep the food or something else... The tacos came with rice and beans and it was the smallest proportion I had ever seen (they were in "sauce" containers... not enough for a "side") not good value for the price.  the waiter was nice enough initially but only checked on us once.... then disappeared which is saying something since it is such a small place. We never got a refill on our drinks and had to go looking for him to get our check. I only had the tacos and went home. I felt queasy all night. The food did not sit well with me.

_A6D60G34KU7Ah8w-108Ug.text: Fresh gourmet tacos, with tortillas made in house. The chef came over to everyones table to see how everything was tasting. Excellent food, worth the extra money.

w6QCQFnc73noWsiib7RsaA.text: Service is fast and very eager to ask what options you want changed.  Food is great and fairly portioned.  Everything is working as it should and makes it seem like they know what they are doing. There isn't really much room to complain. My friends can't handle the stronger cheeses they serve though, haha.

nmp6jQMGP2xSQn1qy0gL_g.text: Great place! First time here and the environment was great! Staff went out of their way for my husbands bday and even the owner/chef came out to sing. Food was delicious. Can't believe I never stopped in, in all the years I've lived so close. Will definitely recommend and will come again. Much love to the bartender. ((I didn't get his name)) :( Margaritas were delish as well!

l-GVgeTIfL2bKJ3ZiTAUEw.text: Excellent food and even better service! Waiter let us try some churros wow were they awesome! We ended with a handshake from our waiter and left feeling like family.

oeIj_pZJ3DhADfbOk6CsUg.text: This place is amazing!! Small and casual with delicious food! Also, Maria is a sweet heart and helped us make the right food decisions aka the fish taco! The steak was unique and also so delicious. Be warned- the al pastor can be spicy to those who don't tolerate heat well- but still delicious! can't say enough about how much we loved this place.

UOfR0boVMW2tsEzHcJBxvw.text: Loved this place! Great food and service. Margaritas, enchiladas, and tacos are all delicious. Will go again when I visit Arizona.

cx7cJYXn8foX-pIDAiO8sQ.text: Great food and great service. Been in Phoenix for 3 years and without a doubt the best place and service we have had!! We will be back. Thomas was great!

4FS_E_Qb4J5N6AC7-L_adA.text: Exceptional food and great service. Meeting Leo, the chef, was a special treat after such an enjoyable meal. It's impressive how well he can cook the basics (incredibly flavorful beans and rice), but also add his own personal spin to familiar dishes. We left so satisfied and happy- will definitely be back many more times!

gtPxntDrEC6cdfRlLFtStA.text: Wow!! The reviews are so on point! This place has delicious tacos that really hit the spot! We had the Al pastor tacos which were flavorful with a nice kick of spice! We also had the beef tenderloin taco and wow... So good! We will definitely be back!! This is must try if you're in the area!!!

GaBmRniA0Lby2X4LFmBHHA.text: Awesome.  Best Mexican I've had in Phoenix and I've ate at many.  Leo the chef is amazing.  The guacamole was out of this world. Service was excellent. Chicken and beef were so moist and tasty. Perfect flavor without pain.   Ten thumbs up.

CV8geI_NnZcDzjhWiXuELQ.text: A True hidden gem in south Phoenix! * Very friendly staff! Don't be surprised if the owner/chef comes to your table to thank you for your patronage  * Nicely decorated inside, don't let the exterior fool you * Have eaten almost all the tacos, enchiladas and built a burrito- never been disappointed!  * Tortillas made fresh daily * Highly recommend: Oaxaca fundido AND ANYTHING ELSE ON THE MENU! It's just that good! * Great place for group gatherings or a casual dinner date

dz-CJ9GO_xQENkme68Ke-A.text: The Best Mexican Food in town!!! Tacos w/lettuce cups--Yum!! Very quaint restaurant with friendly staff & wonderful food!!

wbae4cVJ0APAgt1WsUApYg.text: Heard great things about this place and it did not disappoint! Great fresh flavors and reasonably priced.  The guac with grilled pineapple is a MUST! Tried three different tacos. The shrimp had the best flavor but all were delicious. So grateful they had the option to have them served in lettuce cups.

c25f7LSRxM7dQMGPhDrC0g.text: OMG!!!!  How can a restaurant this inexpensive be this great!!!  Cannot tell you how great the food is!!!  You must order the mushroom enchiladas!!!!!  Yes!!!!!!

uh7N5WKXsCqr8nErhFbDFA.text: I got two beef tenderloin tacos and one al pastor. Beef tenderloin were Amazing! Al pastor was also really tasty. Best tacos I've had in Phx, also most expensive... but worth it on occasion. Mouth is watering just thinking about them.

I2dUGAXGjKJ59IdId4QYsQ.text: An awesome surprise! Do yourself a favor and come down to 16th St & Broadway for a fantastic meal. I came here for lunch as it is around the corner from my office. The food was fantastic! The chips and salsa to start off were simply excellent. Very fresh chips & salsa. The tacos I ordered were unique and extremely tasty. Another person at the table ordered the MAC & Cheese dish which looked yummy! Per that person it was great. The ice tea was really refreshing as well.  The entire staff was friendly and attentive. The owner/chef came out and had a wonderful conversation. I know people have their favorite, but give this family owned restaurant a shot you won't be disappointed.

ZmIsKTvJuCwWJC1L3Nx7Xg.text: Great place.  Would be better if I did not witness the waiter having a meltdown.  Watching him (waiter) yell at the bar tender about making $$$$$

MurOuyOXKrmTLYUU0BPyVw.text: Wow! I cant stop thinking about this place! Food and service both fabulous! I came in for a take out order. I was a bit intimidated having driven past this place many times but never stopped. I'm so glad we decided to try it! I was greeted by the hostess and she was very friendly and went to check on my order. While I was waiting, the owner came over and offered me water, tea, soda on the house. He gave me 2 free iced tea in a to go cup for free, which by the way, was really delicious (think tropical fruit)! The owner stood there and chatted with me the whole time I waited for my order! Such service to me is unheard of nowadays, especially as a "to-go" customer. One of the servers also stopped what he was doing to come and open the door for me on my way out! Now, the food. The chips and salsa were awesome, tasted like they were made in house and salsa very flavorful! I got the beef birria enchiladas. The meat was so tender and delicious and the sauces were great. My hubby got 3 types of tacos which were all delish but the fish taco was probably our favorite! We also got the elote, which was outstanding!! We couldnt put it down and were arguing over it! Next time we will order 2 of them! We also got the churros which were filled with deliciousness and a yummy cream sauce on the side. We have been dreaming about the food since we went and will definitely be making this one of our regular places! I applaud the outstanding service and unforgettable food!

vC69f7pUe0hJP_ieXag8AA.text: Definitely a place you want to try in Phoenix. They have such unique and amazing flavors. My mom had the green Chile barbacoa and mushroom mole enchiladas and I had three lettuce cup tacos with the tropical fish, shrimp and steak. The food was delicious! I love that I could get lettuce cups. They were super busy but Eduardo, the manager, was always interacting, helping and adding more personality on the floor!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8VpKjWeXm8hVFTan9KK4pg.text: Hands down THE BEST MEXICAN FOOD IN THE VALLEY and perhaps, beyond!!! The food is exceptional! The flavors are beyond.  My husband and I just stumbled onto this restaurant but with the first bite, it has already become our most favorite Mexican restaurant!  The staff are all very friendly and welcoming.  Can't wait to return!

0nXGBUTAQ_3H6qcuNSbtCg.text: All the servers were great! The owner was also very nice came to our table and greeted us  y'all need to try this place.  I got a Pastor taco, steak taco and a chicken taco) it was delicious they only thing missing was a hotter salsa but still very thing was well made  definitely going back !

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bomb !!! Severs and Owner were all amazing and make you feel comfortable!
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I got a Pastor taco, steak taco and a chicken taco it was delicious

UgFn8GH9NY7o0V8IoxmjJw.text: It's been a while since I've had a good dining experience on the south side. We were welcomed when we came in. We were seated and our waitress came over soon after. She was very helpful and accommodating. My little one wasn't feeling well and she did what she could to accommodate us. The food was EXCELLENT! I have the beef enchiladas. The little one had a kids meal, a chicken taco with rice and bean. We also had the churros for dessert. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bqF-3QqHK6IrSPkCvQ_jyA.text: Oh my gosh, always get your tacos with the corn tortillas! They are made to order and the best!! The owner greeted us and even brought me fruit for a dessert for my birthday since I can't have dairy. Everything was delicious. We had the salmon, tacos, guacamole, and the stuffed churros. Great staff and fabulous food! Can't wait to go back!

tJNkNYdvJMbwZB-TsanAOA.text: The food was incredible and everyone was friendly and attentive. Glasses were refilled often and our server was very good. You have to try the guacamole, so good!

RWJpyBdzdPKJ35jTMglevg.text: Tried this place for the first time tonight -- I am IMPRESSED!  The chef is a veteran of places like Taco Guild and Z'Tejas (back when it was good!) and now has his own place. My dinner companion had the mushroom enchiladas and they were amazing. I'll order them next time if there is some reason I don't order the entree I enjoyed beyond measure tonight...the Chicken Artichoke Mushroom Stack.  Wow!    We had the guacamole and chips, which is made fresh to order. It's outstanding! It also came with a delicious house salsa that had heat, flavor and excellent balance.   The mixed veggies that came with my entree purportedly came with broccoli (I detest it) and our server promised me a broccoli-free side serving. The veggies were fantastic but very salty. The only reason I didn't give this locally-owned gem all five stars was the fact that I found the meal to be heavily salted. The chef has a great pedigree and superb sense of food pairing, accompaniments and the chemistry it takes to make an exceptional meal. The flavors are outstanding...go lighter on the salt and let the other ingredients shine through.   Overall, very happy to discover this gem! Please check it out! I'll be back!

30wNhVhfdjCfqg3YUoPW8g.text: You have to try the elote!  The food and service is great. Shows south side is up and coming.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zeTrGQ4E5Ag7rDngwxe80Q.text: The food and service is great. Very friendly staff and the owner who is the cook as well is very connected to his clients. Will come out to the table and ask you how is the food. Definitely recommend it!

Rxb0KN3X5vIKZ3OH2TybnA.text: I found this place here on Yelp when I was in Phoenix. If I lived in Phoenix I would be here at least once a week. The food was so good, plus I was driving so I couldn't sample the Tequilas, which looked enticing. I had the enchaladas, one beef and one pork, and the guacamole with serrano peppers. The flavors were amazing. I was so full but I didnt want to give it up. Next time I'm in Phoenix I'll have to come back.

5xkjIv7p9tncWdi4ubXj6Q.text: What a find!  We are in town from Boston to see some baseball spring training games and I was determined to find some good Mexican food. Mission accomplished: fresh ingredients, great recipes and Leo the owner greets every table. We got food philosophy from Leo with lunch along with info about recipes. Service was from Senorita D. She could not have been more pleasant and sweet. Mix and match enchiladas or tacos. We may go back for dinner tomorrow!

t_-DJphZaqlIZtymBIKY7g.text: This place was fantastic. We started with the fresh made guacamole with jalapeno bacon. Amazing! And for entrees the barbacoa green chili enchiladas, chicken enchiladas and wild mushroom enchiladas. Everything definitely lived up to the hype! Especially the mushroom enchiladas. Leo and Jason both visited our table at various times and I think its great that they welcome feedback and are local to the area. Can't wait to go back!! Definitely try this place if you haven't, you wont regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbacoa green chili enchiladas
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken enchiladas
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole with jalapeño bacon

fG2lKFtLWX5-53Gx-hHpPw.text: First time here and definitely coming back. Had the 3 taco plate with shrimp, steak and chicken and they were ALL delicious! Guacamole was outstanding too.

s_5SDoZMsnkuvX5e-QaLeA.text: I have become a regular here now, normally stopping in at least once a week. You will not have a better taco and the grilled romaine is incredible as well. I also enjoy the chicken quesadilla, such great flavor in everything. You will become a regular as well, I guarantee it!

IdCCCu2rF4-LRdMlfR7WpQ.text: New restaurant with amazing food. I had the fish, shrimp and chicken tacos and they were amazing. Don't forget to ask for the habanero sauce if you like spice. Food came out quickly, customer service was on point. No complaints. Oh and the churros.. amazing.

m01BNuTXmwR1xuZi2RrvHw.text: Worthy of the 5 star rating that originally enticed us. Ordered chips & guacamole, chicken burrito, and a steak burrito. Chicken was juicy & flavorful, steak was tender & delicious. And that green chile on top was the cherry on top. Best green chile I've ever had. Arguably the freshest tasting burritos as well. Elote was accidentally brought to our table, but we were too stuffed to taste it. Smelled amazing though. Thank you Madrigal! We will be back when we are in Arizona next.

OwPzIlx-baedFnX-5H1Urg.text: Great little place. Food was really delicious and prepared with care. The chef was humble and seems interested in our feedback. The guacamole was wonderful! Really fresh. Service was solid, if a little intrusive, but they're just gettin started dmd wanted lots of comments on the food.

CF2EgNY-1lgYSy8QuSY1pg.text: Loved the place! Met the owner\chef (Leo, I think), he delivered the food to our table. Talked to him after dinner and was very concerned about our satisfaction. Eduardo (I think) and Jasmin waited on us, both were wonderful. Had some triple appetizer thing that was great, I am not a guacamole fan, but theirs was great and made to order. Enchiladas for dinner were great.

r0MaWzUpRNPCzR-www7upw.text: Found this place on Yelp and it didn't disappoint.  The food is great and people are super friendly.   I was greeted with two huge smiles when I came in.  I sat at the bar and Jason behind the bar was super friendly.  Made eating alone much nicer.  If you are in the area and want great Mexican food and great people come check this place out!

VdcLcZkOImNZDYOoQKaxoQ.text: Stopped here with the sisters.  Easy to miss as you drive by, but driving by would be your loss. Barbie was our server, and she was extraordinary.  I had the mushroom enchilada and a delicious burrito with hatch pepper sauce.  One sis had the 3 taco special, and Barbie kindly let her mix-up the 3 tacos (instead of having 3 tacos of the same flavor).  She raved about the al pastor AND the chicken tacos.  I almost.forgot to mention the outstanding guacamole and habanero sauce for the tortilla chips.  I will definitely return here.  The service, selection, flavors, and atmosphere were absolutely top notch.

baawJ8IfmAYdj3dgbUM3Ug.text: You CANNOT come to Phoenix and not try this place! Triple D needs to highlight this one. If you took the feel of the bar from cheers where everybody knows your name (cuz once you try it, you keep coming back), but with Mexican food that is so creatively prepared it's like art for your taste buds, you'll get a glimpse of what you'll experience here!!!

olcwQTydrCiGumlV0KA9fQ.text: I love this new restaurant! Scratch made kitchen!!!! Service was great thank you Erin and Emily!!! We will be back

tPBWr0E04vi9ahi5h1nmFQ.text: I would like to give more than 5 stars to this amazing restaurant, the food tastes really good and it's authentic Mexican flavor, the service it's excellent and very attentive all the time, the owner was so kind to me, I absolutely recommend this place, it's going to be one of favorite Mexican restaurants I'm going to come so often I miss the corn already it's so yummy =) and the tacos are amazing they don't need nothing else or put nothing extra on it and the tortillas are homemade, you can't be wrong to choose this place, I'll be back real soon. Congratulations you are doing very good, don't change nothing please :)

zrcZLu8bFJ11Hsa2oyUojQ.text: Totally amazing food and fabulous service. Must order the guacamole, margaritas and coconut cream pie. The tacos were fabulous too, unlike anything we've had before

QXcIlO9UHL95h1CRISMTlw.text: This place was fantastic! We had such a great experience. Our waiter Eduardo was extremely helpful in offering wonderful recommendations. We started with the trio appetizer and it came out incredibly quick even though they were busy. The wild mushroom and barbacoa enchiladas were absolutely delicious. My wife got three different tacos all on hand made corn tortillas and loved them all. We made sure to save some room for the churros which were also terrific. The owner/chef even took time to come out and thank each table for coming out and enjoying his food. I would definitely suggest this place to anyone that wants some delicious food in a great casual setting with fast and friendly service.

YO5sleN1BJX6uFjGvnYhKA.text: Consistently great fresh good. This is another small place, small menu but always good food. Every time I have been ( with friends or spouse) the owner is always there, always comes out after to ask how things are and just chat for a few moments. Great margaritas, must get the frozen ones ( the waitress said they mix the batch and put it in the slushy machine so it actually has more alcohol).

woR6sZ5NELyihe8CQNiN0g.text: Stopped in after hiking South Mountain. By far one of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to. They're homemade corn tortillas and the taco selection was so fresh and delicious. Not to mention some of the best customer service I've ever experienced. Great spot would recommend to anyone in the area looking for a refreshing meal

ln4SVa8jUKoieOpcleEdIQ.text: Landed at PHX hungry. Found this gem not too far away. Delicious!!! I'll be back when I'm in PHX!

G_NGckBJiHTWvhAbO9n5Xw.text: Yes. Yes. And yes. To all of it.   Had the chips and salsa, enchiladas, and tacos. Literally couldn't stop ordering because it was all so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

w8jPg8VLh18rVp-CgLpZRQ.text: One of the best restaurants I've ever been to.  Leo the Chef, came out to chat with everyone and was absolutely wonderful!  He was such a sweetheart and I could tell he loves what he does.  The food tasted of his passion and love. I was blown away with how delicious the food was.  More importantly, Leo takes the time to put love and finesse into the little things; such as the rice, beans, pico and homemade tortillas.  The beef tenderloin tacos with Gorgonzola crumbles and fried peppers I will taste for the rest of my life, when I reflect on this moment.  The mushroom enchiladas were so flavorful and filling!  I love this restaurant and how I felt right at home.  I will definitely stop here again before I head home.  Wish I could take Leo home to Boston!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rxF7D8FYsaMk-jGghGhPmw.text: Highest stars possible! Not super impressive on the outside, but the atmosphere, service, and food make up for the lackluster exterior.   Service: friendly and the server was excited to discuss the food. He offer many great recommendations. The chef himself came out to make sure everything was to our liking.   Margaritas: the only criticism is that they don't have a flight option for all the flavors (or a nap pod to stay all day to try them all). I tried the original and others tried the limoncello, mango, and raspberry. They were all amazing.   Food: unique, creative, heartwarming. Can we extend our stay to try the whole menu?   Go here with an empty stomach and leave happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I4UMUw_5zZCrWGsFHtlFzQ.text: Took my hunny here for Father's Day with our kiddos. The staff was so friendly and welcoming. The food was delicious and left us full but wanting more. We can't wait to go back!

MDwAPUQ_xiCeKM3yWQs8Rg.text: I am speechless after going here.  But so pleased.  I just can't believe that we mortals here in Phoenix are starting to get Mexican restaurants that aren't just clones of Garcia's/Macayo's/Cantina Laredo.  Instead, we are getting graced by these excellent authentic thoughtful restaurants run by chefs who really know what Mexican food is (and it ain't a flour tortilla).  Thank God!  Mankind is finally moving forward!

ELWcJjX6SHzwVbNVVsRbEQ.text: Loved this place, they make the best prickly pear margaritas. My husband had the mushroom enchilada and it was delicious. I had three of their tacos, chicken, pork and beef and they were fabulous. This place looks like someone's house but don't let the outside fool you the food is very good.

r7pPfhXtGAIq0gn4eCAPMQ.text: I tell my friends to go to this hidden gem because it's so tasty while being simple. Bobby Flay style...meats seasoned just perfect, best tacos I ever had..and the chirro...nobody can beat it. Go and enjoy!

fiT7knMNyRTv8LPu-_dNiw.text: This place was ATM (a toda madre). It's a small hidden spot but totally worth the find. First time out in Arizona and it was finger licking good! The birria is like a home made. Type of tia made it at home. The environment is chill and so down to earth. When I come back to AZ. Definitely stopping by again ! Thank you guys!

ZR-QErdlSFIOj_ziaHawEg.text: Bomb, Amazing, Authentic! This place has the best food in town! Get the guacamole with bacon and jalapenos which is super fresh, the corn melts in your mouth, and the tacos are super delish! And the drinks are so smooth that you just want to spend all afternoon here. But most importantly is the atmosphere and the customer service is top notch! The owner and the waiter were super friendly and talkative with us and to top it off the chef personally came & spoke with us. He was so kind, informative and just a pleasure to talk to! Best customer service ever!   Check this place out it's the best taste of Mexico right in your own backyard!!!

MCMYvbhx6fOk2URS-9nQwA.text: I saw this place on Yelp that had a 5 star rating. I had to go. Friendly staff, good service and just ok food. Food had very good presentation. It did not wow me with taste though. I guess I wanted authentic Mexican food not hooped up gringo food. Place is a nice neighborhood restaurant. Menu is limited and pricey. My Mexican friends would not like this place. Too Americanized. Stick to basics and authenticity. Simplicity works.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Made to order guacamole
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips n salsa
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rice, beans, tenderloin taco and 2 al pastor

qY09rvxMt9hTStRCAUJuJw.text: Okay, I wanted to go to Los Dos Malinos last night- our BFF's just moved to S Mt.  they insisted.  UPON entry, we were impressed with the service. I didn't love the chips and salsa, service was amazing, the margaritas (and odd beer I selected) were amazing! The tocos are gypsy made..  I don't know how they make them that good! Meal : - normally I barley like El Pastor- THESE WERE Heaven sent- I want more!! - the Steak Tacos: tasted like the steak you expect at the best steak house in Kansas City. Flavor, spice!!

x0Ouyai_D7M7ekeKynh_Hw.text: The initial plan was to have BBQ but ended at this hidden gem. It can be hard to spot. It is located behind Circle K, private parking lot, and outside patio seating area.   The owner and entire staff were incredibly friendly. It was highly recommended by the staff to try the Guac De Casa. One of the best and most authentic I had in a long time. It was so fresh, the huge chunk of guac, and truly homemade. I can lick the bowl.   I had a sip of my friend's Michelada. It was absolutely refreshing, savory, citrusy, and a little kick to it. My friends tried the Five Cheese Macaroni & Chicken, Hatch Green Chile Pork with tortillas, and grilled Elote with cotija cheese. I tried the Chicken, Artichoke & Mushroom Stack. I loved when a char-grilled chicken is slightly burnt. The creamy sauce and flavor will stimulate your taste buds.   Cocina Madrigal will take you away as if you're enjoying a meal South of the Border, not South Phoenix. I can't wait to return for Happy Hour.

0JaXjMa5qtFW6C8oneWjmQ.text: Get the steak taco.  Like more than one.  Best taco i ve ever had.  Will def come back here next time I'm in town!

lo-NxxGUUQQEgkMWg4SVqA.text: Decided to do something very different for Fathers Day. We made reservations through yelp and used the additional comments to advise how many in our party since max people were less than our group. When we arrived I was surprised they actually read the notes. This typically doesn't happen so off to a great start. We were seated right away, ordered drinks and appetizers. Margaritas were very good but on the small size and a little overpriced. Guacamole and salsa were very good. The staff was extremely polite and attentive even on this day. The restaurant was so warm that it became an issue during our meal. Diana our waitress was awesome!  We enjoyed the Charred Romaine salad and shared with our table which was amazing! La Diabla Chicken was my dish and other than the noodles needing to be more al dente it was absolutely delicious. The flavor just fantastic, definitely would order again. Filet was on the list which I was told was very good. Our table had veggie, shrimp, steak, fish tacos as well as my niece had a turkey burger. Needless to say there were no complaints other than the temperature of the restaurant. Hands down this is a place that I will be going back. Thanks for an enjoyable Father's Day lunch!

b20rlQBXTqW1F011sUvIBg.text: You HAVE to eat here! The Oaxaca Fundido is to die for if you're a mushroom fan. Everything is FRESH FRESH FRESH, tortillas, cocktails, etc. Worth the drive if you live a bit further north.

scy077yT5AcQ6mvafBnazA.text: Yelp didn't lie. We were in Phoenix for a ballgame and looked for the highest-rated Mexican place in town, which led us here. The guacamole and elote were fresh and delicious, and the various burritos and tacos we ordered were all filled with meats that were well-seasoned and tender. I'll specifically call out the al pastor taco with pineapple and bacon as excellent. We finished with a double order of churros, which were warm and delicious.  It's not a fancy place, and doesn't look like much from the outside, but the food delivered.

tNjE1yoCaqLpWNi_0fQkfg.text: Such a delicious, fresh Mexican Restaurant. In Phoenix, AZ, close to the airport.  The steak tacos have deliciously tender meat, and lightly battered deep fried onions.  The enchiladas had wild mushrooms (their biggest seller). And the mushrooms, with their creamy sauce, really pop, inside this enchilada.  The queso fundido had a flavorful, but not overpowering chorizo.  But I came to the restaurant for the churros...omfg. Hands down best I have ever had. Better than Spain, Mexico, Cali.... And the drink pairing... Negro Modelo.  Everyone was really nice, and the service...perfect.  Compliments to chef Madrigal

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom enchiladas
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best churros...omfg
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Queso fundido

IhZ_Rpa6K5026kUK0BHPWg.text: Very good food, we had chips and salsa (the chips were warm!), mushroom enchilada, and steak tacos. All the food was good the only thing I didn't love was the meat in the tacos which was chewy. Margarita was excellent and the service was very attentive. All in all solid choice

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom enchillada

3N2TiaZ4d414sn9SWOWifw.text: So so so good. The food is fresh  and the margaritas strong! A perfect spot for any occasion. I've driven past many times and never noticed. So glad I finally stopped in.

dgXEonVuecf4CZQHi_LFYg.text: Chicken enchiladas and Barbacoa enchiladas were really good! Barbacoa ones were a little more spicy and chicken ones were delicious too! Server was very attentive. Would recommend.

a9gxdynkskX3PLIEbA-GgA.text: Amazing service, amazing food and very much worth the drive! Loved the details given and options and my food! I had the wild mushroom enchiladas!We also enjoyed having chef visit our table to ask about us and food! Super nice guy and enjoys what he does! Pretty full also for a Saturday holiday weekend night in Phoenix!

zi7KDsGwb4A1qAoeAcBzLA.text: Our first time seeking Mexican food in Phoenix and we were not disappointed. We were sceptical at first because the location is a little off the beaten path, but wow! Best authentic Mexican. Homemade tortillas. The el pastor taco was a flavor explosion. Fast, friendly staff. A great find. We will be back.

TBq57Cdh44kB1xB4DKZyMw.text: Superb in taste, by far the best I've had for Mexican food. A bit different from the close to border food. They're definitely conscious of healthier cuisine. My pallet is very particular and this exceeds my expectations.

dxmELfIJ74nu2BBn0gS4mw.text: Okay, this place is bomb. We tried an assortment of things, all were just as delish! Particularly loved the enchiladas. Tacos were sharing size. Rice and beans were super flavorful and NOT salty. (Why do most Mexican restaurants over salt EVERYTHING?!) Guac was probably the best we've had at a restaurant. Fresh and thick. We also tried the chipotle chocolate pecan pie! YUM. Looking forward to coming again!

tkMMmQgrpQGjUYKDLVrCcA.text: Looking for a local Mexican dinner near our hotel by the airport, we pulled up to this stand-alone restaurant in a nearby quiet neighborhood. As we entered the door, we didn't expect much out of this local joint as the dining room was fairly plain and small while half the section was dedicated to the bar area. We were seated by the noisy bar at a small table. After we got our margaritas, we saw some tables in the quieter dining section open up so we asked the hostess to move us. Both the hostess and the waitress were very friendly and accommodating as we resituated ourselves by the window. This was when our delightful experience began. Starting with the best Tortilla Soup we ever had, the home-made flavors consisting of avacado chunks and shredded pork were incredible. The soup's  consistency was just right - not too thick and not too watery while maintaining all the right blend of spices. We quickly cleaned our bowl before we moved on to another delectable shared entree of Al Pastor Tacos. There were three different flavored meats in the home-made soft shell tacos and they were all very tasty. After the pleasure of last taco bite, we decided to end our meal with the order of Churros that we saw on the menu. It turned out to be a surprisingly enjoyable dessert.  We had many Churros in various places before but none was as delicious as these home-made Churros. We had a hard time controlling ourselves as our taste buds were bouncing around inside our mouth with delights. The Churros were crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The dish came with the almond colored dipping sauce that further heightened the flavors. Even though this was our last night in Phoenix, we were wishing that we could come back one more time just to eat these Churros again. As the nice waitress gave us our check, she mentioned that we had to try their amazing home-made Coconut Cake. That was when we had to pinch ourselves to abstain from further indulgence and painfully dragged our feet out the door before we became the slaves of this wonderful culinary find.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mouth watering Churros. A Must!
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quiet side of dining room
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious Tortilla Soup

or99Bl8PKFjqh2BWrFFRGg.text: Believe the hype. If you haven't been here yet, come now. Go hike South Mountain and head here after.  Wonderful food, staff, and margaritas. I've been twice and gotten the mushroom enchiladas both times because they are that good. The chicken tortilla soup is great, as are the beef enchiladas (sort of a smoky flavor). Also, I'm generally not a fan of frozen margaritas but holy shnike these are good and STRONG.  The staff and owner are so kind, attentive, and genuine. The owner came out just to thank us for spending a rainy New Years' Eve day at his restaurant.   Only bad thing is that they have ruined guacamole for me in the valley--no one else's comes close to as good!

Xg0zdE8RDj10uRKKbuR2ww.text: Was visiting the Phoenix area and was looking forward to highly rated Mexican cuisine. I made a Yelp reservation for Cocina Madrigal because I saw the excellent rating and the strong reviews. I was definitely not disappointed! Upon arriving the table was already ready and waiting for my party. Our server was extremely attentive and helpful and knew the menu and gave helpful and enlightening answers. The guacamole starter in particular is very good and obviously fresh and the Oaxaca fundido (cheese cooked in skillet with mushrooms and jalapenos served with tortillas) was abfab as well. We had ordered different types of enchiladas as well as tacos and the make-your-own burrito. The mushroom enchiladas was a def standout and, I would have to say, one of the best mex dishes I have tried. The green chile Barbacoa enchilada was great too. Ordered a strawberry margarita and it was decently strong. I had put 3 Mexican restaurants in my Yelp list and of the other two, one was closed for the day and the other permanently closed. I think we got lucky that this establishment was open as I would definitely go again!

tqXj4fN4wvUk4GWc4UxJGQ.text: Off the ordinary path but a very nice surprise. We enjoyed everything we had and the restaurant has a nice cozy vibe. Some similarities to Taco Guild in regards to food, which is a good thing.  Specifically the corn appetizer and the chips, guacamole and salsa.  Primarily green vs red sauce dishes. I usually go red unless we are talking about Rito's. Based on the location close to my work and high quality of food this place will become a regular stop for me.

SOhJSmGFpxslkP-TFzagNA.text: Food was great. It's not quite my style though, things got a little too creative in my opinion. The burrito had a sweet taste to it, I guess I'm more used to the bean & cheese sonoran style Mexican food.   The fundido with sausage and mushrooms was amazing, get that for sure when you come here.  The service was fast and very friendly. I had fun here.

QgUrJQoIcGNvZdC3sxvvIA.text: Wonderful place. Found this place through yelp & was not disappointed. It truly deserves the high ratings. The food was delicious & the staff were very friendly. Great Customer service. I will be coming again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One Taco Al pastor &amp; 2 steak tacos

IoCXAHCoa1-mFlJVj_DXrQ.text: Truly spectacular experience for Oaxacan style mexican food.  This place is truly special.  Each and every staff member we interacted with was warm, friendly, accommodating, and truly grateful that we chose to dine with them.  The chef came to our table just before dessert and gave us a genuine heartfelt thank you.  Was so impressed.    The location is relatively unassuming from the outside and considering the neighborhood a much more upscale ambience inside than I was anticipating.  The food was absolutely amazing.  Started with the trio which is chips and salsa, guacamole, and queso fundido.  The queso, to my surprise, contained caramelized onions, perfectly sauteed mushrooms, longaniza sausage, roasted jalapenos, and epazote herb.  A True flavor explosion!  I followed that up with one wild mushroom and one barbacoa enchilada.  They make their own corn tortillas and they are just as good or slightly superior to Cocina Presidio Mexicana.  I cannot wait to go back and try the tacos.  My friends both ordered the 3 taco combination with al pastor, barbacoa, and steak.  They were both extremely impressed and we all were in agreement that this will become a regular Mexican standby.

fBzI-2r-3TDZiAu80AurGw.text: Amazing food with a very mom and pop authentic feel to the atmosphere and location. The bartender served us and he was extremely knowledgeable about the food and really spent time with us exploring the menu. I can't wait to go back very impressed by the food it's elevated but still has that authentic homey/traditional Mexican food style we all know and love.

YdI6w84loh1ozM2k7jvl6g.text: Absolutely superb food! We stopped here on our way from Tucson to Prescott AND RETURNED PRIOR TO OUR FLIGHT OUT! Do not miss this place. When the owner is the chef everything has to be perfect! Chef Leo Madrigal is a gracious person who personally greets each customer. Best food ever!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

v8Ml7pkMbBhfGS3vGbEppQ.text: Within 30 minutes of landing in AZ we found this amazing hole in the wall. Eduardo provided excellent customer service with great recommendations. Everything was delicious. Simply amazing. The habanero hot sauce was mouth watering. The home made guacamole, the best. The mushroom enchilada, was devoured. You can't go wrong. We will definitely pass by before we go back home! Highly recommend this spot! You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious Mango Margarita.

CAK3pNiXEVbbJC8ewAV19w.text: Really great! It was a super convenient location since we were on our way to the airport back home. Food was delicious and one of the best margaritas I've ever had. I'm from Texas and I wish I had something like this close to home! Staff was friendly and we were well taken care of!

ruALlLZJtKG1ehTXf-c5JA.text: We had a wonderful dinner an anxious to return to try other dishes. The drinks were delicious. The mango margarita is the best.
