yPNQWCXwDGWYSBSvxKRTBQ.text: If you like plastic people and plastic food, this is NOT for you. If you prefer a friendly place with a team that has a passion for great and creative food...dont delay. We over-ordered, but could not decide.  Guacamole with bacon and jalapeno...Brilliant.  Beef Birria and Barbacoa enchiladas were the best enchiladas we have ever had.  The wild mushroom enchiladas are rich without being too heavy. If you like mushrooms, you will love them! The ingredients are clearly fresh, and the flavor profiles complex without being overwhelming. Even the chips &salsa were top notch.  No jug'o salsa and stale chips from a warming drawer here! The frozen margaritas were heads and shoulders above any we have tasted. We will be regulars and are thrilled to see Leo's talent come to the community through Cocina Madrigal!

8aOm71Lc8q_xpAmukteyTw.text: Holy cow! This place was exceptional!! We had the tacos (chicken, shrimp, and steak) as well as a steak and shrimp burrito. I would eat there every day if I could!

n6uG91gAd5VfKeC_kPZi6g.text: Lovely place with delicious food.  But if you are a dad trying to change a diaper don't count on a changing table! Hope they add it to the men's bathroom asap.

pf_aYmlY85i-2Uzu4nnRfA.text: Great fresh and tasty food!!  Staff is amazing and very friendly!!  The chef came out and personally thanked every table for coming.  I will definitely tell all my friends about this gem of a place!!  Yummm!!

Uk7YU71JK3uICWjGEMXBCA.text: Wow we were blown away with how fantastic our visit was top to bottom. We were greeted like we were family and they could not have been nicer. Our waiter made a few suggestions that were home runs and he was attentive. This is really not a typical Mexican food restaurant, the thought behind these unique dishes was obviously well planned and the food was amazing. Although we live along the 7th St.,corridor where there are tons of new restaurants, we will happily drive to 16th St. and Broadway for a repeat performance. Can't say enough about the food and the experience- can't wait to go back!

aVINBz8-DFMmbgihvP9bkw.text: Food was excellent. Service was fantastic. Went for the first time tonight and will be back.

TflrqeDIeKXXopr3nFJL8w.text: I am in love with this hidden jewel in the South Phoenix area. I got to say this place has the best customer service. They are very friendly and attentive to their customers. I loved their Trio appetizer. Food OMG it is paradise in your mouth. Any one who is willing to try out some good food please come out and try Cocina Madrigal.

5hxPT7LtB8qIZZ2PfmfKdQ.text: This was our first visit to this restaurant. We were greeted immediately on arrival. This was the best Mexican food we have tasted. Everything made fresh. The chef told us all about himself and his passion for great food was obvious. We only wish he would expand his menu for a little more variety because we will return often. Thanks to our friends Julie and Doug for this great recomendation . You were spot on .

e2yYzU0X57hzBin89GWDCg.text: I wanted to add another positive experience at Madrigal...  I went with my brother on the way back from Sky Harbor. I had read some good reviews from neighbors... so needed to try it for myself. I was very pleased with our meal, the service, and atmosphere of the restaurant. I love margaritas frozen from the machine, the guacamole appetizer was delicious... our entree and the folks around us entree we're all very nice, chef presentation, ingredients freash & flavorful. We'll definitely go back. Thumbs up!!

YYAsAyfW49SY4vT9NONhag.text: Excellent service and the food was great. I had the wild mushroom enchiladas.  Overall, I was very impressed.

cEAe33kifAQKMjDKYpSogw.text: Amazing! Looked for a place close to the airport and went here because of the good reviews. Great service, great food, and great music.

Ukv49ELwrRGbRiAYpB2Tww.text: I gave Cocina Madrigal a try after all the great reviews and looking for something different and flavorful,  we order the Guacamole and it was a good blend of flavors freshly prepared, however the corn chips lacked flavor and just seemed like they were not freshly cooked we also order the Oaxaca queso, this is were it started to go down, I asked the waitress what was epazote and she told me it was some kind of sausage, so I looked it up and turn out to be some kind of herb ! Once again the flavor was amazingly good a little too spicy for my taste but very tasty  however was accompanied with corn tortillas and once again not homemade, we ordered the mushroom enchiladas,  a combination of flavors that made them very tasty and the trio tacos fish, chicken and pastor, I couldn't eat the chicken because the achiote flavor was not a good marriage with the chicken, the pastor was very good as well as the fish once again too spicy for my taste but flavors were amazingly good.  My only recommendation is to make sure the staff can explain and understand the food, Is embarrassing to ask for descriptions and be told I don't know or I don't like it!

DNxNAHC-hc8n7weRsaB4gg.text: Quaint little spot big on flavors. The decor is rustic and homey. The staff are attentive and friendly.  The homemade guacamole delicious and fresh. Could not stop eating it.  The enchiladas were moist flavorful and had just the right amount of spice. The menu offered vegetarians a nice selection that was just as flavorful.   The churros were hot, crisp and filled with a rich cream that wasn't to sweet just the right consistency. The  overall experience wonderful.  Food great. Chef personally came to table, just exceptional. This can definitely be a weekly place

4YrwH5cCQYyHlIEQn6nijw.text: This place was amazing! Just happened to find it randomly and I was impressed. Super good tacos and great salsa. The atmosphere is great, the people were fun, but the food was the best part.

du9_wV4ncUavRof4WH4vFg.text: I had the Guacamole and chips and the tropical fish tacos. Both were amazing! I'm coming back!

uywXm8lqS1cpWWdvQnHhjA.text: Muy, muy bueno.  Senor Madrigal mixes with the customers and provides personal service. Very personable.

clzkJXx9X1QBvzIwLUjWEQ.text: Absolutely wonderful food and owned by great people! Had the tacos and enchiladas, all of the different meats were great. The homemade churros were also a perfect way to end the meal. Quaint bar/restaurant with delicious authentic food. Definitely will be back and highly recommend!

DEj3Wg2pj4D95kDAGAu3ew.text: Unbelievable local gem. My new favorite spot for south of the border food with great service and a funky atmosphere. Awesome food

jll-y7eeXxQU0FoMQgB6ow.text: We were visiting from California and stumbled across this gem. As huge lovers of good Mexican food and good margaritas, Cocina Madrigal blew our minds! Top notch! Wish we lived closer now!

2cBmzoKtMMhHblaVKyLucA.text: Great service, nice staff, owner and manager introduced themselves. Food was so flavorful, I'd recommend the steak or chicken... the pork was too spicy and not shredded. Oh and don't forget the margaritas!!! It's about time the south side gets some real authentic Mexican food. Close to the airport and downtown, just a really nice experience.

0FDmp58RuqgO8WIdgvr20g.text: We were in Phoenix for an overlay and didn't know where to eat in our immediate vicinity.  We saw the reviews for and decided to eat here. Truly,  we were blown away. The entire staff could not have been friendlier or more acomadating.  The guacamole was the Best we have ever had and everything we ordered was fresh and delicious. I joked that I would like to move to Phoenix so I could eat here all the time. If you are in Phoenix,  definitely eat here. You will NOT be disappointed.

M7LOszwDMOcZ8dgajwaqRQ.text: I ate fish, chicken and al pastor tacos, they were delicious!  Corn tortillas were so soft and fresh.  Wait staff very nice.  Wish I could have tried coconut cream pie dessert!

PLvJyjOh5DePQa1POjsKbA.text: This place was absolutely amazing! Everything here was delicious and very flavorful! The staff took great care of us and we even enjoyed a few laughs together. Thank you guys for a great dinner!

JFs-HdTP-50lhvHOwqG7nw.text: We found this restaraunt from Yelp and we were very pleased with the quality of the food and the customer service. We were in town visiting family and will definitely come back when we are in town. Service was great! The chef and his son came out and greeted us. They were both very attentive and friendly! We each had a different menu item and all of our food was delicious! I would highly recommend this place! This is one of our favorite places to eat when we are in AZ.

nPVf_7kwubBLXnO2aEc13Q.text: Great place--delicious food and the staff and chef were very welcoming.  The chef was very generous to accomodate my request for fish enchiladas, because I was craving enchiladas but didn't want a veggie enchilada (I don't eat meat).  The music was nice too.  Will definitely be back.

UtKK_havL6YoiFeQuBHuPQ.text: Finally a good restaurant in South Phoenix!  This place is awesome and I we need many more in the fast growing area.  The area is completely changed down be Baseline Road close to the mountain and people want these type of good restaurants.  Great job Cocina Madrigal!!

N7wbINnJtDXJ5q-XTnt3CQ.text: Great place for quality food, super service and wonderful drinks. Love the neighborhood feel, chef/owner involved interaction with guests. Highly recommend the fish tacos, sangria, wild mushroom/chicken entree and margaritas. Authentic Oaxacan fare....fresh everything! Will be back soon!

zDh-Rgtr34XhlpylErnnsA.text: New place in south Phoenix serving some of the most authentic Mexican food I have had North of the border in years. Such an awesome Chef with a great cast of supporting staff. Birria enchilada were to die for sat in the car and thought about ordering more for the ride back to Cave Creek. Churros are often an afterthought but here they were killer both in taste and presentation! Ice cold draft beers and I can see myself easily driving 70 plus miles round trip for a north of the border experience with south of the border flair! Thank you and we will see you again soon.

-ujiRiFB-NUzk1R3_WVT4Q.text: Absolutely my new favorite Phoenix dining choice.  Small, chef owned restaurant serving fresh, flavor packed food.  The Trio appetizer is a great starter with Fundido, Guacamole and salsa with chips.  The beef birria and the barbacoa green chili enchilada were so good I wanted to lick the plate.  The chef/owner came to check on our meal and spent several minutes chatting.  If you are even remotely close to Phoenix stop in for a great meal.  You won't regret it.

Tes8BmWQ3sLX-5-33iM1dg.text: Stop what you're doing and go eat at Cocina Madigral! We went for dinner tonight after rave reviews from neighbors and it was a fantastic dinner. We started with chips and salsa and Chef Madigral brought housemade guac to our table. All of it was fresh and delicious. I ordered 2 al pastor and 1 steak taco. Both had creative ingredients and meat that was perfectly cooked. My husband and in-laws each got burritos. My husband saw barbacoa enchilada and asked if his burrito could have barbacoa (which wasn't a listed option) and they made it happen. My in-laws split a steak burrito and even with two people they couldn't finish. Just since we were trying out a new place we also ordered a dessert to share between all of us. We got an amazing churro dessert with a sweet cream and caramel dipping sauce and it was heaven!  Don't go here expecting a typical run-of-the-mill Mexican restaurant. But, do go here if you want delicious, inventive food with awesome portions at a great price. So happy to have this in the neighborhood! The staff was also amazing which isn't easy to find these days- they were knowledgeable, friendly, and enthusiastic. Hats off to the team at Cocina Madrigal!

F89V9QWQfjotBuoz8uQUPg.text: Unbelievable mexican food and very friendly staff. Guacamole with pineapple was delicious, salsa was just the right amount of spicy, and the tacos were delicious!

efOoVIMSKpnpFqyk61dH3w.text: Wow. What an amazing new restaurant! The service was fantastic and very attentive. The interior is so beautiful and clean. Very warm and welcoming. Now the food. The star of the show. Being a new restaurant we had to try a few things. We started with chips, salsa, and housemade guacamole. The salsa was spiced perfectly, just hot enough to feel it and making crave more. The guacamole tastes so fresh and the avocado's they used were ripened to perfection. The chips were freshly fried, warm thin corn chips that were enjoyable on their one. For entrees we decided to share so we could try even more. Beef tenderloin tacos, El Diablo chicken pasta and the three mushroom enchilada in a mole sauce. I don't even know how to describe the tacos. The seasoning, the chipotle pomegranate marinade, the sauce and fried peppers! FRIED PEPPERS! The texture combination in this alone makes it better than almost everyone else tacos, but then add beef tenderloin, so tender it melts in your mouth. The sauce and gorganzola crumbles add layers of flavor that really plays off the palette. And it was all on homemade tortillas! The Diablo pasta was garnished with fresh jalapenos that added crunch and enough spicy to the already flavorful cream sauce. Our chicken was perfectly grilled, and the plating was jaw dropping. The mushroom enchiladas were wonderful too. Not covered or overstuffed with cheese, but stuffed with mushrooms! The mole sauce was sweet but not like overbearing. It matched heat of the dish nicely. Rice was super fluffy and cooked jusy right and the beans aren't normal Mexican restaurant pinto beans. These were slow cooked, delicious beans that could have been a dish all on its own. Definitely be back and it more than worth a drive for those tacos. Mind blowing.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9uzaRcDS3-w3JzXQLOUKdg.text: Let me preface this review by saying I have been using the Yelp app for years to help me locate good food joints throughout the country as I'm a frequent traveler. I have never felt the urge to leave a review, until now. I stumbled upon the gem as I arrived into past normal dinner hours. The previous reviews all spoke highly so I was motivated to try this place. First, don't be alarmed by the humble building. This place is about food not architecture. With that said, it's very clean. I ordered a chicken enchiladas and mushroom enchilada. In any restaurant the Chicken Enchilada would have been great. In this restaurant it was just "good" because I paired it with the Mushroom Enchilada which was fantastic! I was second guessing myself before ordering it because it had no meat. Don't let that deter you. The flavor is worth it and it was packed just as full as my chicken enchilada. The co-owner was very friendly. He took time to (actually) sit and discuss items on the menu. Once I had finished eating, he asked for comments, suggestions, etc. Absolutely no ego. The other co-owner is the chef and it's clear he has experience at high level restaurants. The food is too original, flavorful and perhaps intelligent for him not to have experience with putting together a menu. If you are looking for authentic flavors and quality food, you must try this place.

JK32lFvb0cLV4fPxHlUFbQ.text: What great food. The owner has such a great story. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

YHyBsGKqZU-6fQLMoQCmgQ.text: Food is delicious and fresh! I haven't stopped thinking about the guacamole!  Customer service was great! No complaints whatsoever and we will be back soon.

t6bZaKxNote4RVDGJLy6fw.text: Just finished my lunch here and I'm currently sitting in my car writing this review because I absolutely could not wait. Everything was superb from the service to the food and it's all thanks to the owner, Leo who only serves the highest quality food and personally picks all of the produce himself to ensure the highest level of satisfaction. In addition to the spectacular food and service, the bar serves crafted specialty cocktails that are both gorgeous and delicious, and don't even get me started on dessert. Thank you Leo and staff of Cocina Madrigal for a wonderful dinner. We will be back very soon.

YsDT61Rypv-FKiPIflfifw.text: WOW! We live in Ahwatukee and were returning home from Sky Harbor Airport during rush hour so we made a quick detour to Cocina Madrigal to "try-it-out" as we avoided traffic. Previous reviewers were 100% correct! Excellent staff, friendly casual atmosphere, and best of all high quality "authentic" mexican food (we lived in the interior of Mexico in Sinaloa, so we have some expertise). These guys are new and my guess is with "word-of-mouth" spreading there will soon be long lines waiting a seat; particularly during snowbird season.. The 14 mile trip from Ahwatukee will not be a deterrent ... we'll be back for sure. Gracias y Buena Suerte!

aCXYpZDcbGtYmTAgvjQn-A.text: What a wonderful Mexican restaurant we visited twice just to be sure it wasn't a fluke.  :) Every item was superbly done and very flavorful.  The 5 cheese macaroni tasted great and included Cajun chicken,  elbow macaroni and bacon.   Sounds weird tasted great.   All the other items the 3 of us tried were equally good,  and the frozen margaritas scrumptious.  Going back every time I am in Phoenix.

Ah-vqIuR45F7jkh5Rm7Vog.text: I have been to this restaurant three times now. The service and food is amazing. The atmosphere is great! Not what you  expect in these neck of the woods. Very favorable and modern authentic Latin food!!

wL2V9q5kLSJYHEYZEljdfQ.text: MY NEW FAVORITE!   I'm pretty critical of Mexican food.  But there's nothing not to like here! I was leaning toward the Hatch Green Chili Chicken Enchiladas, but when I found out I could mix and match the taco trio, I went for the Oaxaca Shrimp, achiote  Chicken and the Beef Tenderloin with crispy chili's.  Happy Happy!  And the side of beans and rice are no afterthought; great flavors!   We started with the guacamole which comes with a generous helping of chips and salsa and was delivered to the table by Chef Madrigal himself.  If you like an extra kick, ask him for the Habenero salsa.  Great heat AND great flavor.  What s great find!   I still need to try those hatch chili enchilada - guess I'll have to go back - GLADLY!

aoeP6YQm0BjAXXGRbMz9BA.text: Let me put into perspective just how fantastic Casa Madrigal is: we have eaten here twice in the past 27 hours! The staff is really friendly, personable and accommodating. My girlfriend loves Mexican food, but she absolutely detests onions. At nearly any other restaurant, that would pose as a problem. No worries here though.... owner/chef Leo was totally willing to alter his recipes to satisfy her "needs". Yesterday and today, we kicked it off with the Appetizer Trio. The Oaxaca Fundido is outstanding, and it was served still bubbling in the skillet. While the ultimate goal is to try EVERYTHING on the menu, we can't seem to deviate from the enchiladas. The Wild Mushroom Enchiladas are top-notch. We have tried them with both the mole sauce and the Hatch Green Chile sauce, and the judges are still out on which one was better. For dessert, the churros are a MUST. If you are anything like us, you will totally toggle with the idea of DRINKING the leftover creme anglaise once you eat the last one! Even though we just discovered Casa Madrigal, we have already told everyone we know about it, and we plan to bring all of our out-of-town visitors here too.

7DhZkLw-UGa4h5azwi5ZsA.text: The food was amazing!  I had the beef tenderloin tacos and they very filling and the presentation was great.  The atmosphere was great.  Not only was the service outstanding but even the owner and Chef spent time talking with us.  It's nice to finally have a 5 star  Mexican restaurant in South Phoenix!

YXevpni9fcAJ0WDXuIjgqg.text: Wow!  This is my first ever Yelp review and I use the app all the time.  I couldn't pass on rating this one because of the entire experience.  Not fancy and you might not drop in based on exterior appearances but once inside it felt great to be there from the moment we were seated.  Very friendly wait staff and our waitress Liz although new  was very knowledgeable about the menu and made spot on recommendations. The wild mushroom enchiladas had a unique and memorable flavor., really good!  The habanero hot sauce was not only appropriately spicy but actually had a good flavor unlike so many that just burn!   We also had the trio appetizer which was outstanding!   Leo Madrigal came out to greet us and thank us for coming and made sure we understood all of his food was prepared fresh and that was evident.   Don't forget the churros.... best I've ever had.  Will go back again this week because there are other items I need to experience.   Go and enjoy!

5jkJLGbfCaDW01ywCt8iew.text: My friend chose this place based on the Yelp reviews and this restaurant lives up to the 5 stars!!! This place is AMAZING!! I had the chicken tacos with corn tortillas. Their tortillas are fresh and made to order too! We also had their fresh guacamole and the best churros ever! Everyone on their staff is so friendly and personable! I cannot wait to go back! This will be my new taco Tuesday place!

3rrgFR89eOl-KHHOZAvWow.text: WOW! It took just over 2 years since we moved here from San Diego but we finally did it. Yep. We found the real deal Mexican food. I'm glad we live out in Verrado or we would be here twice a week.        I want you to imagine a three mushroom enchilada. With a sauce so velvety and the fresh made tortillas so soft it all just melts in your mouth. How about a barbacoa pork enchilada that is totally off the hook good. And all of these enchiladas have about 4 times as much stuffing as a normal average enchilada. And the sauces are simply divine. Not at all like what you are used to. This is the real deal. Gourmet Mexican food that you only get in really upscale restaurants in Mexico normally.      But let me tell you about the fresh made guacamole! Order it with the roasted Serranos. Talk about an explosion in your mouth. Ok maybe we will go back tomorrow. Chips and tortillas are made fresh. Why wait? Beat the rush. Go now.      Now for my one suggestion. I want my Margarita in a big fancy glass with two shots of good tequila. Priced accordingly. Their michalada's are excellent no matter what beer you select.

sahycNMS7JrVCE8DAhdG8g.text: I've never had better Mexican food in my life. I used yelp to find #1 in Phoenix while on Business from Pennsylvania and the reviews were spot on. Leo the chef even asked us how our food was and that has never happened to us before! It was so amazing I had to get food to go to fly back to Pennsylvania with it so my wife can get a taste. I'm coming back next week on vacation and this is our first stop!

pn9xO8xMBEtNQPg81kvGMQ.text: Let me preface with this. I'm not a big fan of sitting down to eat with a waiter. I don't like going to fancy restaurants and spending a lot of money. Honestly, I'm extremely cheap, I want a lot of food for as little money as possible. So this was NOT my decision. I had seen the place before but when I looked it up it was all 3 things I don't want... But my brother was adamant, said he'd pay, that I had to try it. He knows I'm big on Mexican food, I try most of the places in the city at least once when I'm hungry and nearby.   So when I tell you this was amazing, I'm not blowing smoke up their ass. I already showed you that I went into this place already skeptical. How could 3 tacos beans and rice come out to 12+ a plate? BECAUSE THEY'RE THAT FUCKING GOOD, THAT'S WHY! When you use premium ingredients, things are gonna cost more. There's nowhere else in the city that you're gonna get this much flavor and quality in general. To top that, those 3 tacos are pretty big and you get a decent side of beans and rice(quantity, the quality is amazing).  We had the al pastor, chicken, and Asada tacos. The last one normally comes with gorgonzola but I'm a traditionalist so I requested they use the Oaxaca cheese instead. Listen, the fact they even have Oaxaca cheese tells you they're legit. None of this cheddar shit or a mix of cheeses. That's the worst thing you can do to my Mexican food, use American cheeses, should be sacrilegious. I'm going off topic, let's get back on track. So the al pastor was really good, had a little sweetness with a lil spice. The chicken was moist and tender, the steak was amazing. All the other ingredients compliment the meats.  Finally, let's talk about the staff. We caught Eduardo at the end of his shift, was more than willing to stay late to take care of us. Matt had him the first time he went with his wife, raved about the service. Needless to say, he and the women working up front were all very professional yet gregarious. Eduardo was also fluent in Spanish, has a lot of charisma. Great guy, even gave us some chips and salsa(which were fantastic). Gotta take care of him or the ladies if you come in, they'll make you feel at home.  Oh yeah, let's talk about location. It's not the biggest parking lot but being full really shows the food is worth it. Outside its fairly unassuming but you get in and it has a little flair. Nice bar, nice decor, like 4 quality TVs playing sports. It's just a nice lil spot you wouldn't expect to be as cool/good as it is. I give other places 5s but that's more based on all around price quantity-quality all mixed together. This was 5s across the board. Truly stands out, prolly the best in the city(or close to it). It's a new restaurant so take your friends and family, they deserve all the business they can get...

zS_CVGuOo-qqILDbOue79w.text: Best tacos, burritos, and house margaritas I've had in my life. I went here for the first time only because I live two miles away and wanted some chips and salsa. I'm not even a big Mexican food fan because so many places have rice, beans, and food that tastes the same. This place has food with beautiful appearance, incredible taste, and top notch customer service. I've been here multiple times since my first recent visit; I now take clients and friends here regularly. The owner Leo frequently talks to the customers to thank them for their business, and all the employees answer any drink or food questions with ease. In the past I've been a only a burrito or fajita guy, and this place has resulted in me trying the tacos (incredible), churros (amazing), and appetizers (try all of them!). This place is a True diamond in the rough and easily one of the best restaurants in all of Arizona

VltfyqehRu3_YI2S3upjwg.text: Everything about Cocina Madrigal was absolutely lovely - the food was incredible, the drinks were delicious, and all the staff were friendly and fun. Chef Leo came out to ask how our meal was and when he found out it was my mom's birthday the next day he personally brought out a slice of chocolate pie and helped sing happy birthday. I will definitely be back here next time I'm in Phoenix!  edit: right after I posted this, my mom and her friend simultaneously said "YUM YUM YUM" after finishing the dessert

y2ReDeiFE9sF6lAvdC6xoQ.text: We were on vacation and decided to check this place out based on yelp reviews and it was super yummy authentic Mexican food. We were not disappointed. The chef came over and asked us how things were and was very sweet and we chatted with him a bit. The suggestions from the staff were all on point and the service was great. They even were so kind to put chips and salsa to-go in a bag for us even though we didn't ask as they knew were were traveling. We will defiantly make a top the next time we're in the state.

STHdogyd2OErVIh2wEbvag.text: This restaurant is small but the food is AMAZING!!! The frozen margaritas are the best and a little strong, but that is why they are the best. The chips and salsa are great. Might be my new favorite spot to hit up for lunch. The prices are decent and the menu is simple. Jen was the best waitress, she was very attentive and made sure we were good. The atmosphere was awesome. The real icing on the cake would be if they had an awesome happy hour food drink specials, still have yet to find that out. Definitely a great spot to eat for lunch :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1rEhDsHwCZMqDSyXfkl6EQ.text: Insanely delicious attentively prepared food. Get this trio appetizer to taste the phenomenal queso melt, homemade salsa including a habenero salsa, and freshly smashed guacamole.  Great wait staff. Bartender constantly shaking handcrafted margaritas was music to our ears. We missed happy hour by 30 minutes but this would be a great happy hour joint.  A modest building in little remote neighborhood but walk in and its hipster central. Will come back!

xW5ZQQL1W0MdfWG5dykVIQ.text: Cocina Madrigal was an experience. I recently went to attend a friend's birthday! The owner introduced himself and gave us a couple of freebies.  The Al Pastor tacos were amazing and super fat .   Great environment and great people!

J5Uz59X-Dqq6TCZwR2T6uQ.text: Very unassuming location, but the food is absolutely stellar! This food obviously comes from a chef who cares very much about every aspect of the dishes coming out of his kitchen: the quality of ingredients, the taste, presentation, etc. all within the bounds of traditional Mexican culture and tradition. Great modern take on this cuisine, will be back!

Xbd-uvHjp9RCmzt5iR4A-w.text: This restaurant most of its categories to eat are amazing to average. Tacos are decent looks more glorified than taste worthy. I'd give it 4 stars if the restaurant seemed more reasonable on their prices for tacos sure they have a nice pick three or mix and match for tacos but not really the best tacos I'd tasted or should pay but overall decent place to eat out it's convenient for family outing.

FxRJPZ2kQSEvwCC95r1siQ.text: Great hospitality. Great Food. Priced right. Wish I had room for dessert. Staff nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best New Mexico dish!
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best appetizer here!!  Hatch pork Chile.Taste just like authentic New Mexico Chile verde only needs to be spicier

8a3JaJnuCRqAaR7q6X7lqw.text: Wow! Stumbled into this place while passing through town, but this is the kind of place I'd go out of my way for.  The food--Fresh, homemade, top quality ingredients.   Highlights-  Oaxaca Fundido Wild Mushroom Enchilada  Beef Tenderloin steak taco Oaxaca shrimp taco Fresh made corn tortillas  We usually never order desserts, but it was my husband's  birthday so we got the churros and chocolate chipotle cake (because who can decide?)!  The churros were so warm and delicious with a sweet cream dipping sauce. But the chocolate chipotle cake was out of this world!   Finally- the service was exceptional. We came at an off hour and the chef came to talk to each table. Our waitress efficiently provided refills on drinks, chips, salsa. All the staff gave the impression that we were valued guests.  I live 10 hours away but I hope to be back!

YFXF-WmV6EeTNUOvMHoFFg.text: Was in town for a graduation and was actually kind of surprised at how great this place was. The stand-alone building was fairly humble, the quality of the service was highly personable and the food was absolutely amazing. From appetizers to desert, everything was phenomenal. Fish Tacos, Shrimp Tacos, Mushroom Enchiladas (which is saying a lot since i'm mostly carnivorous) all had the perfect amount of spice for the extra bit of kick, but not overly so that you couldn't tell how fresh the ingredients were. I ordered a Pizza Port chronic ale which although is usually a heavier beer than i like to get with Mexican food had a sweetness and nuttiness that paired well with both the food and desert.

MNMOqoTIN5aagWf_Xq4skg.text: Keep this place a 5 star!! Service and food was great!!! I had the top three tacos and they were all amazing (my fav was the beef one). Husband had the mushroom enchiladas..he's a meat type of person but they were highly recommended so he tried them and man they did not disappoint!!!' The sauce on top was to die for!!! At the end we tried out the stuffed churros they were also delicious!!!

S4gHKaE0qv17z9NWBxouLw.text: Amazing food with great service! Next time I am in Phoenix I will be back!!! Highly recommend the steak and shrimp tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4W8TUG59xuc-1p5ArE2QgQ.text: Excellent Service  Location  But... sweet mother of godddd.. the food.  We wanted some 'decent Mexican food' before we left Phoenix.. and, honestly, this place failed miserably - because it was THE best Mexican food I've had in about as long as I can remember. The chef brings authentic Southern Mexican flavor to the table (bar) both quickly and deliciously. The service was on point, the margaritas perfect and the food was beyond expectation. Try the Mushroom enchiladas (trussssttt..) and don't be an idiot and order ANY other app besides the Trio. Sit at the bar with Eddy, let him make the decisions and you'll walk away thankful, full and as happy as can be

vbVif0bZ8KifzUxDs05-CA.text: The food and service are top notch! So impressed! Loved the wild mushrooms enchiladas, guac was exceptional and then churros for dessert. Best churros I have had. Wish we loved closer. Thanks for amazing service. Also they saved a loose bull dog while we were there , hope it found her home !

s7oDdW6GNS7JZmTtjSnGgQ.text: This place is the perfect size: intimate, not too large so you can still hear tour table speak and the ambiance is calm and immediately we thought, 'Oh, this is going to be our spot!'   All the food that passed by looked amazing and smelled great. We started with the gacamole that was just sooo fresh and absolutely delicious. My husband got the al pastor burrito and is was boooom. If I come again I will not hesitant to get it.   If you're looking for the spot for contemporary Mexican but for it to still make your grandma proud. This is it.

s_9R8011wgniRzUGN4A1IQ.text: This place is lovely. Our server was super friendly and the wild mushroom enchiladas were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mezcal Margarita

pvsXISAnLN9RMJN9f9-XRQ.text: Loved it! The owner is not just a cook, he is a culinary artist. I wish we had him in Boulder, CO.

5_7VaFOXAU1WH-6tlOBkRQ.text: I was waivering between 4 and 5 stars, and decided to go with 5 because of the service. The service here was spectacular - the server was attentive, answered our questions, and checked back frequently to make sure everything was all right.   The food here was good, but not the best. I ordered 3 tacos - shrimp, fish, and steak. I've had better tacos around the neighborhood and back in New York. The creative flavor choices came as a delightful surprise, but were not harmonious enough to put me over the edge. The fish tacos are unexpectedly spicy, and the blue cheese on the steak tacos are an interesting choice. If you're looking for recommendations, I'd go with the shrimp. It's juicy, and the mix of toppings were modest - not too salty, sweet nor spicy.

H17cejNIXNnDjmujLLqsEw.text: Wow! I would give this place 6 stars if I could! The food is simple, delicious, not overly salty. I had wild mushroom enchilada and it may have been the best enchilada I've ever had! My husband had la diaba pasta with chicken and it was amazing and had very fresh ingredients. We shared grilled elote, it was yummy too. Margaritas were refreshing and strong, they were made fresh, not from a mix and they were not too sweet. Our bartender Tom was very friendly and sweet. We are definitely coming back here again and bringing our friends very soon.
