Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled elote
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild mushroom enchilada

mbkXhT4BxJ3BXPTmaZb8rg.text: Everything was delicious. Unique flavors. The service was wonderful. Our waiter Jose took great care of us made wonderful recommendation from the menu. I can't share a picture because I ate up too fast!

Cw6RiRq0OX9c5Mm5kFAXjg.text: Shout out to the curator of Yelp's Top 100 list because they knocked this one out of the park.  Many people will probably overlook this restaurant when they drive by because of its modest exterior. However, these individuals will be severely depriving themselves of the bounty of flavor that awaits inside these hallowed halls.   I typically order meat dishes as I am constantly craving savory and salty flavors. That said, the wild mushroom enchilada delivered an umami bomb of flavor that satisfied my desires.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild mushroom enchilada

DBRBErYiIR91pcQMr6J57A.text: This place is awesome and is probably the best  restaurant I've been to in Arizona. The food come out in a good portion to a point where I can't finished it. The atmosphere is a mix of bar and mom and pop restaurant. The service is what make this place great as they would replace your drink almost immediately.   One way to know if a mexican restaurant is good? It is when you don't like beans but finish what come with what you've order.

w_ksXIA8DsjcKzoybU-m4w.text: This place is one of the best places to eat in Phoenix.  I have been here several times and the food is just superb.  The owner comes out and chats with the people on a regular basis.  It is good to see this hidden gem blast off.  Great food.

33IgLkHJLkDYRu7pW5foFw.text: I stopped by on my way home form the badge ceremony because it was only a few blocks away. Okay, what was I thinking? I was already full from the Yummies at the event. However, I am rarely in that neighborhood and I had heard such great things from my Fellow Foodies.Can you say leftovers expected? Teehee!  I mean, how could I not stop by when every one of my Foodies tell me it it great. After all, it is rated as a top restaurant in America. So, I was skeptical because I never thought Z-Tejas was much to write home about. Also, I am not a fan usually, of Mexican food.  The place is darling. It is an understated cute to theme. More plain to Barebones but appropriate to genre. I think it was an old house before, at least that is what the server told me.  The service was amazing. They made me feel like family. Yarelli, I think she said her name was, was my server. There was also a man there who thanked me. He was very outgoing to all the customer too. I was very impressed with the service. Ya know, I felt like I was at a house in Mexico visiting relatives. It has that type of feel to it. The outside is cute with the twinkly lights. Parking is a bit challenging. The lot is kind of small but the place is not a large eatery.   The food is really great! I ordered the Serrano Guacamole and the Elote and it was fantastic!  I hear the Enchiladas here are out of this world. Next time. The Elote was beyond amazing to me. I really liked their chips and salsa too. They do have an interesting menu. They have potato cakes ( My favorite food ever)  and sandwiches too. A return trip is a must to try other items from their eclectic menu.   Over all a great new find! Wish it was closer to home. Bbbbbbuuuuuut, then again, "maybe not" my waistline says.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole Serrano
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy Salsa
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elote was so amazing!

uxL70O8F4Lrn8qtRsyXztg.text: One of the best hatch green sauces I've had, almost as good as NM. Great service, friendly and courteous.  Great music and very chill atmosphere.

fbmzy3-Ner_V6IhxJ8ZF3w.text: Fairy authentic Mexican joint that we found downtown after a recent game. It has only been there for a year, but seems like a neighborhood hotspot now.   The clear best part was the $8.95 homemade Guacamole. I had some carmelized pineapple on the side, but it's not needed. The second best dish was desert which was a delicious homemade coconut cream pie served with homemade whipped cream.  The mexican rice was fluffy and decent, but the pinto beans were salty and hard to eat. Wild Mushroom Enchiladas - these had an addicting sauce, homemade corn tortillas and alot of sauteed mushrooms. Tacos - probably a bit overpriced as you mix and match 3 for $16. The flank steak was good, but undercooked and the shrimp tacos had great flavor.     The menu is a bit small, but definitely some gems to be found here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very good Coconut cream to go
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos

2ChTNi1Lr9r7Kg5AQEKVlQ.text: Visited this place for dinner, it's literally walking distance from my home, and a good friend had suggested I try it. Well, I did and honestly it wasn't bad but truly didn't meet my dining expectations. The environment was pleasant, friendly staff and a simple menu. The music was not crazy loud and easy to have a conversation with friends or a date.   I want to be fair with my review and I must say...this place clearly knows who they cater too. This place has excellent rice, nasty beans, average burritos with a very delightful enchilada sauce but in the end...the "El Pastor" burrito was not something I would eat again. The Mac n cheese with grilled chicken was much better but my 13 year old didn't like it. I did however and ended up eating his dish but he didn't like the burrito.  The lights kept surging and I was worried about a blackout...it is monsoon season. We were seated quickly,  the server was very nice and brought us drinks  on request. It seemed like 10-15 minutes went by until we were seen again. It was enough time however to get a deeper feel to the environment. It was not surprising to hear the "in my country they are called cenote line" this clown used his accent voice and totally entertained the older non-latino guests...guess who he looked right at and just kept walking??  Yup, this guy! I am happy he did...it would have been an insult to my Mexican background.   In my other posts I've never left a place without reviewing the facilities...the rest room was clean, stocked but it really smelled and could use proper ventilation.   Our server was very polite, he did an awesome job (after everyone walked pass us for 10 or more minutes) he totally redeemed himself and I want him to know that he made my great servers list.  So, if you are in the area stop and judge for yourself. The price was high for the food portion and it seemed like food truck service in a slightly higher class environment. The Hispanic guy with the dark chef outfit and mustache sure is entertaining but so is the little monkey who tilts it's hat when you give him a coin at the carnival.   This place is not one that I would return to and it's a shame because it's literally within walking distance from my home.  P.S. I did enjoy the salsa and chips...try both the regular and habbanero salsa.

b0rxRkxbF6EX2qFRn7iAiw.text: Ok. Went back a second time, fish tacos are good--too much cabbage that takes over the other flavors. Same with the shrimp taco. The steak tacos were sweet. Not a fan of a sweet carne asada taco. The margaritas remain amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bombazz Mushroom enchiladas!
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa! They mango habanero is hot hot hot but hard to stop eating!  Prickly pear and mango margaritas! Perfecto!
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Housemade Coconut cream pie! Delisiouza!!!

i8GwKz7OFy0mDirdR5RAiw.text: My second time at this amazing and authentic hidden gem and I love it even more than before! Save room for dessert and order the churros- you'll thank me! Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu- Page 2
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu - page 1
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churro dessert-insanely good! Save some room!!!

kHyHHoawZBSD7oCCh1nhRw.text: My first visit to Cochina Madrigal was a success. I had a business meeting at Sky Harbor, and the other folks decided they wanted to try some local flavor.  Being the local guy, I looked up closest authentic Mexican restaurants and Cochina Madrigal came up.  The host/server was kind and helpful. We had an appetizer of the chips, salsa and some guacamole made right on site. It was excellent.  The tastes of the salsas and guacamole was great.   For lunch I had two enchiladas- one mushroom mole and one Barbados green chili. Wow. They were very good. For desert we had some coconut pie and Bavarian cream churros.  Again, excellent.   The restaurant also has a bar inside and outdoor seating for nice days.   The staff was very kind and the chef came out to meet us and explain the dishes. Overall, it was a really great experience.  I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild Mushroom Enchiladas and Barbacoa Enchiladas

hobycvfI57O6GuyT67krGg.text: Holy shooot this place is amazing. I am a taco and Mexican food scout and look far and wide to find the best. Top 5 for best Mexican is the rank here. Been to Mexico many times and spend lots of time in baja living in California. Go here, drink margaritas, eat tacos and enjoy.

vQuU3Ni08ybn_YoGr-BcZQ.text: We stopped here on a Monday afternoon when it wasn't too busy.  I ordered the steak tacos and chicken tortilla soup and both were really good.  The soup had a lot of flavor and had the right amount of meat.  The tacos came in three and they were quite tasty.  Our server was really nice and attentive.  We were only here for about an hour or so but by the time we left the place got busy with people sitting inside and outside.

VTSiAsI2HyBxSy1dSN79Dg.text: Passed up a Brazilian BBQ to go here and so glad we did!! This place even won over 2 picky kids. Steak tacos with lettuce cups were delicious and served beautifully. Beef enchiladas and chicken quesadilla were flavorful. The salsa alone was amazing!! The guacamole is made to order!! Some of the best salsa I've ever had.   Staff is meticulously attentive and friendly. The owner came out to greet guests and ask how the food is.  The outside is unassuming and the interior is no fuss but the food overall is excellent and we will come here in our next trip to AZ.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fMpLCfwcg7JJ0C8SLh74sQ.text: This is wonderful food.  Had the Oaxaca fundido to start with excellent margaritas.  Someone knows how to cook.  Really lovely and attentive server and good vibe in.  Leo is charming (Chef/Owner) and Tom is a magical bartender. The service?  Just spectacular.  The food?  Even more amazing!!

WBogYZ8QaFsZ4AcLezvMDw.text: Excellent service and amazing food. I'm used to Tex Mex, which I like, but my co-worker insisted Phoenix Mexican is a different animal, he specifically said more spicy. This wasn't as spicy as the street tacos we had in Cancun, but it was definitely flavorful. You could taste the mesquite and the jalapeno cilantro dressing was just right. Even the cherry tomatoes were grilled! And they were those fancy tri-color mix. My co-worker had enchiladas and they let her get one chicken and one barbacoa. With rice and beans, it was enough for two meals. My other co worker built his own chicken burrito, it was awesome and huge, another two parter. The seasoning is perfect and wrk balanced, spicy but flavorful, they are not trying to melt your face! We all had a hard time making up our minds, so it's definitely being bookmarked for a return visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Misquote grilled romaine shrimp salad, chicken and barbacoa enchiladas

SA2se3Y3e4gfS0evHNmCtw.text: Stopped in yesterday.  We sat up at the bar and immediately were involved in conversation with other customers on both sides of us.  Great recommendations on both food and drink from them and the manager.  Food and drinks were unique and outstanding, wonderful manager/bartender Eduardo,  fantastic attention to detail.  We will be back again even though it is a "destination" from where we live.  Well worth the drive!

NcMk4fTbMROSgXj_xhCn9w.text: Excellent, fresh, authentic Mexican food in a family friendly fun package. It's a must.

70zzGGmWxDu6WfAzHuXEuA.text: Excellent Food with an authentic Mexican authenticity. Staff is really friendly and the food is very reasonably priced. Secret Gem on 16th in Phoenix. If you haven't tried it, you need to give it a try! You won't be disappointed. The chef makes his rounds to every table to see how you doing.. who does that any more?? Great Restaurant!!!

GNZsgbjWlwBj9FplXOW2uQ.text: There is a reason this place has five stars and over 500 reviews. The food is amazing on all levels. The fundido chips and salsa enchiladas everything were just perfect. I can tell you I have hated enchiladas my whole life. Don't know what's wrong with me but just do not enjoy. However the mushroom enchilada was just amazing and may have restored my faith in trying enchiladas when I go out. Now the most amazing thing of the afternoon was the tenderloin taco. It was so tender and flavorful with the crispy peppers it was awesome. Now when I saw Gorgonzola on a taco it sounded so wrong but I'm glad I tried it cause boy was it so right. I'm having a hard time remembering a better taco. My wife and I had to drive 45 min to get here but it's so good we will be back and won't mind the drive at all it is so worth it. Last note the service staff was just as awesome. They really took care of us from start to finish without a single problem. Thank you to the owner and staff for the amazing experience you will see us again soon.

73EzSUl2od5vNmzqXRCqAQ.text: So good!  Came because of the reviews and it didn't disappoint. Our table ordered tacos and the mushroom enchiladas. I had a pastor, shrimp and asada taco, all good but go for the asada. Everyone from our server to the bartender and the cook/owner came by to say hi. Will be back when in town.

nhJ1AzDwF6B7LrSENN026w.text: What an absolute delight. Food is fresh and full of flavor. Great care in service. Guacamole with pineapple and tacos al pastor are to die for.

Lpxa45yWlNJANL6ZFv5kNw.text: My new favorite place in South Mountain. This is the hidden gem of South Phoenix. The food is unlike anyplace in the area and it's is really, really good. The guacamole is phenomenal and I highly recommend the mushroom enchiladas. Wash it all down with a margarita and you are good to go.

mvciGXI6tmM7oRGANLrDzQ.text: Wow wow wow! This place is gooood! My husband and I were driving home and heard of this restaurant through a couple of neighbors. We were planning on just getting a quick snack but several items on the menu caught out eyes! We got the trio (salsa, quest, guac) and the hatch green chili barbacoa enchiladas. It was all awesome. Can't wait to come back and try other menu items! So happy to have this restaurant close to my house.

o8QdfcgORMDJWnPYB8Imjw.text: My dad and I needed a food break on our road trip so I randomly chose this restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious as the chips, salsa and guacamole are addicting and my chicken enchiladas were delicious. I was extremely impressed with the staff there. Our waiter kept checking on us to see if we were okay. The chef came out and talked to my dad and I for a bit and we told him that it was our first time there. Then I think it was either the owner or manager of the restaurant who spoke with us next and we had a nice conversation. I've never felt so welcomed at a restaurant before. Keep up the fantastic work Cocina Madrigal!

1suA8Mik7TQx6JUgJ4r8PA.text: Very nice treat in South Phoenix. Only one month open ... our server was prompt and knew the menu well. Jason the general manager visited with us and offered menu suggestions which were wonderful... the taco trio,, the mesquite grilled salad ( my favorite) and the Hatch green chili appetizer was my dinner. I will order it again. All three of us agreed we will go back again for more. Be sure to try the dessert... pie and churros.  Yum yum.

9CC3f2Dh4Y5oxxjVioTkaA.text: Very good food and service. One of the better meals I've had. Outstanding enchilada's. Very impressed.

HqDNF5BG_Qj3vfD7qsoJ5Q.text: Nice to have an upscale Mexican restaurant so close to home.. get the Guac, the barbacoa enchiladas and if they have it the SALMON.. I would come back solely for the salmon, so crispy and flavorful.. waiting to get my churros, but will definitely be back.

5jSiSDnTZXhVIn8acK0tgw.text: The BEST Mexican Food I've ever had in my life! Coming from California and living in Seattle, I thought California had the best Mexican food, but I'm so sad to say that this place had the best Mexican Food I've ever had. Eduardo (Eddy) is the best!!! Highly recommend!

fyQiPdQ_swF29Sf9GyWIDQ.text: Unpretentious, but impecable flavors. Wild mushroom enchiladas were fantastic. Would definitely go back. Margaritas a bit too sweet.

vJi6nJcFgMQmgnhcaZI1MQ.text: Let's cut to the chase...yes I will be back, yes it's good, and yes, mushroom enchiladas are a thing. Jason and Emily were awesome and even sent me back to the office with extra chips and salsa to share with my coworkers. They wanted feedback on the salsa, which me and the boss agreed is superb. It's a tad hotter than I can just keep chowing, eventually the heat got the best of me, but that's better than boring spice-less salsa. Chef recommendations: hatch green Chile pork, the Madrigal burger, crispy salmon, any burrito, and I don't recall which salad but man, 3 of those salads sound awesome.

k4aBZsrQ-Y8f818erVL_7A.text: First time here.  Awesome food & great atmosphere!  Did I say great food!  I met a friend here and we enjoyed the margaritas and beer.

n7WvDa75b-LAYveP-coy9g.text: What an amazing find!  We were heading to a performance in Phoenix for the Conveyors (an AMAZING reggae band!) and found this little gem on Yelp.  It is humble, but the service was amazing and the food was incredible.  Started with a margarita, chips, incredible salsa, and freshly made guacamole.  I ordered the wild mushroom enchiladas and they were easily the best enchiladas that I have ever eaten in my life.  The staff was accommodating and attentive, and if I did not live in Gilbert we would be coming here every week.  You will not be disappointed!  It is not the Scottsdale restaurant scene as far as ambience, but the food is tremendous!  Try it!

xA2iFinrdyqSJQE6Y2GqQg.text: We have visited Cocina Madrigal many times and have had excellent experiences each time. Had dinner with foodie friends from out of town this weekend. The praise for the CM team was unanimous. Two of our party from Scottsdale said they would drive the 40 minutes to eat here again. Every dish, every experience has been just terrific. Strongly recommend Cocina Madrigal.

J1h-d3Nd_6Gc8LGBUryy-g.text: First time here and we loved it! The service was remarkable; the food was amazing, specially the churros! We will definitely be back for some more tacos and enchiladas!

8B-Z5kgm_sSohW3TrBPxVw.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. First of all, the steak tacos were literally the best tacos I have ever had in my life. The meat was so soft, present in every bite, & it also had tempura'd vegetable, blue cheese, & lightly had delicious sauce in it. Everything was homemade and prefect, even the tortilla. There was absolutely no dripping sauce or oil, so it is not only delicious, but definitely more healthy than most tacos I have eaten. Even the beans and rice that it comes with are seasoned just right. I ate them even though I never usually eat rice & beans, because they were that good. Their elote was also delicious. I had the churros for dessert, & they were stuffed with Bavarian cream & mexican caramel. Everything was the best, & definitely worth the price. On top of amazing food, Jasmine & the chef were above and beyond in their service. Jasmine gave amazing recommendations and attentive service. The chef clearly takes so much pride in his work, because he takes the time to hear feedback. He was great to talk to and very friendly. It is very refreshing to encounter those types of people. I will definitely recommend this to everyone and take all my friends here.

rbFJ51JQurAZKh0QThIyoQ.text: If this is your first time at this restaurant you'll likely pull up and question if you're parking at the correct location. The staff is very polite and professional. Our party of 6, including a 3 1/2 and 1 1/2 year old, was well cared for. Prior to ordering our waiter went over the menu with great detail, pointing out things we may have overlooked otherwise. I settled with the wild mushroom enchiladas, delicious. Part way through the meal the chief, and owner, came out to introduce himself and see how things were going. This place won't disappoint. Give them a try!

cvoU8rQpaCKJUssEDcb8yw.text: First time diners. I saw recommendations on our Next Door Neighbors posts for a while and decided we needed to try it out. Great experience and authentic food.  Margaritas made by hand,  not out of a machine or pre-mix. I had chicken enchiladas and my spouse had pork enchiladas.  Delicious.

iIF_C6Fh68kxddFu6KPe4w.text: What a find!!!  I was researching my trip to Phoenix and came across this place. The beef tenderloin tacos were amazing; the beef was perfectly cooked and the fried jalapenos gave it suck a nice crunch. I usually don't like corn tortillas but tried their homemade ones and wish I would have gotten them all that way.  The margaritas were perfect after a long flight and the staff was friendly and gave us other suggestions in the area. Stop in and give it a try you won't be disappointed!

_jDispblgkGbgTemhbXAvg.text: Everyone is super friendly & the food is SO good, and for a reasonable price too!! The mushroom enchiladas...HOT DAMN! So good!

_MwPm9Ggc6VVnhSk6MQfqw.text: Excited for a new neighborhood restaurant in South Phoenix.  The service was nice without being rushed.  Everyone loved what they had; shrimp tacos, mushroom enchiladas, and al pastor tacos.    The owner was excited to share his story and get feedback from us on the food, atmosphere and service.   Looking forward to going back to explore the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al pastor tacos
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

c693K3gdc6gqD7gtSCqTxw.text: Outstanding service! And really good food, too. The place from the outside is not as catchy but my husband and I decided to try this great place because of the reviews here on Yelp. Let me tell you that we were surprised and of course appreciative of the chef/owner who came out to talk to his clients and introduce himself. Very few owners do that and this one did show his appreciation for the uncommon wait we had to do to get our food. He quickly explained that he was unexpectedly short handed and well that's totally understandable. The fact that his employees and he in particular took the time to apologize and make it right said wonders about him and the quality of his work.  We will definitely be back!

figoFBIx15rWbdeVXhEh8Q.text: This place is fantastic. They make most or all of their own ingredients in house. The habanero salsa was very tasty. I ordered the taco trio and it was very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fRTYNpXVSRZKPGyZB9nJNA.text: Absolutely the best Mexican Food I've ever had in the US. 5 stars you won't be disappointed. I can't believe this place exists in Phoenix. Blown away!!!

J2iJRZcyI91z4IAwga1WMw.text: Best Mexican food in Phoenix without a doubt! The margaritas are expensive for the size but it also doesn't stop me from ordering, service is great. Mushroom enchiladas are my favorite!

N5azJsGM_wYvHS7hqjBv5g.text: Food was tasty and came out quickly. Chicken enchiladas and a beef burrito. The beans were flavorful and the rice had some fresh pico sprinkled in. Prickly Pear margarita on the rocks was strong and had a good taste. Stand out was the service; the chef came out and spoke to everyone and was so warm and friendly. The servers were efficient and engaging, making jokes with each other and the guests. It almost felt like a large family gathering. Overall, worth a dinner stop. I can't remember the last time I went to a restaurant where everyone truly seemed so genuinely friendly.

mI2aWORN6bYZo5FZfe0IUg.text: I was very happy with the food and the service. The staff is increbibly friendly and attentive. The house-made corn tortillas are amazing! The steak tacos are fantastic! The chips are hot and fresh and taste wonderful. I will certainly be back. The only thing I wasn't a fan of is that chips and salsa are not complimentary. In the Greater Phoenix Area this is typically a gimme for a Mexican restaurant. But everything else is so good that this didn't bum me out too badly.

eTCrReyG-BXDMrwGbZW1lw.text: Visiting from California & the food was delicious!  The service was great too!  The owner also came out to welcome us.  A wonderful place to eat!  Thank you!

WGWJfxoh4wDY4i2oCb_GLw.text: The filet steak tacos will blow your mind! This was by far the best tacos I've had in a very long time. I was pleasantly surprised at all of the different elements that went into making the taco. From the pomegranate marinated Filet Mignon, to the crispy fried jalapeno slivers, and Gorgonzola cheese. The flavor comes together perfectly and it truly makes sense. Give them a try!

Gr_zaAhCBb903DPfkP0eBw.text: Supporting this new restaurant was a great idea. Thanks for making your location this part of town. We did the full course meal appetizer, main courses and dessert. Main courses were fish tacos, beef enchiladas, and achiote chicken burrito. Appetizer the trio and dessert the churros. Flavors were well balanced and worked well. Nothing was over seasoned. Cooked perfectly. Prices were above average, but considering what the owner is trying to achieve I understand but not agree. Portions, staff, chef/owner was great. The 4 stars is based on the achiote burrito. Buying it the way it is sold might be great but I pass on the rice and cheese. The flavor then was good but not great. It seems the items in the dish could not be independent of each other when it comes to flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Qm7V0kfzMb9y9R7pRYaldg.text: Saw the Yelp reviews and decided to try it. We had 11 in our party and had Eduardo as our waiter.  Our waiter could not have been better. He explained the menu, explained the vegan options, was extremely nice, our water glasses were never empty.  All meals were way beyond our expectations. Anything from the mushroom enchilades, freshly made corn tortillas, fish tacos, all tacos were amazing.  The chicken mushroom dinner was incredible. We brought our picky eating basketball players and all raved about the meal.  We ate til we could not eat any more. Well we did have the churros as dessert, not churros like I expected. These were custard filled fresh and hot drizzled with caramel. Best Mexican or probably my best server, service, food experience for as long as I can remember. We will be back!

IhWV_mPj4WJb4FOKsXwNjg.text: We had the Oaxaca Fundido for the starter, served with flour tortilla and salsa and chips, that was amazing. The Mushroom, chorizo and the melted cheese was sooooooo good. We had the different kinds of tacos, but the steak with blue cheese knocked it out of the park! Everything was incredible. The service, the people and Oscar our server is the sweetest. Can't wait to come back.

pTNLAvM_rcuRAX3gYBn0mg.text: Cocina Madrigal NEVER disappoints!! We can hang out here for hours at a time, lounging at the bar and relaxing.  Their patio is opening soon and we can't wait! We look forward to every visit!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild Mushroom Enchiladas
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mango Margarita rimmed with Tajin

UshsiwmIbvNy34WL5X_H3A.text: AMAZING!! Service was great! Mango lemonade vodka amazing! Omgffff I don't even like vegetables but these were AMAZING!! The music stays poppin! The quest dip was phenomenal! Great place recommend 100%

jXACVEcxjyNmrG6EYXYVuA.text: All I can say is wow amazing food and service best fish tacos and steak tacos I've eaten and mushroom enchilada wow the desert was so amazingly good

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_HlOdfetV43goqLWCmrZIg.text: Met up with a friend for dinner and neither of us were familiar with this area of town. We narrowed our choice down to Mexican food a d this was the first restaurant to pop up. We took a chance. The service was great. Our server was very attentive and several others stopped by to refill drinks, chips, salsa. The homemade guacamole was perfect. I had 2 different enchiladas and my friend had 3 different tacos. Everything was delicious. We finished the night with churros and they were the best I've ever had....the sauce was amazing!

Fgaked29WaFXhiZQRf2FPA.text: My absolute favorite taco spot in Arizona.The tacos are creative and so, so, delicious, and the guacamole is as fresh and flavorful as it gets. The margaritas are always spot on, and the staff is beyond friendly and attentive. Whenever visiting the area, I always make sure to stop by. Worth the trip! :)

oJ6INSR91vOlJjrUiTfvTw.text: Absolutely loved this place...from the moment I stepped in I was feeling the vibe of this place! Tom the bartender took care of me while I waited for my family to show up for dinner. Eduardo was so attentive, I felt like VIP,  not only did he answer all of our questions, but did it with a  charm that made my family feel immediately like they were home. They have this appetizer which I believe was barbacoa dip, chips that was so good! We had to stop ourselves or we'd be full. The mushroom enchiladas, were by far my favorite!! This is gonna be new NEW!!!

xiaEbMc7BNAVP1n9Y4L8lg.text: Hands-down the best Mexican restaurant I have tried in Phoenix. I come here often and each experience has been incredible. The enchiladas are outstanding, the trio appetizer is fantastic. The margaritas are incredible and the service and friendliness of the staff and Leo the owner is something you don't see every day in this town. I will certainly do everything within my power to ensure that they succeed. Please give them a try, you will not be disappointed.

yfMgnADxsu_9Xi3qPYA6AQ.text: Really cool atmosphere, friendly service, and great food! The margaritas are to die for! I recommend the crispy salmon. The prices are on the higher end but worth it. There's a tv to watch at the bar. Also the parking lot is very small so good luck with that.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You pay for nachos and salsa... guacamole of course.
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy salmon
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted veggies.

m058QlI7AtikXe_bI4WPfA.text: My wife talked me into coming to this place, I was reluctant. Let me tell you, this place is amazingly delicious! I ordered the wild mushroom enchilada (avoiding meat and working out) and elote,OMG! It was all amazing. I live out in Surprise and believe I'll be making the drive out here to enjoy the food and my prickly pear margarita. Thank you Chef Leo!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros with Bulgarian cream. Amazing!
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elote.
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild mushroom enchilada. Hella good!!!

c3xbLs-W6cdce4ibGC_ehA.text: Had dinner here a few times and have been blown away every time. I have lived in Arizona my entire life and this is the best Mexican food around. 100% worth the 20 minute drive and the owner is just a phenomenal human. If you've never been here you are missing out.

BLg6x54MMYUeZJtNdyc30w.text: Delicious food for an airport restaurant. Enjoyed this little place during a lengthy layover. I recommend.....uh everything.

yJKyTEuQPrmXWpaTHnmgXw.text: Holy Moly! I think I found my new obsession, the beef tenderloin tacos are crazy good!  I found this place on Yelp and let me tell you, they have earned every single one of their five stars. The guacamole is exceptional, like mind numbingly delicious. If you like guacamole you won't find any place in Phoenix that does it better.  Back to the beef tenderloin tacos, they're one of the best tacos that I have ever had. This place is super unassuming off the street and would probably have a line out the door if it wasn't in South Mountain. But if you're reading this review and you are willing to make the drive - DO IT!  Lastly, the service here is phenomenal to the point you and whomever you are with will make note of it.

IqWVSPlhOecapOYqbtDjfg.text: Go and you will see why this place is 5 stars! The food was delicious! But beyond that the staff was genuinely hospitable and caring. You just don't get that anymore! Re: Food - my husband had the taco sampler and he loved them all but his fav was the veggie surprisingly. And I had the enchiladas, so yummy! We washed it down with Mexican coke, mmm!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco sampler
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken enchilada and mushroom enchilada. I had already dug; sorry, not sorry. ;)

9yY0_Tnu3zoiSrnxq6_nxg.text: Decent food, good service... 3.5 stars.   Food was tasty but a bit sloppy presentation.   No drink menu, and we felt the server rushed us a bit.     The bathroom is 85 degrees and smells like sewer.

OGMKhhFVOPmvModeu8WVug.text: South Phx! You want flavorful food,  an imaginative, passionate chef, stiff tequila drinks, and great service? Look no further!     We stopped in for the Grand Opening.  We were not disappointed.   We were greeted by friendly faces, a (sweet surprise) complimentary guacamole, chips, and salsa.  The chips were light and crispy.    The salsa was delicious.   Nice flavor and a lil heat.  We devoured the chips, and salsa.  And then polished off the guacamole, that we found out isn't made until you order.   I loved the roasted pineapple guacamole.  Will be ordering that again.     If you are a mushroom lover, I would recommend the wild mushroom enchiladas.  They are loaded with mushrooms, accented by cheese, and topped with a ancho cream sauce that will send you to enchilada heaven.  They were the best enchiladas I have ever had.  My husband had the seasonal veggie burrito, and let me have a bite.  The veggies were cooked perfect, and the green sauce was flavorful.  Overall a bright, and flavorful dish.  But the mushroom enchiladas were the shining star to me.   Dropped in today headed home from work.  This will be our 4th/5th time here. Today we had Leo's hot salsa.  Wooo did that have a delicious donkey kick!  It was flavorful but had that punch of hot salsa that I love.  I kept going back to the original then to this hotter one.  Both are fantastic, and I love having a spicier option when i'm wanting the heat and the flavor punch!  I tried the raspberry brandy liquor frozen margarita.   WOW it was delicious.  I will be ordering that next time, AND the next time.  The contrast in the flavors of the lime, and raspberry was phenomenal.      Ordered the shrimp tacos.  The shrimp in the tacos are so yummy buttery (yes, yummy buttery) and the tacos are so so flavorful. Ive ordered these the last two times.  Def becoming my second go to favorite dish here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

2in8mNiwYDguRpYnsSNLlg.text: Don't be fooled by exterior or location! This place serves fabulous food. I had the three taco sampler plate: steak with Gorgonzola, al pastor and a grilled fish taco.  Loved it! I chose the prickly pear margarita on recommendation of Maria who who was a super host.  Great dining experience. Bartender was charming the whole bar.

cYwK-vFtkkwAQYXesSKGAQ.text: Excellent Family Restaurant. I have visited several times with my fiancee and friends for dinner, and It has become of our go-to Mexican Restaurant in Phoenix (Personally, my favorite).   The food is authentic, delicious, and greatly priced. Mushrooms enchiladas and elote on the cob are a dishes not to be missed, but you won't be disappointed whatever you pick. The ambience is laid back and very friendly, just like Mexico! The staff is really accommodating and truly care about your experience. The chef comes out to greet people and say hello, which is a very nice touch. Drinks are very good too - My fiancee says her Margarita was excellent! Wish the owner tons of success, I am sure we will start seeing more and more of Cocina Madrigal in Phoenix.

tHl_gSBGTiQbXSXIdDQF2Q.text: Return visit May 6th, day after cinco de mayo, still putting out, Chef in kitchen! Great meal and dessert, the chocolate pie/cake excellent

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan enchiladas
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Romaine only

6nVjOt_7CtgCpC-xQ9KSEw.text: This review is for sitting outside on a warm night with a beer and tenderloin tacos.   The tenderloin tacos are the best tacos I've ever had. The former champion was from a tiny town in Texas near the border (Marfa), but Cocina Madrigal has taken the top spot.   Everything we had was delicious, the guacamole and salsa were great and the other tacos we tried were very good. You should go here.

EOkAK9h72_tN8VaykZBhrA.text: I brought seven co-workers here based on one recommendation... the food is unbelievable.  We ordered steak tacos, shrimp tacos, fish tacos, chicken dinner and a steak salad.  My table got real quiet when the food came out.  Everyone loved their food.  I will say the steak tacos with corn tortillas were fabulous.  Easily the best corn tortillas ever and the steak tenderloin was cooked to perfection.  We started with guacamole and fundido for appetizers.  The guacamole was so smooth and lacked nothing.  The fundido was delicious filled with mushrooms and accompanied by fresh tortillas.  Our waitress was extremely busy, but kind and attentive.  We really enjoyed our visit from the chef.. so gracious.  We will return for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fundido with sausage and mushrooms..  so delicious
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh chips and delicious salsa...  the orange salsa has some heat!
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh guacamole, so smooth and delicious

YlPz2Enf2qsLqedEfLOdHg.text: The food is amazing!  I got a trio of tacos (al pastor, steak, and shrimp) -  the steak with Gorgonzola cheese was my favorite.  It was so good.  We had the guacamole and churros to share.  You must get the churros!  Don't let the exterior fool you, go inside and try the food.  You will not be disappointed.  I get why there are 5 stars.  The chef and owner even came out to say hi to us and his daughter was our server.  Both were so nice and genuinely care about the restaurant and their customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros

c47MYhV8BmLS8Kuq9q6e_Q.text: I would recommend this place. I took my father here for a dinner and we both ordered. There was a small concern about the food (I am a very picky eater) and I asked the waitress for accommodations. The owner personally came out and made sure that everything was to our satisfaction. He was so kind and shared with us the story of his venture into owning his business. He even sent us out the churros that they have which were absolutely amazing!

vI-JzWPlkcWVJZMPHvI4WA.text: Food was DELICIOUS and the chef/owner visiting our table was a perfect finishing touch to a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken enchiladas
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh guacamole and chips/salsa

5LQLouWcuc6XxIdjTq_bUA.text: Similar to the review below, I also moved from NYC/LA and while have found several other in the Valley disappointing, this place is one of our faves, so much that we bring our out of town friends. The skinny margarita is great, love the shrimp tacos, and the service is always on point and welcoming. If the staff/owner Leo are reading this, thank you! We'll continue to be back :)

pidSn0gFu-U_N5Nq-d5F7Q.text: Very good. Had the tacos (house made tortillas) and burrito. Margaritas are fresh. Doesn't taste like a mix. The grilled elite was our favorite.  Great service. Owner even came to our table to chat.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gaPLpanFGmjAetNviTlgvA.text: Yum yum yum, everything was homemade and delicious! Enchiladas, tacos and churros! Yum yum!!!!

sJRWo853o7Mw8ZTTjsrqsw.text: We love this place! Opened in July of 2018 and our family is making it our place for family celebrations + my husband has been bringing his clients in the area and they love it, too!

G9OKGNORpKPML-qYA8kICA.text: If you haven't been here yet, you're doing it wrong. Though unassuming on the outside, inside the restaurant is welcoming due in large part to the staff who make you feel like a part of the family. The food is top notch. We'll definitely be back for more; especially, the mushroom enchiladas.

WhITaqoRiVl7amt-i4vvGg.text: Ok. If there was a 6, I would surely give it.  First, let's talk about the food. On the advice of many others here, we had the guacamole with roasted pineapple. You have GOT to try this! I have never had guac this way. The waitress said, she has had guac with orange slices in it too. That would be good too. But seriously, if you come to this place, you have to get this.  I had the enchilada plate. For the last 50 years or so that I have been eating mexican food, I have had a big preference for cheese enchiladas. They didn't have cheese enchiladas, so I had to choose what they had. I couldn't decide so, I had both the barbacoa one with green chili sauce, and the wild mushroom one with the mole cream sauce. They were both great, but I will let y'all in on a little secret - the mushroom one was way tastier! Now, when I come back, that will be my GO TO plate.  My wife had the Chicken Stack. She said it was great. But after a bit of plate envy at another customers table, she wishes she had gotten the fish and shrimp tacos instead. Next time.  We finished off with coconut pie, because everyone raved about it. If you don't like lots of coconut then don't get this. It was so dense, it reminded me of cheesecake. Yummy! What a way to end the meal.  The waitress and staff were VERY attentive, my glass of tea hardly ever saw the bottom.  The only drawback was it was a bit noisy. Not so that I won't come again, mind you. But as I get older, noise bothers me.  This is NOT, I repeat NOT in a bad part of town. So don't let that stop you from coming here. You MUST try this place.  Leo Madrigal, who is I think, the owner, came to our table at the end, and wanted to know where we lived, and how we liked it. He said, he makes sure EVERYTHING is fresh.  And I would say that it is.  Again, come to this place!

8AwzomnUVv4Ntao2JeB6Eg.text: All I can say about this place is WOW!!  The wild mushroom enchiladas were absolutely amazing!!  My husband had the pork tacos, and they were unbelievable!  The service was great, and even the fresh chips and freshly made salsa were delicious.  We are here visiting from Dallas, but I refuse to leave without eating here at least one more time before we leave.

ICGEeLPlKHkCOs8w08sjBw.text: Oh my, I am in love! Only in Phoenix for a couple of days and will probably be back tomorrow night!

j8vt8zLQ8cD3GrpRXz7n3Q.text: Visited on a Thursday. Establishment was clean, GREAT customer service....BUT...PERRO.... Food was so bland, kept wondering if the cook was sad:(...There is a saying in the Hispanic/ Latino community that if dish had no salt, the cook was sad:(..... Me believes that was the case on the evening me and my daughter visited.  My daughter had a "make your own burro" of steak, rise and beans. No flavor! Bland, bland, Bland!!! Had to keep adding salt and pepper for flavor and taste!!!!  I had the chicken tortillas soup. Soup was so thick, could not see all the avacado in the soup!! Which was a good thing, there was only a very small piece of chicken in the soup. I counted 12 tortillas strips!!! WOW!  SO SO BLAND!! Once again had to add a lot of salt and pepper. Ordered a side of guacamole, OMG!!!, There was so much purple onion in the guacamole, never tasted the avacado, the sweetness of the purple onion over powered the the bland taste of the guacamole!!! Again had to add salt and pepper to get flavor in the guacamole!!  Por Favor mijo, give the cook the night off, a tissue and a shot of tequilla!! Let him cry out his sorrows before you let him back in the kitchen!!!! Again I believe the cook was feeling sad and probably not in the mood to cook!!!  When a cook in the mood, LOOK OUT!!! The cook will add his/her joy of life to the dish!! Truth!! UNA GRAN VERDAD!!!! This establishment is not for me!!! Will not be going there again and will leave empty my table for someone that enjoys bland Hispanic/Latino food. Provecho!!!!....and please keep the salt and pepper shakers full!!!!

rIvqfbIy6ONZZGMhHGjdAQ.text: Awesome place!! Chef came to table to make sure everything was good. Serrano guacamole and margaritas were great. The salsa was very good. This is the first time to actually give a review it is that good

c4LrqpT7ZmUCcWm4lhLosQ.text: This place is AMAZING! The music, food, and staff were wonderful. I will definitely be coming back! The food is authentic and the churros were delicious! The staff was so kind and helpful with recommendations. Thank you, see you guys soon!!

uMsQVi7zCF0s1rzcCywLbw.text: AMAZING service, and UNBELIEVABLE food!  Fresh made to order guacamole is FANTASTIC!!!  Fish tacos were best I've had!

N1kqKl9n2jfJIJQ-tS6EAQ.text: What a wonderful gem we have here in south Phoenix. From the moment we walked in, we were given incredible service. Our server Zay was friendly, knowledgeable, and professional! The owner came by multiple times to talk to us and we enjoyed conversing with him very much. We ordered the Trio appetizer and were blown away by the fundido that came with it. The house-made tortillas are to die for as well. By the time our entrees came around we were pretty full off of chips, salsa, fundido, and guacamole, but they were delicious as well. My boyfriend got a taco plate and was pleasantly surprised when they were loaded up and weren't skimpy like street tacos often look. It's a shame we were too full for dessert. We will be back soon!

fjWdj9Xnsh_TrVaLb3bPeQ.text: Had really good Beef Enchiladas with very savory beans. Little bit noisy but good service Very recommended

JvcCK1QaABRoS6m_FQxBVg.text: Erin was THE BEST! Her energy and recommendations were perfect for us. We enjoyed the 3 Wild Mushroom enchiladas and La Diabla Chicken pasta...after the very yummy guacamole. If we lived here, this would be a regular stop for sure.

mM6VjTST2CT_eZsXgsIM0Q.text: Amazing food and great staff! The chef came and introduced himself to us, the manager introduced himself as well. Everyone was awesome and the food was authentic Mexican food! I highly recommend Cocina Madrigal. Will definitely be coming back again and again and again.

xJFj0giHq5QoEiW0mKaHaA.text: This place was amazing! I can't believe I have passed this place over 100 times and have never seen it. This is definitely one of my new favorite Mexican restaurant.

eJxrppCX7VsMM6ACJF6myA.text: The food was amazing! Leo is an amazing chef and very talented! We had the trio, tacos and green chili enchiladas. We devoured everything. Can't wait to go back!!

HH98YUv9rDtx-y6yap0GuQ.text: I'm not normally a reviewer but I couldn't leave without sharing a note! This place is awesome! So fresh! I had the steak tacos and fish taco along with chips and guacamole. I'm from Dallas and have had my fair share of tacos. This place blew everything I've know out of the water! I'm shocked there wasn't a line out the door! The service was also exceptionally friendly! I highly recommend a stop in!

NLWlsN-VZZkKeCx0ndHyLQ.text: Amazing service. Amazing food. We had the queso fundido, mushroom enchiladas and tacos. Best fundido we've ever had, hands-down. We will most definitely be back. Soon.

NxT67Un5hpijPqnMmv55JQ.text: Do Not Miss This Place. So jealous of the people who live near here. Meat comes from local farm and melts in your mouth. Fully lives up to its 5 star reputation. Wait staff is delightful and chef came to our table to ensure we were having an excellent experience

Um20lKqhRZQ31dcO94rk-g.text: So delicious!! Will be back. Steak tacos are insane, al pastor good too. Service was great.  Only wish it was a bit less expensive ($66 for lunch for two adults and one toddler, including one margarita).

OfPEFG-kLxCLCEGeTBuNeA.text: Stopped here after our flight and HAD to come back before we left town. Love the crew, so friendly and helpful. The food.......oh my.......the food. Have you ever seen the videos were a baby is giving their first bit of something yummy and their shoulders start to bounce up and down in pure joy? Ya, it's like that! I will fly back to AZ just to eat here!!

e-HdCZIcLXfYLbh6gaVzgQ.text: Soooooooooooo good. Drinks were strong, food was hot and fresh.  Plus the have a decent happy hour.  Staff was really cool and friendly as well.  Pretty sure i'll become a regular, it so close to home.  Glad they decided to open on the south side

ViWWJmc9asLDU-yWyGUbgw.text: If you go there, order the Trio appetizer which is Chips with Salsa Sauce, Guacamole and the Oaxaca Fundido (delicious).  Do not miss the Oaxaco Fundido which has sausage, spicy with jalapenos.  And they make it with cheese everything melted in a small pan.  I ordered the Wild Mushrooms Enchilada for entree.  As the reviews say, it is phenomenal.  Oh and don't forget to order the Churro with the creamy sauce

YTSnr0DUwRVBsCWstvpiSA.text: Wow! The trio appetizer was incredible goodness and the mushroom enchilada was out of this world! Also had a barbacoa enchilada and the worst part was deciding which bite to enjoy next! :-) Truly outstanding fresh food with terrific service! Would go WAY out of my way to eat here and can't wait to come back.

ms2H2GB8eTrQD2xAWPVCdQ.text: Highly recommend this place. Great service and the food is even better. The owner/chef came out to greet us and told us about himself and the place. Freshly made tortillas on-site, and the bartender knows what he is doing! Definitely coming back.

QM1uGP8tapkaeF1WGH6pwA.text: We have had Mexican food from coast to coast, New York to Austin to San Diego, and none was better than here. Super friendly staff( the chef even came out to say hello), nice sized portions,  reasonable prices, and a varied menu, not all strictly Mexican. We had the hatch green Chile pork, Achiote chicken quesadilla, and a create your own assortment of tacos. Clean and nicely decorated.

_w8pYMyX61U50A4U3WXP9Q.text: We came here after seeing the reviews on Yelp and it did not disappoint. Eduardo was an amazing host from the moment we entered to when we left. He went over the menus with us and when we ordered, he recommended things without being too pushy. Definitely would come back here when in town.

6vMjwTRh8_TjsyHohASHxw.text: We made a quick stop for the steak tacos before our flight!!  Homemade tortillas. Delicious and creative toppings. Great friendly staff!  Go!!

hq8ZQOlRjg6yaP6DvyT1CA.text: Great food and great service close to the airport. I was just looking for a place to get some Mexican food close to the airport, and this little home in the wall beat my expectations.  I've had some pretty crappy Mexican food in Phoenix before, but this place is a world of difference. It's a little small, but it was a nice low key atmosphere. Their menu is streamlined, so you won't find everything here,  but what they serve is all top notch. I was hoping they had fajitas (they didn't), but that was my fault for not checking the menu, so I can't fault them for that since you can see their menu online.   Between the 8 of us, we ordered just about everything on the menu. We had the steak tacos, the fish tacos, the soup, burritos, and the churros. Everything was mouth wateringly good.  (Almost as good as Austin. )

XYlEcUz_z0_68MIF6FrKqA.text: Lives up to the great reviews. Extraordinary food - authentic and fresh. Fun atmosphere with terrific service. A bargain for the quality of food.

Pxa6A-djgayAfkw8IAt0gw.text: Out of this world! Delicious food, generous portions, accommodating staff. The head chef and owner greeted us and chatted with us for a few minutes, followed with thanking us for visiting. We watched him do this with each table throughout our visit. The head chef use to work at the corporate level of Ztejas, which I had loved, and then he quit when Ztejas got new leadership. Their loss. We will definitely be back. Green Chile pork verde appetizer is a must!

HlerWeh4pbZGAHq62OU1kQ.text: Wow this Place!! Eat here do not pass up the opportunity to have excellent food at reasonable prices ! We have dined in many many high end restaurants and have not left as satisfied and happy as in this little place. We were hesitant to step in but with so many reviews we just had to try it.  We are not snobs just leery of some places that don't look as nice. It is Plain. The music is not our style  and was at times annoying ( just being honest) but by the time we enjoyed desert our toes were tapping. Hahahh

Yp3HZ-6p9Zjsggm9WcxJgA.text: This is a quaint restaurant but do not let that fool you. The food is fresh and delicious. Staff are very friendly!

vDyUpyDajdtdmwNyyhMwPA.text: Stopped by here on a visit to Tempe and walked away with a full belly and a smile.  The tacos bring an authentic flavor and style while the habanero salsa was a delicacy with the perfect amount of spice.  To cap it off...the churro...amazing...enough said because it's nap time!

sOloSEZu1Ns2whjlZ8PjEg.text: Delicious find!  The barbacoa enchiladas were delicious!  The staff is super nice and attentive!  The owner also cooks and came by to ask me how it was.  Awesome place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros!!!

JYPwGSlrHJ-7fMFHqP1mjA.text: Really good stuff, worth the trip there, the tortillas are the best around

My8Dd-AJtlNDSK5HSn3LJQ.text: Great food at great prices. We really enjoyed the guac and chips and margaritas to get started. Everyone in our table of 7 enjoyed their entrees,  and were too full for dessert. But we brought home some coconut cream pie to enjoy later, and we were glad we did. Excellent!

4V5RBYBPpwKOL1aFuTEvhw.text: Great food. Great service. The kind of place you want to succeed. Even the freakin' beans are delicious. Go. You will be glad you did.

jTWQn_yag5UgXNcKwp4CVA.text: Incredible food with a unique twist on the typical Mexican restaurant. We keep coming back for the great food and the staff that treats you like a neighbor!

XDH5-DbwfEpMZcGgTUlwwg.text: Went to  Cocina Madrigal based on reviews. Got the wild mushroom enchiladas and my guy got the birria enchiladas. We also ordered the guacamole.  OMG!!! EVERYTHING was on point. This place has some of, if not the best, Mexican food I've ever had. The staff is really friendly, AND the service was excellent!  I will definitely return, during my next visit to Az...

Byff2fdLRtQ_fHU1NlKJQQ.text: Excellent service! Good food and drinks. Unassuming exterior but definitely worth a stop. Would definitely eat here again.

v-2i3Q-vbZ29orQ8sUdV2g.text: Refreshing menu, fantastic food, and fabulous service. Definately a must if I am in Phoenix again.

plHro9ffkPDAlLmma-VEKw.text: This was one of the best dining experiences my family and I have had in a long time!  We tried Cocina Madrigal based on all of the 5 star Yelp reviews, and expected a good, local 'hole in the wall' Mexican restaurant, and when pulling up, it does have that type of feel.  Eduardo waited on us, and he was so passionate and knowledgeable about the menu, I assumed he was the owner.  Turns out he is the manager, but should absolutely have his own restaurant!  He spent probably 10 minutes with us reviewing the menu, making lots of recommendations, of which we all took.  For starters we had the Trio (guacamole, salsa and queso fundido..so good).  I had 3 tacos, all of which were gourmet (Pastor, Fish and Tenderloin..the last being my favorite) plus their wild mushroom enchilada, which was amazing.  My wife had barbacoa and chicken enchiladas, both were excellent.  The owner/chef was there, and came over to visit with us a bit, very nice man.  This is a restaurant that we will 100% visit again on our next trip!

fSmtGBWaiRqw539bHNfsOQ.text: Excellent food, friendly service and Chef Madrigal is so welcoming. Love this place and everyone we take, loves it too!  Wild mushroom enchiladas are fabulous!

FXrlZjezscM4xw8L2FLiAg.text: I have always said that you can tell when the person who is preparing the food, loves the food. And this is EXACTLY what I mean. The chef loves the food and wants you to love it too. They let us mix and match things on the menu so that we could taste more than one item. To say the staff was friendly was an understatement. Every person went above and beyond!!!!!!!!!!!

PeRW2Bc9QjpR3PWzyk5zYA.text: Wonderful experience! If you love spicy, flavor and authentic food paired with genuine service, you have found your new favorite mexican restaurant. Owner/chef came to our table. Loved everything! We will be back!

ftm_LmJoLvL56VDkvy6xcg.text: After visiting the ONLY 5 star Mexican restaurant in Phoenix that we found on Yelp, my boyfriend and I left with something much more valuable than what we had expected. We felt at home the second we came in, after speaking with the people responsible for all the magic. The food was breathtaking and the margaritas were unbeatable. This restaurant feels like a home away from home!

EeKmHSXeGMiPl_kuIBJoUA.text: The mushroom enchiladas are terrific! Would definitely recommend this place. Friendly service and Great food.

hQ2D_nleSe-IebdFtDn8YQ.text: This restaurant has an unassuming outside and you have to come here and try it out. It's clean, smells good, simple menu, FREAKING DELICIOUS food. The corn tortillas are perfection, the enchiladas are amazing, the guacamole is so damn good! I'm blown away. I came in here not hungry and didn't want to stop eating. The chef who owns this place knows exactly what he's doing. The staff is very friendly and attentive. Do not pass it up.

AskwJbl4FQo0hdYfH-B26g.text: Food was pretty good but the service was really stellar. Reasonably priced. Don't let the exterior fool you, it's worth a trip.

QUceUewF-GSTP6h4cIUS7w.text: best....mexican....restaurant....ever!!!   please open up in maryland.

Lmn3LbU-BOIJql4iIYsVFw.text: Found this place tonight . I had driven by it so many times. The head chef and owner even came out after we ate and spoke with us about the food. The food itself was wonderful. The mushroom enchiladas were explosions of flavor and the queso fundido was mouth wateringly delicious . Recommend highly !!

7Z-g4KZMJTA6llxSLRw5vg.text: Amazing food and great service! Got the trio appetizer, fantastic and delicious guacamole. You can mix & match tacos, so we got one shrimp, one fish and one steak. All three were super tasty! Definitely recommend!

IWHHqqDPByt3BA3ADz8i2w.text: Being from Texas I have high Mexican food standards and this place hits on all cylinders   It was wierd that the chips and salsa were not complimentary but the habenaro salsa has a great bite to it, this is no gringo stuff  The grilled elotes come on the cob and were tasty.  I have never had a veggie enchilada but the sauce on the mushroom enchilada was amazing. Tim also suggested trying the Barbacoa with  green sauce  I'm bringing friends here the next time I'm in PHX

ChDYrYiSAgHmNPrEwmxEtA.text: Some of the best Mexican food I've ever had. And I have had a LOT. Tried 4 different types of tacos and all were exceptional. The salsa was fantastic. And the CHURROS!! OH MY GOODNESS!! Great service!

KS9MhSQjY9Ru009HzBydAQ.text: Great Mexican food!!!  Greater owner!!!  Staff is extremely helpful!!!  Definitely worth the visit!!!

HuJWekqV4tHTNbhNWD9fBw.text: Good was exceptional as was the service.  The fundido and pork verde was so tasty.   The salsa was amazing.

rpMKgrnGp4kQjcGO3_Xa_Q.text: I went on a first date at Cocina Madrigal tonight. It lived up to the 5-star review. Don't let the location put you off because this place is a gem and you wouldn't know it driving by. They get people driving Mercedes Benz and BMWs and Phoenix's finest motorcycle cops in there so you know these people know something. We started out with the Fundido for an appetizer and it was so flavorful and slightly spicy and was so good. I had the Tropical fish tacos for my entree and she had the steak tacos and we both really enjoyed them. I had a frozen raspberry margarita and she ordered a pineapple margarita and it wasn't on the menu but they made her one on the rocks and she loved it. I also ordered the Churros and those were warm and cream filled and absolutely amazing. My date texted me on her way to the restaurant that she didn't like the location where the restaurant because she thought it was not in a good location and we were both very pleasantly surprised how nice the restaurant is both inside and out on the patio. The owner of the restaurant stopped by our table to see how our meals were and was very friendly to us. I thought that was so nice of him, it just goes to show you the kind of man he is as a business owner. My date and I both decided that we will go back to Cocina Madrigal and I am excited to try their enchiladas.

fXU-hYzLAj30YfBX6MTrmA.text: Love this neighborhood gem of a Mexican restaurant. I've eaten here many times the past 6 months, introduced several neighbors, friends and out of town guests to Cocina Madrigal. Outstanding food, wonderful choices, great service and Leo, the owner, is so welcoming and awesome. I absolutely recommend this restaurant and hope you'll stop by, enjoy and support this local restaurant too.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu...seriously!

1Rm2aVhCiGEq87wfH352ug.text: Magical service. Authentic drinks. Flavorful gourmet-style food.  This place is a breath of fresh Mexican food air and the best Mexican food I've had in a long time.  It's a hole in the wall nestled off 16th and Broadway (close to the airport).  Parking is tight and it was a full house on a Saturday night so be sure to reserve in advance to avoid the wait.  From the moment we walked in the staff was very friendly and the owner/chef Leo came out and made us feel at home.    Must try: the Trio (the Oaxaca Fundido was very unique), Al Pastor Tacos (mouth-watering and out of this world!), Chicken enchiladas (the meat was sooo tender) Grilled elote (tasty but could use some kick) and of course the Churros! (crunchy and soft at the same time filled with vanilla cream).    Really appreciate the hospitality here and I can't wait to bring family and friends here to try out more yummy dishes!

bpxqBu227wZFPXSYIbj8QQ.text: I have never felt the need to leave a review before now...  We are new to the area, and have been looking for the perfect local spot, and we finally found it.  I can't say enough about the experience, but we were greeted at the front desk, seated immediately, checked on consistently by our friendly waitress, food came quick, thanked by the bartender, and had the door held for us leaving... Not to mention the AMAZING margaritas, chips, tacos, and enchiladas. We will be back!

trB6Nfv9V0plB-QOUX1Xmg.text: This place is seven stars!!!  It was awesome!!!  We had enchiladas chicken & mushroom. We had fish and steak tacos and it was FABULOUS!!!  This place has the best food I've had in Phoenix!!  A must visit anytime you are on the side of town or make a special visit. OFF THE CHARTS YUMMY!!!  The people are excellent too!!!

Hxoiu7T8joankfb91RukiA.text: We stopped here after arriving at the Phoenix airport... it's about 10 minutes away.  It was so good we stopped on the way back to the airport a week later!  The beef tenderloin tacos are 10/10 stars.  I mean... ridiculous.  The elote (corn) was also excellent, and the grilled romaine salad excellent.  Generally everything we tried was good to great, but don't skip the beef tenderloin tacos.  Yelp for the win!

Wa5g4BYBWDCrP9lYrUUAJg.text: This is probably my favorite Mexican Food spot. I love the chips and salsa, steak quesadilla, and frozen margarita. My favorite thing to order is the pie! You need to order the pie. I promise you won't be disappointed. Already counting the days until I can have it again.   Eduardo and Leo have amazing costumer service. Tom, the bartender, is always super fun to talk to. Diana was our waitress the last time we went. She is AMAZING!   You MUST eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oIfJUggABmOCczizY2nWvQ.text: Drove by this place about every weekend and have been curious. So one afternoon boyfriend and I decided to go and it was beyond amazing food. I got the chicken and beef enchiladas and he got the steak burrito and both were absolutely delicious and very authenticity home made. Got to meet the owner of the place and heard some history as he greeted everyone. Have to say I was lost for work on this place and will definitely be returning again with family. I recommend this place to everyone if you want a mama kitchen food. Being Hispanic and love to cook I will take the time to go here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GR2OedX7RljJnmB3-WN1oA.text: Our friends took us to Cocina Madrigal saying it was very delicious and amazing Mexican food. Being that they are big time foodies as are we, we were excited to give it a try. Definitely not disappointed. Cocina Magrigal is in a spot of town you wouldn't expect to get such great food or have an experience like this. The owner will come out and greet you warmly and talk about the food. You won't feel rushed, more welcomed than anything as if you were a guest in someone's home. It was a lovely time with our friends as we enjoyed our meals and each other's company. As a vegetarian I was excited to have several options and can't wait to go back and try a few different items. Everyone at our table enjoyed their meals very much. Thank you Cocina Madrigal!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Qipz-I71uM5m42_x3zE2tg.text: Went here last night with my family! It was amazing!!! Delicious food and great service. Heads up though that the al pastor is on the spicy side. Fresh salsa and guacamole, the elote is just a single large corn on the cob grilled; very good, highly recommend. We ordered a build your own burrito with the chicken, not spicy, but good. Two orders of the al pastor tacos, one with flour tortilla and the other on lettuce cups. After a few bites, had some tears bc it was a little spicy! Everything was great!

pBIuGMxFpJLHSPZL1m4k2Q.text: The second I heard about this restaurant, I started to research it.  How is it that I could pass a restaurant this amazing and this popular as often as I have in the year it has been open and I not realize it!  I'm baffled by it.  I think I know why.... South Phoenix.... Modest building....  Assumption made....  Can't be that good....  Well, I say, "assume" something and you make an ASS out of U and ME!  Clearly, I made an ASS outta someone since I judged this resto by it's "cover"!  I am excited about the fact that I turned the pages and found what's inside Cocina Madrigal to be well worth the 5 star rating.   The June International Supper Club UYE was held here, at Cocina Madrigal.  Several of us were seated at a booth/table combination.  We learned that happy hour was shortened and now ends at 6 pm instead of 6:30.  That was fine.  Several folks ordered appetizers.  I sampled the salsa and  Oaxaca Fundido.   The Oaxaca Fundido is a fairly spicy cheesey dip that can be eaten with tortillas or chips or without either.  Since I practice a low carb lifestyle, it was a pretty decent option without the chips -melted cheese with sausage, peppers and onions.  That was so delicious, I know I will order it the next time I stop by for lunch or dinner.  For dinner I had the Grilled Romaine Salad with Steak.  The salad had the perfect blend of bacon and cheese, and charred lettuce and sweet tomatoes.  While the salad could stand alone and be sufficient by it self, the standout star of my meal was the Steak.  The steak was flavorful and seasoned to absolute perfection!  It was succulent, moist and tender.  I could not have asked for a more perfect choice to top my salad!  I can't wait to return.  I'd like my own bowl of Oaxaca Fundido!  Lol.  I don't think I'll be sharing that the next time!  Buen Provecho!  Return Factor:100%

Anr1wCmr2nE8nbD4oNVVCA.text: If you are in Phoenix area looking for some authentic and delicious Mexican food, Cocina Madrigal it's the spot! Make it your next destination, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Elote&#39;

DzJ8BvYF3fXfCQ1pWQIb7w.text: This restaurant was amazing! From the service, to the chef, to every meal we ate, including the cocktails! My husband had tacos (definitely try the steak! It's delish - one of the best tacos we have ever had). I had chicken enchiladas which were perfectly cooked! The guacamole is fresh and the margaritas are well done. This exceeded all expectations. The chef also came and chatted with us, he was wonderful. Highly recommend!

-Q4RP5ahXqBX1CfFJrNQWg.text: Oh my WOW!! These were some of the BEST tacos I've ever had!! I ordered Steak, Shrimp, Chicken, and Al Pastor. I started from right to left and they got increasingly better with every taco! The rice and beans are also superbly done! Everything was so fresh and unique. If you like tacos this is a MUST TRY!! We finished the meal with a Churro. It came with a caramel cream sauce and a Birthday song! AMAZING!! I've had churros my whole life and this was hands down the best I've ever had! I can't say enough about the quality food and excellent service we received!! We will for sure be back!!

jkMNe1hU1HImvkOLbA9mYA.text: This place is in thee top three Mexican restaurants I've been to In The valley thus far I've been in Arizona for 42 years and this place stands up to the best of them we had the enchiladas they were amazing we also had some micheladas and they were amazing everything there was unbelievable the customer service was awesome and the atmosphere is great. I am very excited to go back

p0c1Kz41TYj5BwRR0XIgZw.text: Best Mexican Food I have ever had. We had the Trio, Veggie Burrito, Wild Mushroom Enchiladas and the Churros. The Mushroom Enchiladas were seasoned perfectly. It's authentic. It tastes like someone's Grandma is in the back cooking. The Churros were SOOOO GOOD. Service was friendly and super attentive. Drinks were kept full. This place is great and has a great family feel to it. A++++

-xWqVTIdhydQvfMk1cY6Yw.text: This place was SO GOOD. Peach margarita with Tajin rim - smooth and delicious. Guacamole with roasted serranos - a little spicier than I would have preferred (think whole chile including seeds) but still fresh and delicious. Mushroom enchiladas - BOMB. The mushrooms and the sauce were incredible. The red beans were a different and tasty twist. The rice was the only "miss" - it was ok but nothing special. I certainly am not complaining. I wish I had room for the amazing looking churros but I was just too full! Next time - because there WILL be a next time!!

oD33u7Z-nVSdfybQhnWr8g.text: Tom and Eduardo made me feel like I'd known them for years and just met them...so we gave them our money, that sound right? Lol.  We usually stay in Scottsdale when we come to the area, but spend our time downtown and found this place on yelp and we were not disappointed.    Homemade tortillas always get me, in a sucker for them, and this place has some of the best in the country!  The regulars at the bar made us feel like regulars, just an all around good feel.  Oh and the food here is great!! You really can't miss with anything on the menu.  We've added this to our "Phoenix Collection".  The owner even came and thanked us for coming out, we will surely make this a staple when come to Phoenix from now on!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak tacos
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak tacos

0MQMh6cO1MX7ZUM3onHfVA.text: When my hubby found this 5 star Mexican restaurant on Yelp, we knew we had to check it out.  We weren't the only ones at the bar with the same idea.  There was a man on a business trip and a couple that had driven from Mesa to check this place out.  It was absolutely worth the drive because everything we tried was exceptional.  Thomas the bartender greeted us almost immediately and made us some mean margaritas.  He recommended the fresh guacamole with only "whole fresh ingredients" (his words).  It came with salsa as well.  It was chunky and very flavorful.  I ordered tacos: al pastor, shrimp, and fish.  There was a nice char on the shrimp and they were cooked perfectly.  I'm not a rice fan, so I asked for double beans instead.  Thomas suggested I sub one of the beans for an order of roasted vegetables.  I'm so glad he recommended that.  I could eat those veggies as my main meal any day!  Hubby was very satisfied in the juiciness of the chicken in his burrito.  The couple next to us ordered the churros for dessert, but they couldn't eat them all, so they offered to share with us.  Who could turn down a churro filled with Bavarian cream?!  Not I!  I'm used to churros that I get sick of after a few bites because they are so dry, but these were the opposite.  The cream on the inside and the optional dipping sauce made these very moist and enjoyable.  Your meal will not be complete without the churros.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa comes with guac

YocGwWXS7p_Bd5-q3n0CXg.text: What a hidden gem! Oscar was a great waiter and Chef Madrigal checked in on us to ensure the food was fantastic and it was. Highly recommend!

O_Mn-Dcugr66ahV1yxs1vQ.text: We loved everything about this place! Everything!  From the time we walked in we were greeted and seated with smiles. Our server came to us immediately requesting drink orders and continued to check on us throughout our evening.   We started with chips and salsa ($1.99), a regular margarita on the rocks and a mango margarita. The salsa was sooooo good, with just the right about of hot! We were offered the hot salsa but didn't have the guts to try it   The entrees can definitely be shared! They're huge! I ordered the taco plate with house made corn tortillas. I had the steak taco, chicken and a shrimp taco. My boyfriend tried the chicken, fish and shrimp tacos. We loved every single one but the steak one by far stood out the most! The steak was seasoned and cooked perfectly, loved the fried onions that accompanied the tacos, l loved the cheese on it (Gorgonzola maybe). Man, they were good. Next time I'll be sure to get 2.   We missed happy hour by 15 mins so we paid regular price ($9) but they were sooooooooo good. I MUST return soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken, shrimp and steak taco plate

ZQ4Zw2-G4M98-e6L2avU4g.text: Wow! Guacamole is very smooth, fresh and deliciously made. Please order it. The free chips are also crispy!  Had a frozen margarita to help wash down 3 tacos. I ordered the 2 steak ones and 1 al pastor.   I believe these two toppings are the gold medal toppings for tacos. If you get these 2 right, you're on to something.  Well my friends the Madrigal folks are on to something. The steak ones are paired with delicious cheese, and crispy batter jalapenos thin strips. Wonderful idea.  The al pastor tacos was also well made, a little kick to it but nothing to be afraid of.  The service here is phenomenal and makes you want to visit the place again, and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Frozen margarita

pARJ9kVbx9o777ScYOzUDQ.text: Awesome service! Great Food! This was a nice surprise. We looked it up on Yelp for a dinner date night. Our server Yas was so attentive and nice. She definitely made our night special. The ambiance is good too. It's not expected to be this good since it looks run down from the outside but it is clean and nice inside. I recommend and can't wait to come back again!

b9fdvq5lRGJHHmyK6azrew.text: Wow! The food at Cocina Madrigal is amazing and divine! My wife and I recently visited for dinner and started with the Trio, which is an assortment three appetizers. The first appetizer was the Chips & Salsa which was a solid start to the meal with crisp tortilla chips and fresh flavorful salsa. The second appetizer was the Guacamole de Casa. The guacamole was creamy with fresh-diced onions, tomatoes, and jalapenos. The final appetizer was the Oaxaca Fundido. This addictive dish was basically a melty cheese dip (Oaxaca Cheese) filled with tender mushrooms, meaty local sausage, and caramelized onions. For the entree I had some of the best enchiladas I have ever tried: the Wild Mushroom and Barbacoa Green Chile Enchiladas. A soft warm tortilla was filled with juicy tender mushrooms and topped with a creamy flavorful mole sauce. The other enchilada was filled with rich tender beef and topped with a lightly spicy green chile sauce. Overall, this was some of the best Mexican food I have ever had.  Cocina Madrigal will be my first stop next time I'm in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole de Casa
