Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oaxaca Fundido

O5DU5zsxDNsX9sciYz7bqg.text: Fantastic!  We just moved to Arizona and have been searching for really good Mexican food. Husband and I tried to go here around 6:00 on Saturday and it was packed. We decided to try it the next day around 4:00 and no problem. We sat at bar and got great service from Daniel. He recommended a dish for my husband that turned out to be too spicy for him. Daniel informed manager who insisted on having a different entree prepared for him. It was the mushroom enchilada. What a treat!  Everyone extremely friendly and helpful. This is our go to Mexican restaurant from now on. Thank you, Eduardo.

UvyCFfYdo11inuk3-G59Ug.text: I went here because I saw it has good yelp reviews & is close to my friends house. Food was fresh & tasted great. I ate chips, salsa, guacamole & tortilla soup. The salsa was my favorite! Happy hour prices are good too. The staff is really friendly & you can tell their putting in the effort to grow the business. There was plenty of free parking in the lot & on the street. I will definitely go back

nlT6fbF6hk1N1PxjSRTI-g.text: The food was out of the world ... margaritas were great  ... service was excellent  ... your rating was well earned

pyoVDoEM8-X9Ji0VXDl9Rg.text: After my family and I left the airport, I happened to find this fabulous Mexican spot. I live in Dallas so I am a huge fan of Tex-Mex Cuisine. The food was comforting and had unbeatable flavors. The tacos have to my favorite part! The beef tenderloin taco was the best thing on that menu. The mushroom enchilada was unlike anything I've had before. I definitely recommend both those dishes. The service was great and everyone was welcoming when we entered.

-4aGbRMxeWLGzU16SyPVUQ.text: I been wanting to try this place that friends have talked about for a while now. Well I moved a month ago and noticed I was only 2 1/2 miles away. So I took my son and we both had 3 tacos (Steak, Chicken, and Shrimp) and the Flavors and Taste were A M A Z I N G and the rice and beans were also perfect. I must say these were  probably the best tacos I have ever had and the Service by Elizabeth was Top Notch.  The only bad thing is that this place is 2 1/2 miles away from me.

LpshZCA8hxSkPhBrNx_Dqw.text: Worst expiriance ever! Do you want to expiriance gentrification first hand please go to cocina madrigal. I could honestly say we were the only mexicans in the establishment and were treated with less attentiveness then all the other non-Mexican people ,remember this is a Mexican food restaurant. I was there with my family try this 5 star place it was a party of 4. We were served by Jasmin I believe and as soon as a larger party showed up we never saw her again we saw a gentlemen that was left in charge but had no idea of what was going on and one nore girl that i didnt get her name. Well we order chips and guac to start they never made it to pur table but the white cuple that had just sat down gpr their chips and guac ASAP and i mean ASAP but not us. My son had asked for side of beans, also never made it only mines did so he stayed waiting we asked for limes never made it and when I adressed this to them they just said sorry and when on to continue tp help her larger party. The food is not great and its not authentic Mexican food, beans are from can and salsa is from a tostitos jar. If you like and know mexican food you will know this is not the place for you.  Si eres hispano no apoyes este lugar. Usan nuestra cultura y nuestros sabores para americanos Y despues nos tartan como que estorbamos y no nos quieren.

Fvo62HJ3RNZr2ins_8M7WQ.text: This place is amazing!!!!! Simple place with the best Mexican food I've ever had. We loved everything we ordered. You absolutely have to try Oaxaca Fundido. The BEST!!! You cannot go wrong with anything you order. The service was excellent too. Our server was attentive, fast, and friendly. This is an authentic Mexican food and we LOVED it!

FZFklWBsruJDaQEWdSN8dw.text: I was looking for a good Mexican Restaurant and came across Cocina Madrigal.  A five star rating?  Never saw that before with 400 plus reviews.  We Ubered over and all I can say is this place is a five! Simple menu, everything made from scratch, great ingredients and super staff!  Chef Leo came by twice to say hello and make sure we were happy.  We had guacamole appetizer, burrito, mixed enchiladas, margaritas, draft beer and house made coconut cream pie to die for!  Food right down to beans and homemade chips were excellent.  Hatch Chile sauce is awesome.   I can't say enough about home great CM is!  Thanks Chef Leo, can't wait to come back next time I'm in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The owner/chef checking on his patrons.  This man truly understands customer service!

mesqHCMfOieH9kiceJGAug.text: Excellent guacamole, terrible shrimp tacos.  The shrimp tasted like they came from the Gulf.  They basically tasted like dirt.  I enjoyed the fish tacos, margaritas, and the guacamole and salsa.  The restaurant itself was clean and gives good customer service.  No changing table for babies but other than that it's casual enough for kids.  When you open the female restroom the bathroom door almost hits the toilet so I recommend not using the restroom unless you absolutely have to.  I am petite so it wasn't too bad but I can't imagine what it's like for taller people.  The parking lot is small but there is street parking surrounding the area.  I would definitely return for the guacamole!

VUQx1imorNhorTJgxdQXaQ.text: Great food, awesome service. 5 stars is well deserved. The owner/ head chef came out and met us, a very nice man who's passionate about the whole experience. Eduardo took care of us at the bar, he's the man. He's a Dodgers fan - but nobody's perfect.

iZ96MVjtVHNN9RSxLbzjJQ.text: Excellent. Start to finish delicious. I would recommend the guacamole and any of their tacos. Stellar.

m6Q1AwdLUIT1irhWbiPkLw.text: Can I give it 10 stars? Best steak tacos I've ever had. Guac was superb. Simply the best. Yum yum yum! Go now!

d4BYEXf5EESFl-YpBzbiWA.text: Cocina Madrigal is not your usual Mexican Restaurant. It's better....It's elevated Mexican Food. The Owner/Chef is a well seasoned Chef originally from Central Mexico and serves  carefully detailed Oaxaca/American Cuisine. Everything is made from scratch and tortillas are cooked to order. They offer interesting detailed food that you are not going to find at other restaurants. This is also a family friendly restaurant so that means pricing is very reasonable.  We started with Chips and Salsa. The Chips were hot and fresh and seemed free of oil. The salsa was delicious and full of flavors. It also was spicy.  For my meal I tried the Artichoke Mushroom Cilantro Pesto Marinated Chicken in Soy Mustard Cream and Pepitas. It came with fresh buttered vegetables and really great mashed potatoes. The chicken was so delicious. It was very flavorful and cooked to perfection with this delicious char. All the flavors were really great!  It doesn't say on the menu but you can mix the tacos. My husband ordered Three different tacos with rice and beans. EACH AND EVERY TACO WAS SO DETAILED. The Beef Tenderloin was marinated in  Chipotle and Pomegranate. This taco also contained fried peppers, gorgonzola cheese and fried onion straws.....This was a really detailed delicious taco. The achiote braised Chicken Taco with Menonita Cheese and the Tropical Fish Taco were great too! I'm kicking myself now for not tasting the rice and beans because my husband said they were very good. He said the rojo beans epazote were exceptional and not the usual refried beans you get everywhere else. He said these were really delicious. I will try them next time.  We had the churros for dessert. I have to say that these were the best churros I ever had. They were FRESH MADE TO ORDER and were stuffed with pastry cream and covered in just the right amount of sugar and cinnamon. They were also came with dipping cream. they were crazy good.  The whole staff and owner were very friendly and welcoming. They also wanted feedback on all their food.  This restaurant is a Great Addition to Phoenix!

lXYiu0AQYCRSyRa9vzNP3g.text: I stopped in here because of all the 5 star reviews on here. I should have looked at the menu first because I did not see anything I would eat. I was not impressed with the dish choices. I ordered a margarita which was delicious and chips & salsa but found the salsa too spicy. Just not my cup of tea.

wGSTxOQ3Ite_HB8WDusRPg.text: Definitely 5 stars.  I wish I'd ordered more from the interesting menu.  Chef-owned restaurant, and he's there every day.  The leftover green chile pork barely made it home.  Best restaurant salsa I've had in I-don't-know-how-long.  Ditto for the traditional margarita on the rocks.  Even the chips had something special about them.  Great service on a comfortable patio.  Impressive clientele for such an out of the way place. The price of the margarita seemed high (we had one each and it was 50% of the check), but the drink was expertly crafted and in a different (e.g. less casual) venue I wouldn't question the price. Anyway, it was worth it.

ZIT4IliiLAnK9p7qpG7CTA.text: This place is amazing! The space is pretty small, but very welcoming and homey. It's also a little out of the way but absolutely worth every minute!

9-TmrwYtR3nwX9HJNe0IQg.text: One would not expect to find a gem like this in an area of Phoenix that is far from fancy, yet here it is. On the recommendation of a friend I came here to try their wild mushroom enchilada, which came with the usual accompaniment of rice and beans. The flavors were amazing - notches above any enchilada dish I've had before, and I am a big enchilada fan. Chef Leo Madrigal really knows his stuff! The grilled elote I ordered as a side was also very good; the tender grilled sweet corn was coated with with a flavorful creamy cover that held on generously to the crumbled cojita cheese it was rolled on. My server was very friendly and attentive and the restaurant itself has a very casual atmosphere, quite relaxing even with multiple TV screens playing sports programs. Prices are good, especially considering the quality of the food. I am definitely compelled to come back; the flavors are too good not to experience again and definitely I also have to try the desserts which I did not have room for after this very satisfying meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild mushroom enchiladas with rice and beans
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild mushroom enchilada
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled elote

7m4f8g3Bhv1oETwTBrP7Iw.text: Not far from the airport, my family dropped by for dinner before a drive to Tucson.  We were all impressed by the creativity of the chef here.  Entrees were so flavorful!  Really good food.  The meals were put together with fresh ingredients intended to blend together in uniquely delicious ways.  Tasty!  We'll be back!

QQjFmRnZKorDRtf2gzymfA.text: We heard about this restaurant from a co-worker. We love finding new Mexican restaurants so we gave it a try being new to the area. It stands out with the cute style and the string lights outside. From the moment you walk in the staff is very welcoming and friendly. We started with the freshly made guacamole and chips for an appetizer. This was to die for. They make it as they are ordered, it is not pre made. We are huge on good guacamole so right there made this our go to place. The wild mushroom enchilada was delicious. The house margaritas are tasty as well. Definitely order the churros for dessert! The owner himself came by after we ordered and said he would love to get feedback as it's a new restaurant. This place definitely met our expectations. We keep telling friends about it and have continued to go back. They need more restaurants like this in Southern Phoenix.

U6ZCE3UqmK6oFK5JhTM6dQ.text: FINALLY! Cocina Madrigal fills South Phoenix's need for a quality sit-down restaurant. The menu is not a huge but it has great variety and everything looks incredible. I had a hard time choosing between the shrimp and chicken tacos and after a brief convo with the manager (who waited on us because they were unexpectedly short staffed) and telling him my dilemma, he gave me a "say no more" look--initiative that I personally enjoy--and brought out 2 shrimp tacos and a chicken taco. They were both delicious and made with fresh tortillas, but the shrimp was my favorite. My husband ordered the al pastor burrito (one of the best he's had) and frozen margs for each of us, which didn't skimp on the tequila. The chef came out at the end to check up on us and introduce himself.  Long story short, Cocina Madrigal combines high-quality dining with a neighborhood-cafe vibe. We're so excited to have this gem in in South Phoenix and can't wait to bring people here instead of having to travel north for good food!

_PoJlAjpx0wn76Jt5Dv0wg.text: This friendly Mexican restaurant serves up superb food.  We enjoyed several of their taco and enchilada choices and all were delicious.  Had wonderful margaritas too.  If you want genuine Mexican food, this is the place.  Highly recommended.

WRlqSaCZnczXF1woXYoYUw.text: Not much to look at from the outside, but the food and ambience inside is worth the adventure. I always prefer chef-owned restaurants, and Cocina Madrigal delivers!  Try the wild mushroom or Barbecoa Hatch green chile enchiladas. They were my favorite. Also, the guacamole appetizer is amazing--they make it fresh for you after you place the order. I plan on visiting this place regularly.

ggz5U2P23hdU-Jzp1-2spg.text: This place is down the street from our fabrication shop - it seems really out of place to find such a high quality Mexican restaurant tucked in to a dirty industrial area but don't judge the place based on its location. The food is good - all of it. They came over promoting the place when it opened so we bought up a variety of things to try out, and everything, without exception, was really good. It was better three days later than most places around here are at their best. Definitely worth a shot!

ruVLVolwteSC97kZ4LnFzg.text: Awesome enchiladas. Very good Mexican food. Best enchiladas I've ever had. Very good service.

7wumk-qXlsI4eS2yeYaYew.text: Great experience all around! We are visiting from Seattle and found this spot on Yelp, it was worth the drive. The wait staff was exceptional, place was clean and inviting. The food was amazing, tacos had great flavor, and the churros were to die for!

uOTDQPVf65hOmHCEOBw0mw.text: IT WAS SO GOOD. If you want Mexican food that has FLAVOR, you must go here!!!! The costumer service was excellent, they always meet your requests. If you are vegetarian, like my family, they have lots of options. THE FOOD WAS TO DIE FOR. You will not regret a visit here I promise!!! if you were to get one thing, GET THE GUACAMOLE. Everything is homemade here from the guacamole to the tortillas.

em12NCluZ3nSBZvsgSdd5Q.text: The food and service at this establishment were exemplary! Every last dish was delicious and our rowdy table of 10 ladies were treated with the upmost care and attention. Down to the kitchen attempting to accommodate a dietary need with off menu choices. The chef even visited our table twice to thank us. A must go!

A3XAi-GCVPRmoLzisQY0qQ.text: Nothing but great things to be said about this restaurant! Frozen house margaritas may look small but they sure pack a punch! We've enjoyed the enchiladas, which come in a set of 2 and you can mix and match, and their tacos, which come in a set of 3, and you can also mix and match. We've enjoyed all 4 options for the enchiladas and were very impressed! We will definitely be back!

NS6jMAFtg-UZLNSOUC2h8w.text: Food was absolutely amazing! Seasoned vegetable tacos were to die for and the chimichangas were very filling. Beans and rice were perfect sides- rice had amazing seasoning. Overall  food was a 10/10. Customer service also couldn't have been better.  The hostess was sweet and very attentive keeping our drinks filled. Our waiter kept up great conversation and was super helpful with directions as well! (We're not from the area). Chef came to our table to ask how our meals were... overall would say this is a must visit if in town!

1DASDM_O2q4DsurD6Wr5Bw.text: Excellent, fresh food.  Had the dip trio and 3 shrimp and seafood tacos. The beans and rice are also exceptional in my opinion.  Just the way that I would make them.   Enjoyed every bite.  The margaritas were excellent as well. Great service.   I'll be back real soon!

1qLT7CeyBgR9JryAPZ7VQw.text: Fresh with great food and service. Really good dessert!! I usually don't order dessert but I will make sure to save room when we go back. Good food combinations especially if your tired of the same old same old. Chocolate cream with nuts, churros with yummy sauce, pomagranats, coconut slaw, mango.... BIG burritos.

XR8yF105uHZdj7_nLJWFhg.text: Had to try Cocina Madigral based on all the positive comments on our neighborhood app. It did not disappoint! We went for happy hour...started with some drinks which were excellent. Zay was our server and did a great job. We tried the fundido, chicken quesadilla and guac/salsa appetizers. All the food was super fresh and very tasty-the real thing. Even the tortillas were amazing. Jason the general manager came by and chatted with us for a bit, as did Chef Leo. They are both very welcoming and looking for any type of feedback. This is truly a wonderful place and we will continue to visit. Can't wait to bring our out of town friends there next time they visit. This is a must try place.

1ExgNnxbACiBJj7HyYKbQQ.text: Since moving to Phx from LA,  I was so homesick for real authentic Mexican food that I don't have to cook myself.  Wow...this place is phenomenal.  It's a cute humble place from the outside and when you step inside you are immediately greeted with a smile.  Their made to order Guacamole was done with just the right amount of chiles so it's not too spicy but a great sabor.  I had an enchilada de pollo in hatch green chile sauce that was beautifully done!  I also had an enchilada de birria that was insane.  The meat was so juicy and the sauce...spicy and balanced perfectly.  I'm super picky about rice and I loved theirs.  That's very rare for me.  The churros with creme anglais...I thought I was going to cry they were so good.  They took me back to so many happy memories of Mexico.  Thank you so much for all of the love you put into your food.  It truly shines through.  I'll be back to try everything on the menu.

mKUK62XXfb4qdigZFQfs8A.text: i cannot explain to its entirety how amazing this place is! my family and i all ordered tacos and i gotta admit, it was one of the best tacos i've ever had in a long time, and that's saying a lot from a taco fanatic. i had tacos from tacobell a few days before eating in cocina madrigal and... yo... incomparable. and i love tacobell so much. but tacobell will never offer what cocina madrigal offers: great food and amazing service. the staff treated us as if we were family friends, they went extremely kind and helpful and open to our suggestions and critiques about the food. i've had gourmet tacos made by highly trained chefs from new york, trash 99 cent tacos from jack-in-the-box, street tacos, but yoooooooooo... the tacos at madrigal are a GAME CHANGER.

YnoHq0w3g38sgLQTF04bsw.text: This was an amazing meal. We went to the restaurant on a whim....we were looking for a Mexican restaurant by South Mountain and this was close by. We were all hungry. We first ordered the guacamole with caramelized pineapple... pretty darn good. Then the dinner menu was amazing....I ordered the mango steak salad.... the steak was so tender and juicy and the mango combined with the sweet/salty/spicy pecans added so much flavor and uniqueness, every bite was different. My son ordered the beef tacos and said they were the best taco's he has ever had. His friend ordered the mushroom enchilada's and said they were fantastic. He said he's not a mushroom person, but the menu description made him curious to order them.... he could have easily licked his plate. Then we all shared a churro cream dessert. To die for...... there was leftover cream and I used my finger to try to get the last bite (I know, gross) but I should have asked for a spoon to get the last remains. Also the Margarita's were AMAZING. Everything on this menu was spectacular.... we did meet the humble Chef, but I didn't even ask his name.  Next time in town, I'll ask and order something different, just so I can explore the other dishes.  This place is the real deal.  Great food, great service and wonderful Chef.

6hwmur2uiR_cDWGwRufU5Q.text: Received some info on this new restaurant and checked both Google and Yelp reviews before making the trek here from south Chandler. Let me just say this for starters....it was well worth the trip. Looks very unassuming from the outside and the inside was not fancy at all but the food and staff were both FANTASTIC! Went with a party of 6 and were greeted by a very friendly hostess. Waitress was also super nice, attentive and helpful with everyone's choices. We had 2 appetizers the bacon jalapeno guacamole and the Oaxaca con Queso.  Wow. These both blew us away with flavors and freshness. Most of us had frozen margaritas with the apps and our group raves about them too. Then came the entree's. Everyone ordered something different and I watched as each person took their first bite and the happy look on their faces. We all tasted little bites of each and not a single one was less than really delicious. Then came dessert which was their version of Churros and also a slice of Coconut cream pie. We split it up between us and once again the smiles were on everyone's faces. Top this off with really reasonable prices and you have a winning combo for sure. The owner came by several times and talked with us before and after dinner and he was very genuinely happy that we came so far to try his food. We assured we would be back often. Wherever you are in the valley it's worth the trip to come to this little gem in S. Phoenix. Can't wait to return and try more of their delicious food. Finally have found a unique Mexican inspired restaurant that is affordable and one that any foodie would enjoy!

it89s37nV5Q5LW2PW_0JVQ.text: Just flew into Phoenix for the first time and happened upon this establishment and wow, what a pleasant surprise. The food was amazing - fresh, tasty, packed with flavor and to top it off the staff were genuinely friendly and inviting from the moment I sat down; it's immediately clear how much pride they take in what they're doing here. This place is something special and is worth every bit of your time.   P.S. try the mushroom enchiladas for an unexpectedly delicious treat. I'm a thoroughbred meat-eater but this blew me away.

vgWGfrB1XJciS8c8Bgsz-A.text: My son & I were in town for spring training & were hungry when we got off the plane, found this place on Yelp & were so happy we did! Definitely deserves every 5 of the stars. Staff is very friendly & efficient. Best guacamole & tacos! The owner came out to check on how we liked the food & he was so great to talk to. Will definitely recommend to our family in Phoenix & will be back!!

xQ4flJ6JJoNe6MbYLBQlDQ.text: This place did not disappoint. Traveling from out of town look them up on yelp and the food was fantastic! The wild mushroom and enchiladas are to die for and a green salsa Verde enchiladas were magnificent!  Highly recommend!

uGGVZhBzRj_B1MIc5IJC9A.text: The guacamole was to die for. The tropical fish tacos were to die for also. I was not crazy about the portion size of the enchiladas. The beans were good but I'd rather them not be whole. Overall a good experience. I would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Aw1YKb2dtLSkEpNHyqMhlA.text: Great! First visit, Shrimp tacos were loaded and tasty, beef tenderloin tacos were off the charts creative and delicious. Barbacoa lean and tasty. Desserts are home made and terrific! What puts this place at the top of the list though are the people. Servers were pleasant, informative and they worked together. Every server treats every table as if it were their own. A visit from the Chef/Owner just enhanced a great evening!

xtL-NGCQ4Roc9XlvCUQyig.text: Such delicious, fresh and homemade food with wonderful and attentive service. A must stop!!!

DMtBBomwUgWI_uwnLjAVjQ.text: Amazing! Loved this family-run gem. Don't get thrown by the exterior and surrounds, this place is casual dining with a refined twist. The menu has all your favorites with surprise flavors (please see beef tenderloin tacos with a chipotle pomegranate marinade).  The wild mushroom enchiladas were by far my favorite item.   I am usually a margarita on the rocks girl but the frozen margaritas is where it's at here.

wQPyHAqcxiaog06JedmL0g.text: The food was the best Mexican food I have ever had and I have!!!! Everything was perfect, food, margarita, service, just a great vibe.  The chef owner came out to our table to chat, very nice.  A big thank you to our server,  Yasmin who took excellent care of us

Ezyl9cMy4OSFGRHtziweJw.text: The slow roasted beef was extremely tender.  I had the Barbacoa Green Chile Enchiladas.  The wait service very friendly!  The restaurant is cozy too.  I'll be sure to be back.  Came in at 1130 am Wednesday.

YwZfqVenrES4OYFS-LC-Cg.text: Wow!!! What a gem! Just heard about this place thru another online review so feel I need to pay that forward.   Great food with a super friendly and attentive staff. Guac is some of the best I have ever had. All things made fresh as you order them.  The owner even came out to the parking lot as we were leaving to thank us for coming in (he was in the back when we left and didn't get to see us inside).   Give this place a try. It's new and is just what the area needs to provide some great food and service options above and beyond the over abundance of fast food spots in the neighborhood.  A++!!!

o-XPIVkZK7wOGYolDNu6mA.text: This place is pretty awesome, food is very good, drinks even better. The chef/owner is very hospitable and willing to create anything you like. The queso fundido was excellent as were the tacos. Several other menu options seemed good so I'll be back!

NLjKlpDObhOP6Ntvu-jvfQ.text: Best steak taco in the valley. The meat is seasoned and cooked perfectly. The fried peppers and onlions complement it perfectly. I hadnt ever tried gorgonzola before. Had i noticed the menu listed it i would've surely requested a different cheese be substituted. I was of the opinion that I didnt like blue cheese of any variety. Now its a must on top of my steak. Thank you cocina madrigal for broadening my horizons and making food worthy of praise. Eduardo the AM bartender is one of the best food service workers ive ever come across. After 20 years of working in the industry I assure you you wont be dissapointed if you try this restaurant.

k8SgPVyORcGaSgz9sHh5XA.text: I live down the street from this place and have passed by it every day for months. Finally my roommate suggested we try it and we arrived to a full parking lot which was a great indicator for the beginning of the evening. We were promptly greeted and seated in a nearly full restaurant. A young lady came to the table and offered to get our drinks and chips and salsa. As she walked away our server, Eduardo, came to the table to say he was taking care of another table but would be right over. We got our waters and freshly fried chips and salsa. The chips were light with a perfect balance of salt and weren't saturated in oil. The salsa was a great balance of heat, acid and salt.   Eduardo came to the table, welcomed us and covered the menu in great detail. He suggested the Al Pastor taco, Oaxaca Shrimp taco, Beef Tenderloin taco and wild mushroom enchiladas as things he regularly eats himself. We ordered guacamole and funditito with sides habanero carrot hot sauce and hatch green chili sauce. The flavors of all were fantastic and we quickly emptied the first basket of chips. I decided to take his recommendation and ordered the tacos.   They came out very quickly and I tried a single piece of each protein. The flavors of each were distinct and unique. The al pastor was hands down my favorite with its crisp exterior, fantastic seasoning and moist center. Eduardo was attentive and made sure we had full drinks and chips. He asked how it tasted and we couldn't help but gush over how happy we were with the food and service. After a short time passed and we were slowing down he brought out a single wild mushroom enchilada for us to try. Even though we had reached what we thought was our limit to what we could we eat we took a bite and found an amazing blend of umami and vibrant chili flavors. As we had our leftovers boxed the owner/chef came to our table to see how we were doing. He had been visiting each table in the dining room and making sure each customer was satisfied. We talked about his time with corporate restaurants and his fusion of Mexican flavors with untraditional applications like pasta. We were thanked for coming in with hand shakes and invitations to come back to which we happily accepted.   The food, atmosphere and staff are beyond expectation. We plan to come back on a regular basis and try something different each time

hKzuqNxyxJ697i-HGwp7hw.text: My husband and I went here for our date night and it was really good, would highly recommend. We were seated promptly and both really enjoyed our food. Server was also awesome!

JknojWrxWNM7uXimPwl3eQ.text: I work a full-time job as well as own a small business.  Time is precious and my expectations are high.  My husband and I often eat out due to my crazy schedule, and it's one of the few times we have to relax and connect.  We first tried Cocina Madrigal because of neighbors praising it on Nextdoor.  We have been 3 times in the past 2.5 weeks, and all I can say is - WOW.  The food is consistently awesome.  Not good, not great - amazing.  Drinks are cold and delicious.  Chef Leo clearly takes pride in his work; chips come out heated, plating is gorgeous, servers take your leftovers (if there are any!) to the back to package for you to take home.  This is truly a local gem, I am so happy they move into the neighborhood.  We have had the opportunity to speak with Chef Leo a couple times during our visits, he is still making lots of changes and refinements to the menu and genuinely solicits feedback.  Same for the manager, Jason.  All in all an incredibly friendly place that leaves both your tummy and your heart happy.  While my business isn't in the restaurant industry, it is a service business and I know first hand how hard it is to create a high-performing team like the one at Cocina Madrigal.  Major props to all of the staff, their teamwork and passion shows.  Can't wait to go again and try something else new off of the menu!

WE4tF7-LfVlnh8JbDx1_oQ.text: WOW - we loved everything about this place. We came with our two year old for lunch and were immediately welcomed. The food was outstanding - fish tacos so flavorful and fresh. They made mac and cheese for our daughter and she loved the grilled veggies and fish tacos. The service was warm and prompt. The owner/chef even came by to chat with us, such a friendly man. Can't recommend this restaurant enough!!

TsbZ83ZpAUo5vkd1mm0lDQ.text: Frozen margaritas are poured from a re-invented soft serve machine- sooo good, & don't be mistaken-strong!!   I had margaritas, guacamole, salsa, elote, & dranks at the bar.. couldn't be happier!! Next time I'll try out the entrees.

Uh_i16ZkgL5ABfDOow86wA.text: Wish we lived closer because this place is the real deal! Everything we ordered was flavorful, authentic, well seasoned and delicious. Some vegetarian and gluten free options on the menu, fresh ingredients, prompt service and a casual environment. Lots of food and pricing is on point. For sure get the churros!

Lz1sVqEaQ-qx5Cm7a9v81A.text: The staff and food at Cocina Madrigal is a breath of fresh air in a city with a high Latino population, where culturally appropriated "Mexican Restaurants" with their hispter vibes receive much of the praise in Phoenix.  I went on day I was recovering from being sick so I was avoiding most foods. I had the guacamole and chicken tortilla soup, which wasn't chicken at all. The guacamole was made fresh, and maintained its creamy texture with all the typical flavors. The soup, is actually pork based, but provided a unique smoky flavor to dish. My boyfriend had the steak burrito which he loved. I tried his rice and beans and I was impressed with the flavor and kick in the beans you don't typically get.   Finally, we met Leo, the chef and owner. He checked on us multiple times and wanted our honest opinions. As a family owned restaurant I love the commitment they make to customers and receiving feedback so they can welcome you back again. He told us about the freshness of the margaritas, they don't use ice in their frozen ones, and that you can taste the tequila bc they put more when it's frozen unlike other restaurants. For that reason, the limit is 3. If a restaurant has a limit on their specialty drink, it's probably really good. Finally, Leo gave us some churros on the house. THESE ARE THE BEST CHURROS IVE HAD TO DATE. My boyfriend who can't get enough churros since I introduced them to him, was ecstatic.   We will be back to enjoy the margs for sure, and try their tacos which look amazing. Support this local business, they deserve it.

9l6utY6SqI1gObNOsMFpFg.text: We are in town from Indiana and looking for something authentic and amazing.....we found it! This place is amazing in every way! Service was top notch, the Chef/owner came out and chatted for a while, and the food was out of this world! I would highly suggest the steak tacos!

9MadUIjAC9dELHDlPwo8VA.text: I have been here 4 times now for lunch and great service and the chef and it managers always check to see how you are doing. I have had the elite. The guacamole  is made fresh and is so yummy and I have order a steak quesadilla  3 times now. Great spot and most check it out

bXWPyeXX_0vNYLTXDNydKA.text: The food is DELICIOUS, has great presentation! The staff is fast and friendly! Im definitely returning and telling my friends and family

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros with caramel
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Chile enchiladas . Sauce was full of flavor
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom enchiladas with freshly made tortillas

hMJIYKe78fqsLnrhyUlu7w.text: Had Beef Tacos and Guacamole. My wife had mango steak salad. The tacos were fantastic. The beef was really nice and covered with fried poblano pepper straws. Genuinely the best taco is ever had. A really well balanced set of flavors, not just loads of cheap meet and cheese. That pretty much sums up this place. It's Mexican food, but with real thought as to what flavors and textures work best. When I get visitors in from other cities, this will now be my go to Mexican restaurant. Also, my wife said the margarita was very nice. Finally, staff were really friendly and smiley.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Jm4XoOz0Q0WgNutrrUO_Hg.text: Great people, great food, we will be back tomorrow. Chef Leo came out and talked to us.  Open for a year and 600 reviews with 5 stars this is a must go place.

RIhU6Dn7c6_hIFDx8kL5pw.text: Had the absolute pleasure of eating here today. What a gem for South Phoenix! Everything was outstanding - from the service to the food...and the food...so DELICIOUS! Our waiter was terrific & very attentive - explained the menu and made great recommendations. The carrot & habanero salsa -- not to be missed!! My partner ordered the tacos - which he said were awesome, and  I ordered enchiladas - so flavorful and really tasty!  Some of the best I've ever eaten.  After our meal, the chef/owner, Leo Madrigal, stopped by our table and chatted for a moment.  He was gracious and thanked us for coming in. We plan in making this one of our regular dining spots. Highly encourage everyone to give it a try - you won't be disappointed!

7Mg7XYgCL1Su9vDZ4nFURA.text: great place for meeting with friends and family.  best service! the jamaican chicken was delicious with the roasted pineapple salsa! the manager was an amazing server! I will definitely be telling others about this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. DELICIOUS!! great lil mexican place in SW Phoenix. family owned.we were even served by the manager!  super friendly, quick service, and food

GHwSy7bL6vwcQMIQNI93qg.text: This place is excellent! Was in Phoenix with a bunch of work friends and we absolutely adored this food!!! Loved it so much we came back the second night.  The manager was so kind and welcoming. THIS PLACE WILL NOT DISAPPOINT ! :)

pTR--cuUcGCM1BdxMEW_sw.text: Went on a Tuesday night. Service was on point. The owner came to visit table. I ordered an assortment of tacos & the queso fundido. Everything was delicious! Cute cantina-style venue. Can't wait to go back!

pM7LJThzxaUZ8_LWEkWQsw.text: A great neighborhood restaurant.  Good food, service, prices and apparently a popular place with the regular customers.  Will return on our next trip.  There is no pretense about this eatery just a good bang for your buck.

79vjdCDeRVOvJMXjjRS6fw.text: Me and a coworker stopped in here on a whim and left extremely satisfied. We ordered the steak burrito and Barbacoa enchiladas and everything was phenomenal! The service was except and we even Got to speak with the owner and chef Leo Madrigal. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NReFXc5B19y1sI5B4CbGVw.text: What a gem!  We are visiting Phoenix and have been disappointed in some of the popular restaurants, but Cocina Madrigal single-handedly made up for all the less than positive experiences. The mushroom enchiladas were delicious. The fish tacos were great. The margarita choices fun and original (and fantastic). We will make a special trip to come back!

ErMlNm0sn4D3NLk2EXhjrw.text: Probably the best Mexican food I've had in my life. Everything from the tortillas to the chocolate cake is homemade. You can really taste the passion and love put into each dish. Would come back every time I come to Phoenix. The chef was very kind as well as the staff, so it made dining a memorable experience.

UxeznK25998ZEqrW6vE0TQ.text: Not your typical Mexican food place (at least what I'm used to) but we all really enjoyed our meals. The veggie taco was so delicious! Great salsa as well. Very good service.

w4jBIU_-PBqielMM_9zwUg.text: I don't spend much time in this neighborhood--actually never--But was here on a sale call and wanted something sit down nearby. Found this among the many Mexican restaurant options and the 5-star ratings made us decide here for lunch. What a surprise! Not your average Mexican restaurant! Truly unique flavors and combinations and not at all what we expected. I have three different tacos and all were amazing. My lunch partner said this was the best burrito he's ever had. Very fresh, very flavorful. The chef, Madrigal, served us himself! Staff was super friendly and went beyond expectations. Madrigal even opened the door for us when leaving! Superior customer service! Highly recommend.

Rqg4oavL9--pKqwoGsyAkQ.text: We had the fish and shrimp tacos, and the barbacoa enchiladas. All amazing. Great food, flavors and drinks! Small family feel with a nice location. Great job

YPRT9HZa3AYXN0eRSlNVAQ.text: Absolutely delicious.  Nestled in an older area of town, but the perks of that is getting DELICIOUS chef prepared food at a great price .  I had the tacos with made to order corn tortillas.   Also, the cream stuffed (made to order) churro with Bavarian cream & caramel dip is a must! I am interested in trying the other dishes.  We will be back for sure.

Ing-okz8NnX9Ggx_ZgWxfA.text: This place is fabulous.  Unique menu and wonderful waiters.  Eduardo was phenomenal as our server.  Made great recommendations for food choices and a fun personality.  The wild mushroom enchiladas we're AMAZING and highly recommended.  Excellent margaritas as well.  Don't pass this place by!

kNkjuDNUUmLoC5wWCbY-MA.text: I want to give more stars here. I liked the food. It was good. Nothing that I'd drive out of my way to eat, but good. I tried 2 enchiladas with rice & beans. It all tasted...just fine. Nothing wowed me. The staff was friendly and helpful. The decor inside simple but nice & it was clean. I want to give it another shot & try the tacos. Maybe I will be wowed into returning.

y70m2cPKb0qZCpD1oCe_vQ.text: Been meaning to write a review of this excellent addition to South Phoenix. Yes they are that good. The fish tacos are to die for and no trip is complete without the decadent churros. Good service and reasonable prices. What's not to like?

aG2Bd0is3fcA2svhmZw6Jg.text: Very very good! Owner was stellar and chips were incredible. Great food and service. (Some items are spicy) The rice was killer

5fwbUsRcT_3YDb3jMzBowQ.text: One of the best places I have ever eaten. I had the wild mushroom enchiladas and they were absolutely delicious. The fresh chips came with spicy salsa and guacamole that was freshly made. I can't wait to go back, and I recommend it to anyone who wants to find an excellent Mexican restaurant in Phoenix.

tTs5QzKUts599-3_Ecxr_w.text: Stopped in here for lunch w a customer per her recommendation. We were early so were the only ones here. Had quac w bacon and pineapple. Delicious.  I ordered a shrimp taco, chicken and fish taco. Very good. The chef and owner came out. I would recommend and will return

4BJOmXjcsWa6u9YFD7VCKw.text: Unbelievable! We were looking for a great local restaurant to hit before flying back home and found this place! The service was fantastic, the chef came out to ask us how we liked our food and the food....oh my, the food was delicious! And so unique!! One of the best Mexican dinners we've ever had. Great experience all around. Highly recommend!!

ArOrpLLdn0lNd4Ci92Y4eA.text: Great hidden gem in South Phoenix. Fresh and unique flavors in their dishes. We've gone a couple of times now and have not been disappointed. I recommend the Grilled Hearts of Romain with chicken; that was were fantastic. The Oaxaca Shrimp Tacos were delicious too. This restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside is well-kept with traditional Mexican music playing and a super friendly staff. The owner and chef came out to greet us which was a nice touch as well. We will definitely go back again.

jL_gr5eNw-28b4K0pwKbag.text: Yum veg food!! Host & Chef Leo were super personal and very inviting. He offered to make pretty much anything veg for us.

B49JTuvlW2TgH0FjGMcD-w.text: Very delicious! The waiter (Zay) was very friendly and attentive. You can tell that the number one ingredient in the food is love! Cute little hole in the wall and worth every penny. Portion size is perfect, menu isn't too big but it makes it easy to order especially with a larger group. This place is 5 star for a reason. These servers care about their customers. A BIG thumbs up to the owner

83or03IiCmka9ft3EYS_Ww.text: This place was AMAZING. First, Eduardo was our server. He was personable and the service was great! Chef Leo came out and explained the menu to us. Everything is fresh and so delicious. The mushroom enchiladas were so delicious---the hit of the table. Everything was so very tasty. We will definitely be back.

NC5w6LK7tP3pBbIG0UxXXw.text: This place is incredibly GOOD! The food was so delicious I over heard the server tell a customer the wild mushroom enchiladas were out of this world so I decided to try them and they totally were! My husband and daughter and I drove 25 min to try this place and we'll definitely come back! The customer service at this place is by far the best I've experienced in a long time! We are glad to have found this place!!

xGELYgXQklsZttKkzloNCg.text: This place feels like a special find from the time you arrive. As noted by other reviewers, the service here is exceptional, with all of the staff being incredibly helpful and both the manager and owner greeting most, if not all, tables. The drinks menu is excellent, with several great beers on tap, excellent and very strong margaritas, and an large selection of tequila. Food menu is fairly concise, with most of the expected selection of tacos, apps, and enchiladas. There are however a few twists to some dishes, as well as a few surprises in the menu. Was not disappointed in anything we ordered and hope to return soon.

aSbinDA2cr7zLQgLoszZog.text: Excellent!!! Read the reviews with multiple 5 star reviews, had to come try it. Well worth the risk. Fresh healthy authentic Mexican food. Service was excellent and food was even better. Chips and drinks never went empty. Very welcoming staff. Would definitely recommend.

39ZXuStuI75PgPAg63qEsw.text: We went on a Saturday night. Our waitress was wonderful!  We were a group of 7 and service was great!  The margaritas were tasty, they had frozen and on the rocks and a sangria / margarita mix. The guacamole tasted freshly made (so good we got a second order of it).  Great variety and choices some people in the group got the mushroom enchiladas and raves about them. Tacos were good too. And the Mexican chocolate cake was rich and not too spicy. Yes location isn't ideal but Would definitely return.

gvUA6IWdBRchOeDdxS73cg.text: Everything tasted great. Best guacamole, margaritas, and churros I've ever had! Service was also great.

ingUtBmB0PTwFJJxgNtoPw.text: Our first time to Cocina Madrigal. The chips and salsa were very good. That's always a good sign of what the food we be like.  The food was fantastic! The owner Leo Madrigal came over to our table, what a nice gentleman. Will definitely return again.   Brian

aD02xN94Xg_9HWjJRxP5wg.text: Found my new favorite restaurant, the food was incredible - simple menu, but everything is done well. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Will definitely be back again!

hNpx-BGNenZqpCfRZ2Ox5w.text: Absolutely the best taco spot/restaurant I've had in the area. Clean, great music, delicious food and great atmosphere! I had the three taco plate and the made to order guacamole and everything was absolutely on point. The stake, Oaxacan Shrimp and Al Pastor Tacos were delicious! To my surprise the head chef and owner Leo stopped by my table and asked how everything was and if it was to my liking. Absolutely!!! Was my reply, it is rare when a chef or owner of a restaurant comes by your table. Typically it's a manager but this was so appreciated for him to take his time to ask if I liked the amazing Tacos. I will definitely come back with my wife and kids. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Qw6nKGKeN-ijqn2PctTHhA.text: Amazing customer service! The chief came out  multiple times chat and see how we liked the food, which was also great! Highly recommend :)

Nqr_N98kRR0NXDP8Q0uf4A.text: The best beef taco I have ever had. Fish taco is tied for best with a taco I had on Maui, but that one had fish in it that had been in the ocean that morning. The wait staff was the most friendly I have had in years. A must try.

BM0ji1OwFntZ2_taCQ2q1A.text: A new restaurant in the neighborhood and we thought we would give it a try. The owner came out and talked to us and was very personable. The food was excellent! I like spicy food and most of the items have a little spice to them. Atmosphere was nice, Margaritas were good (and I dont usually care for margs). It's a local guy trying to make a go at a business. I recommend supporting! Prices are a little high for lunchtime crowds though, so we are hoping they develop a lunch menu.

PGG_6208gumwbBE8cGNgjw.text: Received a notification from yelp about Cocina Madrigal and decided to give it a try and it was well worth the drive! Located in south Phoenix close to south mountain I never expected to find this gem. Authentic and homemade food is being served in a warm and welcoming environment. But don't let the homemade fool you, the menu includes some inventive traditional Mexican dishes with a twist. For example you can add grilled pineapple,bacon, or roasted chile poblanos to your freshly made guacamole. It goes without say that the tortillas are made as your order, coming to you hot & soft. The Mastermind behind this new hot spot is Leo Madrigal. Humble man who comes out from the kitchen to meets its guest and make sure you are fully satisfy. We started our night with the trio appetizer which includes guacamole, queso fundido, and chips & salsa. I also got a blackberry margarita. They do have a limit of 3 margaritas, but trust me that's all you need. They are potent and delicious. For our entree's my boyfriend had the chile verde barbacoa enchiladas which we devoured. I had the trio tacos; 1 shrimp, 1 fish, and 1. Steak. They were all delicious but I loved the perfectly cooked fish and the steak with the gorgonzola cheese was a killer combination! For last we order the churro dessert which comes with a sweet dipping cream and it was just perfection. I am definitely visiting again to try other things in the menu which I'm sure are as delicious as everything last night. I'm sure this place will have lots of success as long as they keep doing things as they are right now. Give them a visit !

Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churro dessert . Just heavenly!

ulIh0SOEG4zq2D_Ca-cDbQ.text: Great place. Chef Leo came out and talk to us. The food and drinks were amazing.  I had the chicken enchiladas and a house margarita. One of the best house margarita I've had.  The chicken enchiladas was awesome too. My husband had a burger and he said he really enjoyed it. Great food,  awesome service.

XegtYZOy7CAsI81UveEYCg.text: This is my second time here. I'll be back many more. Awesome service and if that isn't enough these days the food is AWESOME!!!!! Haven't had anything that wasn't five star worthy here. The habanero salsa is out of this world. A must try. If you know me you know how good this review actually is. I might just be a tad bit picky. Seriously, try this place. You'll be back.

s5zSiYuN90De8G-bNOeuOQ.text: We were visiting from Kansas and all I can say is they were the best street tacos that I've had since downtown Cancun. Truly authentic. Everything was fresh from the chips to the tortillas to the guacamole.  Awesome service by Roddel. Just a great experience. I tried the chicken, steak and pork tacos. Each one was totally unique. One of them had a little bit of blue cheese which I don't like but I went with them anyway. Glad I did. Still not a fan of blue cheese but it made that taco awesome. Truly a great experience.

5qCEmYm9Bnt9ZBsoPnED0Q.text: Nice little place. Had 3 tacos (beef tenderloin, oaxacan shrimp and al pastor). All good. Also the wild mushroom and green chile enchiladas. Both very good as well. The elote appetizer with cotija cheese was tasty (we got it in a bowl vs on the cob). Lastly the churros with Bavarian creme were great.

Aju3QDsMIlGTqLdk75h0ig.text: I would give it 5 Stars but my margarita was average. BUT THE FOOD..... OMG the flavors that attack your palate are simply amazing. We went late one night, I think Halloween and everything was fresh. The guacamole was extremely tasty and they give you a decent amount. The portions overall were generous. A hidden gem in South Phoenix!!!

89tgsP5p1CUT-eyaG4UPRQ.text: Came here for the first time tonight and discovered what True love is! The staff are extremely friendly and personable; we loved our waitress and were also greeted by the chef and owner who were very kind. The house chips, salsa, and habanero sauce are divine. We also ordered the guacamole with grilled pineapple and jalepeno bacon--yumm! The fish and Al Pastor tacos were delicious but do yourself a favor and order the Beef Tenderloin Tacos. The meat is cooked to perfection and they are the perfect combination of textures and flavors.  The only negative thing in our entire experience is that we didn't save room for dessert. We will be back!

SZnnTMXyeVBRAVYovo8hWw.text: Amazing service. Great margaritas! Amazing wild mashroom enchiladas!! Highly recommended!

bAJU4ZlzvqyyuBAbAWLx_Q.text: Amazing food! The tacos al pastor and the beef tenderloin will not disappoint! Also the wild mushroom enchilada is freaking amazing! The churros and the chipotle pie are delicious freshly made desserts. Define

qCp4GdpIL2EgjJEHco975g.text: Awesome place and delicious food .  Great service and the music is making me want to dance... I'm coming back soon!

KF3iNdy24_RNXSB98Y5rmA.text: Had read a couple of good reviews of this place and it lived up to the hype. We went for Christmas Eve dinner and were given first class service in addition to great food and margaritas. The owner was onsite and came to talk to us and all the staff has a lot of pride in the restaurant and knowledge about the food, ingredients and menu. We had margaritas, the Trio appetizer of salsas, sausage Queso and fresh-made guacamole (all excellent) and steak, al pastor (pork) and shrimp tacos which were also all very good - creative yet authentic. There was other stuff on the menu I want to try next time that looked delicious, especially the mushroom mole enchiladas. We will be back and highly recommend a visit.

EdswLVVanaCdhKkNbU1vmA.text: Cocina Madrigal is a very welcome addition to the South Phoenix Mexican food scene.  The quality of the food is several notches above most of the establishments in SoPho.  The service is very friendly and they've done a nice job remodeling the interior.  We had the Hatch Green Chile Pork appetizer and the Barbacoa Green Chile Enchiladas.  Both were very good.  It was also nice to have whole beans rather than refried beans.  We'll definitely be back!

BPFc9MpGZ5XBpp4qfdwcIw.text: I seldom leave a review, but this place needs it! I was visiting from England and saw the reviews on Yelp for this place and I wanted some authentic Mexican food. Well I can't recommend this place enough, outstanding food, outstanding service and amazing food delivered quickly to your table. We spoke with the owner and the manager and they were both great people to speak to. The owner was a lovely guy with a genuine interest in making conversation with you, rather than a sales pitch. If you are local or are visiting, pay this place a visit.   A well deserved five star! Thanks for such a good meal and dining experience.

8PE7zyTbs2F8VC8ovVz5Ew.text: First time here with my husband and we were so impressed. First, service was wonderful and even though it was busy we were seated right away and had a short wait for food. The chips and salsa were yummy and the tacos were super flavorful. Don't know if I'd get the chicken again, but the pork, beef, fish and veggie were all out of this world. I especially loved the veggie taco, and my husband was a huge fan of the beef. We will definitely be back!

JN8cwnRduAbTetgpxVSctw.text: Great food. Great experience. Excellent wait staff  Churros were delicious!  We'll definitely be back next time we're in Phoenix

3JItbKedwIMmikskVzmp6w.text: If you want authentic tacos that might be the best ever, please come here! This family-run restaurant was just what I was looking for on my visit to Phoenix. Try the 3 taco dinner and choose 3 different kinds. The servers are so kind, they seat you really promptly, and then the food is so, so good. We went back there twice and were so pleased we did. The taco made from corn is freshly made, but you would think it's flour, it's so tender. The sauces are delicious and the meats (especially the steak) are perfectly crispy and juicy. Love this place! You should definitely go!

0U7nF7hBqrAwYJefBOtVhg.text: Great artisan tacos! The churros were mind blowing! Plus the customer service was the suprub even when the restaurant was busy. We'll definitely be back!

N8eNIEYhsQWFfz-iM_flrA.text: One of the best kept sextets of Phoenix. Newly opened. The food was awesome. The service was amazing. Professional, quick, kept our drinks full. We had the Barbecoa special and the Tacos recommended by our server. The tacos were full and the shrimp inside was grilled to Perfection!!  We also ordered the fresh made Guaca del salsa for an appetizer it came with chips and salsa. We had to order another salsa cuz it was so good!!!!   The manager came to our table sat down and asked what we liked and didn't like. We appreciated his candor. The restaurant was a bit too warm for me but it was okay for my partner. Try it. Well worth it !!

GqnRIIx51JD8one5BTnBPg.text: Great place. Had lunch today with some friends. A very casual place with very friendly staff. We talked to the chef and the owner before lunch and got a sense of the place. I had the mushroom enchiladas in ancho mole cream sauce with rice and beans, others had a chicken burrito and the Al Pastor burrito.  Everyone raved about their dishes. My mushroom enchiladas were the best enchiladas I've ever had. Absolutely fantastic. Chips and salsa were excellent as well.   Reasonably priced, friendly service and top flight food. Can't ask for more. Will definitely be back.

3JyuQJSNuRvEQmQ7gDXWvg.text: We were stunned by the quality of  this comfortable 8 month old.    We are 40 year regulars to Arizona, and this is our favorite Mexico inspired dining we have yet to enjoy.  The Chef Lou Madrigal, and son Brian told us they opened 8 months ago.  Lou from Oaxaca .  Has his Mom's and his own recipes   , in this their first restaurant.   To me, A Home Run at first try.    We thought the  very fresh basic ingredients to be a key, even down to the perfect limes..    Appetizers terrific, Oaxaca Fundido had great flavor intensity, with understated chiles.  Chicken, Wild Mushroom, Barbacoa Enchiladas were terrific.   Margaritas to me were topmost quality, made with a higher quality Sauza Reposada Tequila, and fresh made in an ice-cream maker. !!  Unique to me, and the best I  have ever found in Phoenix.  The restaurant was cheery, festive. Thoughtful enthusiastic servers.Was such a wonderful experience we returned tenet night to try more of the menu.  We found every item we had to be exceptional .

oz5eG0fo34vO3MTRtqZTeg.text: Amazing first meal at Cocina Madrigal; it was perfect for a birthday lunch!  Excellent margaritas, great fish and pork taco, elote was amazing, and finished it off with a birthday churro.  The wait staff was extremely attentive and welcoming.  So happy for this wonderful local restaurant in our neighborhood!

OogS64gwCGQPttAu6U7l6w.text: Amazing mushroom enchiladas. I live in Houston and was told not to try the Mexican food in Arizona because I would be disappointed but I was very very happy with my enchiladas.  they were delicious and I ate them too fast to take a picture!

l3265WVsK7HU717ocqyy1Q.text: Really enjoyed our first meal here after reading a bunch of reviews. Chips and guacamole were some of the best I've tasted and the wife loved the margaritas. Chef Madrigal was there welcoming guests and helping the staff which we thought was cool. Enjoyed the steak tacos and birtia enchiladas the most. I wish the chicken tacos had grilled meat which I think I would enjoy more and the fish tacos could have a bit bigger piece of fish.  Overall, this will probably become a regular stop for us.

8cOJeaEqJEmJp1SkCMI-TQ.text: Way to go, South Phoenix! Great spot. Chicken Tacos, Steak Tacos, Barbacoa Enchiladas and Chicken Burrito were all delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BIXUxCl9TkwAsTA3iE4jjA.text: The food was great!  Honestly, I probably wouldn't have stopped if I had been alone -  just because I am not from the area and the location didn't seem to fit.  BUT when we arrived and saw the difficulty in finding parking, we knew we had to try it.  The reviews were fantastic and it was obviously a busy restaurant.  I tried 3 different tacos.  The shrimp was my favorite.  My husband thought his enchilada was OK.  I would recommend this place for people who enjoy good food and like to find it in unassuming places.

nMv5l5kznj6X3BNkIwxlfQ.text: The. Tastiest. Mexican. Ever. I have searched for a good restuarant that isn't a chain and this place is it! We have international coworkers come into town each month and the all insist on coming back each visit! The tacos are delicious, the guac is out of this world, and make sure you leave space for the churros for dessert!

FWoK-DlZk8JeZZmX1FbRlw.text: We flew into Phoenix for vacation and found this wonderful spot close to the airport thanks to Yelp.  Cocina Madrigal is insanely good! The grilled salad is possibly the best salad I've ever had, full of smoke and flavor.  The enchiladas, tacos, fundido-- everything we tried was simply outstanding.  The service was prompt and gracious as well.  This was our first stop on vacation and our last before flying out of town again.  It was a lovely experience!

QzerTjNOzNEYPGrETavVqQ.text: Man oh man. My wife found a great Mexican restaurant after our hike. The parking is scarce but well worth it. I had the steak burrito and the meat was seasoned to perfection. My wife loved her enchiladas. Margarita was strong!! They also have a happy hour!

b7HcUKTA0aOY9wAVkYdl-g.text: My husband and I came here on vacation after seeing all the good reviews. The food was quick and really good. The fish tacos were amazing. The owner came over and talked to us a bit and was very friendly. Very well priced with good portion sizes.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos

CRHqRdDRfRcteHmLKlF23g.text: Cocina Madrigal was a wonderful experience. The food was exceptional and the service was friendly and provided great recommendations.

wMiXj5Z1L4aFZB2Hott1Lg.text: Awesome food and service. Must try the churro so amazing.  Had the chicken pasta and enchilada as well as the tacos.  The wild mushroom enchiladas were my favorite. Also if get a chance try the trio sampler appetizer. Worth the drive to south Phoenix. I like that the chef brings out the dishes himself or he comes to check on each table.

HupQJo31PiqAU7u4FdZ3GQ.text: Hard not to love these people.  When I was here, the owner found a limping bulldog alone and in the parking lot.  He lured him into the outside gated area and gave him rice and water.  What a guy!  Equally sweet was the non-Mexican lady working the bar.    Okay, the real reason to come is the food.  I had an amazing mushroom enchilada with delicious cheese and a frozen margarita (I know only gringos order frozen.  Don't judge me).  It's a small but attractive place with warm atmosphere.  In the category of dive Mexican Restaurants the clear winner is Presidio but after that are Madrigal, Adrians, Irmas and Cocina Economica but not necessarily in that order.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. yummy mushroom enchilada

m7DiqFNhEe9P9ipdntBbcw.text: Flew in to Phoenix and this place ranked high on yelp so I tried it out. AMAZING! The food is so fresh, I got the homemade guacamole so fresh, followed by the steak burrito you can make your way! Everything was delicious, highly recommend.

V5K5l-KffwW30HLJ6an8xQ.text: This was the best dining experience my husband and I have ever had. Every ingredient is fresh and made from scratch. Amazing margaritas if you are a margarita drinker. The staff made us feel welcome and like family. The owner/chef was greeting every customer and thanking them for coming to his restaurant. We will definitely be back.  Thank you for the amazing experience!!

ZyNA6gdjp-9yM6QcPzeOeg.text: Honestly I was skeptical about how good of a rating this place had but I wanted to eat some dank Mexican.  I spend a lot of time in Texas and understand higher end Mexican while many other gringos do not.  Looking at the menu online, it didn't seem wildly interesting, but I know that execution is everything.  Unfortunately I was also dining with my idiot coworker who couldn't comprehend why they wouldn't bring him a Chile relleno or why I wanted to spend money on Mexican food.  This spot did not disappoint.  I went in around 1130 pm on a Thursday and the restaurant was mostly empty.  Our server was perfectly attentive and polite about my questions.   The menu is small but well curated.  We started with chips and salsa and Oaxaca fundido, both of which were phenomenal. My dining partner ordered the pastor tacos.  He admitted to loving them.  I had an enchilada plate.  One beef, one barbacoa.  Absolutely wonderful.  Even the rice and beans were interesting and delicious.  My only complaints:  Our table was wobbly, but I'm pretty DIY so I had something in my pocket to fix it.  It was a little on the expensive side, especially the drinks.  Food was reasonable but the draft estrellas were over $5 and the marg was about $9.  It was an absolutely wonderful lunch but 80+ (with tip, we had 3 beers and 1 marg) for lunch seemed a bit excessive.  The only thing I'd change is having lunch drink specials.  Overall, this place is every bit as good as everyone says it is.  Probably the best Mexican I've ever had.  If you're in the area and don't eat here, you need to reassess your priorities.

7vSwU12G9jgpDd4qOcPt3w.text: Thank you Yelpers!!! 'This place is awesome. Great service from Zay.  Kind  and friendly and welcoming.  The food was so good.  Just enough spice. We tried the jalapeno bacon guacamole and chips. Yum yum.  We tried the mushroom enchiladas and also the Barbacoa enchiladas and have never been happier!! Cold cold beer too.   If you miss this place you will be sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MZz13bDMfxe9A3HxjkUxdQ.text: As my wife & I are vacationing from Michigan we were looking for some authentic Mexican.Came across this little gem on Yelp and boy were the reviewers spot on with accessing them with 5 full stars.Our service with Tom was just as outstanding as the food itself.Corn on the cob which isn't featured in my pics was absolutely scrumptious!! We ordered a combo of mushroom,barbacoa & chicken enchiladas(which were all OUTSTANDING!!!) as well as the steak & al pastor tacos.Even the freaking grilled veggies were awesome & well seasoned.We will be returning before we leave town by week's end.

9UuNr7cGS1LakK0BcUo-yQ.text: The outdoor patio seating already won my heart soon after I landed from Chicago. The short distance from the airport was a bonus. The guacamole and mushroom enchiladas were awesome. The sauce on the enchiladas was creamy and added a unique texture to the dish. The manager was really attentive but the server less so.

sgWo_vByqQbmnyWe7iWwNQ.text: Came here with my wife with a couple friends after a good tip - and it certainly didn't disappoint! After we were sat - the manager / owner came by and recommended the green hatch chile pork to start. The pork itself was so tender and the cheese tangi-ness complimented the sauce & pork perfectly.   We also ordered one of the beef birria & one of the wild mushroom enchiladas (great that i can mix & match enchiladas within one order!) Both were cooked well! The sauce on the mushroom enchiladas was vibrant and so full of flavor! And the beef birria meat spice was well balanced!  We ended our meal with the churros. Sure! - a guilty pleasure, but the caramel dipping sauce complimented the greatly executed deep fried delight so well that we literally spooned away at the rest of the sauce.   Would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!

FcMmHRmH0X7KJY7kwXkRfg.text: Seriously Ive never been to Such an amazing spot as this place. Everything is amazing from the service, conversation, drinks and food....we wanna come back everyday!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omg this is what heaven tastes like

Jlh-IWKiALYjJTs0UrO04g.text: My family is from Houston where there is an abundance of amazing Mexican food options. On multiple attempts I haven't found that same level of deliciousness in Phoenix. I was recommended this place by a friend and based on the many recommendations, I tried the beef tenderloin tacos and they did not disappoint. At first bite, you know you've made an amazing decision. Incredible flavor. I only utilized two of my three tacos on this and immediately regretted it. Rectified that with a to-go beef tenderloin taco. My fiance also loved her mushroom enchiladas. Awesome, awesome Mexican food.

EyAJmvX-siqBNorRXpM7cg.text: The food here was extremely good!!!  We were in Phoenix for a few days and found this place via Yelp.  The service was friendly and attentive! Food arrived quickly and was excellent!!  Had items on menu that were vegetarian friendly!  Just a great place! We will return if back in the area!!

lkD00Gs5D3AyZBTL1S3pHw.text: All the other 5 star reviews are accurate, this place is great! Laid back fun atmosphere, great for a group of friends. The lime Margaritas were excellent and not too sweet. You can mix and match enchiladas, I ended you getting one chicken and one wild mushroom, they were both really good, lots of flavor! Our server Jose was incredibly nice, explained the menu to us and you could tell he actually cared about his job, Chef Leo also came out to check in on our table as well! Really nice place and I can't wait to go back because I'm wanting to try more items from the menu!

pf79eiEE4XKZzcNAlaeeiw.text: I saw the multitude of five star reviews and had high expectations. Every single one of those expectations was met and more. INCREDIBLE. Be prepared for a long review...   To start, the service was excellent. Eduardo, the manager, was outstanding. He offered recommendations, customizations, his own favorites, and was just incredibly attentive, kind, and funny. Our food, drinks, and appetizers came quick, and they were made with superb quality. I cannot explain how great of vibes there were!   Now for the drinks... oh my goodness! Starting with the blended margaritas, you cannot go wrong. I did half spicy and half sugary mango and then the limoncello and neither disappointed. My sister did the prickly pear, which was just as refreshing and fantastic. Beware: They go down smooth and are stronger than you think!  As for food, everything was honestly incredible. Some of (if not the best?!) Mexican food I've had. The queso fundido was filled with mushrooms, cheese, and sausage creating a unique, filling flavor. The mushrooms especially were fantastic. Pair that with salsa and roasted pineapple guacamole and you have the perfect appetizer trio set!  Now for the entrees, I HIGHLY recommend the beef tenderloin tacos. Easily the best tacos I have EVER had with such a smooth and distinct flavor. The veggie and al pastor were also fantastic. I got the grilled elote (in place of rice and beans), and it served as the perfect side dish. There is a bit of an up charge from the rice and beans, but my goodness, it is worth it!   Words cannot express how authentic and delicious this place is. I am SO happy I stopped in. The perfect way to end my Arizona endeavors (especially because it is a short distance from the Phoenix airport)!  Thank you for an amAZing meal
