dLo1cJfcMygv_bDNzhAvQg.text: Wow wow wow! This place was amazing! Started the night with "The Trio" and the queso fundido and guacamole was perfect! Then, I had the Wild Mushroom Enchiladas. I never thought I could crave mushrooms but this dish blew my mind! The serving size was perfect and I was ALMOST able to finish my plate. We finished the night with churros and damn... we wanted to lick the bowl clean. We will certainly be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;The Trio&#34;
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wifey drinking a guacamaya
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churro heaven!

ZrANu6BsGa-WaMK7imXvXA.text: Awesome place for great Mexican food!  Don't let the outside of it or the neighborhood steer you away from it. While there isn't a labeled or easily identifiable front door, all door are acceptable.  They host was welding and gracious, we were quickly greeted and seated. We arrived about 2pm, but there were lots of businessmen and local there.  Try the mangorita, frozen--- hands down one of the best!  I had the Hatch green vile pork with cheese appetizer and fresh flour tortillas. It was seasoned well, the large chunks of tender meat were in a green Chile sauce and then a white cheese was melted over the top.  I loved this dish, it was still too much for me but they put it in a plastic covered container- Like for deli salads to go.  My husband had the Hatch green Chile enchiladas. The plate came with what he described as the best Mexican rice he'd ever had. He wasn't used to Hatch Chile so he said he wasn't over fond of the enchiladas.

tHgisfcR4K2QtLiqf9qZLg.text: The quality of the ingredients at this place blew me away! Everything was soo fresh, well-cooked, and delicious.  We stopped by for a late lunch. Starved, the four of us devoured the two Steak Burritos, a Steak Quesadilla, a Taco plate consisting of a shrimp, a fish, and a chicken taco, and a Roasted Pork Enchilada!  Like I said earlier, everything was delicious. The Steak Burrito was stuffed to the brim with big chunks of tender steak; we're surprised by how easy it was to finish the gigantic burritos! The Steak Quesadilla has the same steak in it, but was sandwiched between two tortillas and a bunch of cheese instead of being wrapped in one.  The roasted pork in the Enchilada was also super juicy and melt-in-the-mouth tender. The salsa on it was a little fiesty, but I really liked that.  Out of the three tacos, I loved the shrimp taco. It was refreshing with a hint of lime in the avocado sauce and the shrimps were crispy, adding an amazing texture to every bite. The fish taco was good too, although nothing memorable. Meanwhile, the chicken taco was a let-down. It had a weird, mushy texture and a jarring taste...  Overall, I'm still very impressed by the place and its food! It was packed even at ~2pm. The environment was lively and the owner and chef even walked around to greet their customers. I would recommend this place to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak Burrito
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak Quesadilla
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco Plate

X3Oy762w7LLPikTMM3Ff8A.text: Yes, the five-star rating is Truer than how Kanye needs to see a therapist. This ranks as some of the best Mexican I've ever tasted. Yes -- even when compared both Cali and Texas.  I devoured the following:  *Wild Mushroom Enchiladas ($12.95): Has a mix of three different types of mushrooms, covered in Jack cheese, each rolled in a corn tortilla, and topped with ancho cream, avocado relish, and sour cream. Each bite tasted so fragrant that I couldn't stop myself from inhaling this wonderfulness. (Not sure if I even took a break, too.) Comes with beans and rice.   *Tacos (Varies): I tried three different kinds and would recommend them in the following order (from best to worst):  - Beef Tenderloin Steak: This chipotle pomegranate marinade, fried peppers concoction topped with gorgonzola cheese served as one of the best tacos I've ever tried. The flavors went well together, and they didn't overcook the beef tenderloin (so soft and smooth). I also liked the fresh, soft, tortilla.   - Tropical Fish: Comes with salsa picante, mango, coconut cabbage mix, Oaxaca cheese salsa fresca. Can't go wrong with either the beef or the fish. Each succulent bite made me happy..  - Al Pastor: It didn't taste like the al pastor I'm used to eating. It lacked char and tasted like a porkchop briefly marinated in tomato sauce. I wouldn't recommend it.   *Grilled Elote ($4.95): Pricey for a piece of corn, but the mayo-y, buttery, cheesy awesomeness I had was worth every penny.  *Churros: Comes with two churros sliced in half AND THEY'RE FILLED WITH SOME DELICIOUS CREAM. Comes with a drizzle of caramel, too.   Regarding their service, I thought they sat and served me, quickly. I forget her name, but my server didn't throw an eye roll when I asked her questions.   They have a small patio, bar seating, and tables inside. I wouldn't say it's the biggest place, but it can host big groups. --They have their own lot.  Overall: I def would recommend Cocina Mardigal. DEM TACOS, THO!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos

z4DtpG0GJQ2rmBEIrKvdqg.text: I went here with some co-workers for lunch.  This is one of those places that you drive by and at first glance may not want to stop because of the area and you can't really tell it's a restaurant.  My co-worker, who was working in the area and starving after her visit, found it first; saw it on Yelp and took a chance.  She came back to the office and did nothing but rave about the find!  Next...parking is crazy!  The lot is small and they were doing some work outside on the building so a few spots were taken up with construction material and workers but regardless...the lunch hour appears to be popular so parking will be at a premium.  We all parked on the side street and it was fine.  We were seated at a table right by the door, but again, it turned out to be ok.  Chips and salsa are offered for $1.95 but you can get refills.  The basket was big enough to share for five of us.  The salsa was good...a tiny bit of heat but manageable for those who don't like heat (me!).  They also gave a small cup of orange colored salsa, which turned out to be habanero and I was told it was really flavorful and the bite hits you at the end.    A couple of our people had been before and for a few of us (there were five of us) it was a first.  I ordered the Wild Mushroom Enchilada, recommended by previous attendee, and it was fabulous.  I was afraid that the sauce was going to be spicy but it was more flavorful and really not hot.  I did order a side of sour cream (it says it comes with it and it did in the way of a drizzle over the top) to add to the flavors.  What a wonderful dish, which I can't wait to bring my wife back to try.  Chock full of mushrooms and just so yummy!  Came with a side of rice and beans (I'm not a bean person but did take a taste and they were good.  Rice was good as well...a bit different than typical Mexican food rice and much better.    Others had tacos, combination of shrimp and fish (will order these next visit) and all reported how tender and flavorful they were.  One had the vegetable tacos and again, reports were positive and they looked great.  All in all, a great meal and cannot wait to come back.

zvIsSSmHwYH8lcN2d2LsAQ.text: This place is pretty good. I was visiting for Southern California and I wasn't sure what to expect from a Mexican restaurant in Phoenix.   The restaurant had a laidback feel to it and fun lively music. The only gripe I have is that we were there at the same time as a very boisterous family that made it hard to hold a conversation even with the people directly next to me.   The service staff was educated and friendly, providing guidance on what were some of the favorites. they provided quick service and made sure we enjoyed our time.   The real star of the place is the food. I had some tacos as per the suggestion of my waiter. The tacos were a little more dressed up then I'm used to, but all for the better. I got a couple of al pastor tacos and a carne asada one. The flavors of the al pastor tacos were on point and elevated by the pickled veggies. The carne asada taco, or beef tenderloin steak, was a stranger in my opinion. I'm not a big fan of the cheese they went with, however, I loved the fried peppers and would order it again without the cheese.   If I ever find myself in Phoenix again ill be sure to come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

jk7oya7RaOYSNGAxaMSjTA.text: Cocina Madrigal beautifully framed our calibration with a warm hospitality that fulfilled their vision for treating each customer like family. Many places undervalue excellent service. But Cocina Madrigal appears to have mastered it. From the moment we arrived, to our departure, we were greeted cheerfully by staff at each level. Even the chef makes rounds at this place.  They take great pride in their food and customized their food to meet our veg requirements. We came searching for mushroom enchiladas and found delight in the Oaxaca Fundido and grilled Romaine Salad. The crisp outside with Bavarian filling of their churro created a noticeable contrast that secured a place in my list of most memorable churros.  And after the meal, we left with a bag of carefully packaged leftovers to enjoy a sunset that echoed the beauty of our evening at the restaurant.

vChhgrhHFFud9FXNZmRIBw.text: Cocina Madrigal helped us celebrate Cinco De Mayo early and they delivered!  We craved variety and decided on 4 tacos a la carte: el pastor, shrimp, beef tenderloin and fish. The absolute, hands down BEST taco was the beef tenderloin.  The beef was succulent, the fried jalapenos were savory, the Gorgonzola took it to the next level. Cocina Madrigal is borderline the best taco I have ever ate.  The mantra of the restaurant is Tacos & Tequila and of you know me, I love me a margarita, on the rocks, frozen, flavored, house.. I do not discriminate  but we were going to a kindergarten curriculum night and I ordered an Ice Tea, next time, it's on! I can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elote
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Chile appetizer
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UKtefMGUQtliUNqclpjnHw.text: Have you ever heard of Cullinan? This is one other Mexicano Cullinan for food.  The area around looked shady, the moment I stepped in, I witnessed a super packed crowd. Louder than other restaurants and my mexican friend was like "Feels like I am back home".   Ordered- Wild Mushroom Enchilada - I have never tasted such a good enchilada in my life. It is delicious and mouthwatering. Sauces put on enchilada was a deal breaker. Totally loved it. Guacamole is a must try with chips. Chips are freshly made and were bland.  Presentation is not up to the mark but food though!! Quick service and 0 wait times even when crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild mushroom enchilada
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Busy Friday

1Hjg5f-x9xkI-v59mPS8_A.text: Had a nice meal at Cocina Madrigal on a recent trip to Phoenix. Everything was solid, service was quick, prices were good.  We started with the dip trip. The chips come out hot and fresh, the salsa is good, guacamole is also good (although would like some heat and a bit more salt), and the queso fundido was amazing with mushrooms.  For entrees, we had a trio of tacos and the chicken pasta. The pasta was good, although could've used a bit more pasta. Nice hints of heat come from the julienned jalapeno. The tacos were delicious. The made to order corn tortillas are great, and flavors of the tacos were all on point. We tried the pastor, fish, and steak - steak was easily my favorite but all were good.  Of course, we ended with the dulce de leche churros. These are done well and not overly sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Queso
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken pasta

slTb1YSs7g-KKhsOprfP6g.text: A rare combo of really delicious food and over the top service.  I came on an early Friday evening and their system had just crashed as we arrived.  Before they sat us they explained the situation, apologized for the inconvenience, but said they would serve us drinks on the house if we wanted to wait.  Quite an offer, so we sat and ordered a Mexican coke (it's a big bottle) and prickly pear margarita on the rocks (delicious).  10 min later they said we could order appetizers so we got the "Trio" which comes with Oaxaca fundido, home made guac, and chips with salsa and hot sauce.  All were good, but the Oaxaca fundido was out of this world!  Next, they said we could order an entree if we had cash, as their system was still down.  We split 3 tacos, one fish, one al pastor, and one beef tenderloin.  All were fantastic and it's hard to pick one over another but I was told the tenderloin is their most popular one.    Upon finishing we asked for the check, but after our server spoke with the manager/owner they said it was on the house!  We were pretty insistent on paying as we had cash, but they were adamant.  On the way out the manager/owner apologized again and only asked that we come back again.  Needless to say we plan on making this place a regular spot of ours!

mjh76xg34jonmVZcMbNC3w.text: Unbelievable flavors!!  We had tacos (steak, al pastor, shrimp) and a couple enchilada plates and they were all an eye opening experience. Outside isn't much to look at but the inside is warm and friendly. The service was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak taco, taco al pastor and shrimp taco

M-lkK-I0ixAAnfXVe6tsyg.text: OMG!! We went here based on YELP reviews! They do not lie! This place is amazing from beginning to end! The food is outstanding! Service on point! The price was definitely fair for all that we ordered. I can't wait to go back again! I was so impressed with the Manager not only for his endless energy but how he paid attention to detail. He made it a point to thank us on our way out and then another Manager (I think) held the door open for us. The churros are a MUST no matter how full you are from your meal. They are the best I've ever had and such a precise balance when it came to the sweetness! Oh..I almost forgot the potatoes were to die for!! This place is a hidden gem and worth any amount of driving to get there!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4TMODJUTPbexvjr-Sa_oOA.text: Holy moly!  WORTH THE DRIVE!!    We came into phx & decided to stop here for lunch.  I'm so happy we did!!  Small place but were seated immediately & the service was awesome!!  Drink refills right when we needed them, super friendly & helpful server & the food is AMAZING!     We got the guacamole to start & it was really good.   We loved the chips & salsa!   I ordered the wild mushroom enchiladas & it was better than I can even try to describe!!  My hubby isn't an enchilada fan and he was surprised how much he loved them!   He got the 3 tacos {you can mix & match}.   We are big al pastor fans but we also love some good steak.   He got 2 al pastor & 1 steak.   Okay.   The steak taco was maybe the best taco we've ever had.   Their tortillas are incredible & fresh!!  Next time we will get 2 steak & try a new flavor.    The beans on the side weren't my favorite but still tasty.   The rice was cooked & seasoned perfectly.    I do wish it was closer to me {it's about 45 minutes away} but it doesn't matter!   It was worth that drive & we will be back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2 al pastor &amp; 1 steak taco
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild mushroom enchiladas

FwgZHf_NCOUUAGywNRYNEg.text: I was so excited to try this new restaurant in the neighborhood.  The reviews were great and family members recommended it.  The food as fabulous and Chef Leo, his son Brain, and the staff made you feel like you were family.  We stopped in mid-day 3:00 pm.  The food was fresh, homemade, and delicious.    We started off with the guacamole and chips.  The chips were crispy and thin and fresh.  They serve you a large portion.  The salsa was tasty, but the guacamole was exceptional - the avocados favorable and perfect ripeness.   We shared the fish tacos.  The fish was grilled to perfection and perfectly seasoned. I was happy that they give you the option of having the taco wrapped in lettuce for people who are eating healthy.  My boyfriend liked the corn tortillas too.  The taco had just the right of of filling including some mangoes and filling. The flavors blended well.    The best part of the delicious meal was the churro dessert!  OMG!  The best I've ever  eaten in my life and filled with cream. My boyfriend and I shared this perfectly prepared, cinnamon and sugar balanced, crunchy and creamy dessert.  Next time I'm not sharing!  Lol! . Just kidding.   The staff was friendly and the service was fast!  We highly recommend this place. It is locally owned and worth the price.  Treat yourself to a nice meal and cocktail but save room for the churros!  Thank you chef Leo and Brian and staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. DELICIOSO!  I died and went  to dessert heaven with each bite of the churros.
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tropical Grilled Fish Tacos!  They give you the option of wrapping them in lettuce for a healthier option!

BKkrdKhAhF8JAcH6wK7ODA.text: Stopped in Phoenix on my way to California and had a really nice meal here. The staff was super friendly and the owner/chef even came out to chat with me and other guests.   I had the guacamole and chips and salsa which were so delicious and the taco platter with the most tender carne asada and al pastor. Really great meal and would definitely stop in again if I am in Phoenix again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne asada taco

HL-6u_Zj56UbTYUXMrzVuw.text: The Fundido dip was amazing! The fish in the fish tacos were perfectly cooked.  Shrimp tacos were ok, kind of plain. I'd definitely come back here just for the Fundido dip though.

LoqoVfRZ8cWS-18MSLXlgw.text: This little hidden gem lives up to all the Yelp hype and 5-star reviews. Definitely would never have stumbled upon this place without Yelp. It's not fancy, but the food is really fresh and good. Favorites were the Oaxaca shrimp tacos, chicken tacos, and the pork enchiladas w/ green Chile sauce. Rice and beans were great too. The guacamole was outstanding - simple, creamy, perfect.  And to complement all that, our server, Jose, was one of the nicest guys ever. So friendly, attentive, over-the-top with kind words and hospitality. Oh - and save room for the cream stuffed hot churros for dessert!

VE2s8TFV-Ew8xzUgPa-Tvw.text: The food was flavorful, filling and delicious. Eduardo our server was attentive personable and knew his menu. I recommend this place from appetizers to dessert! I will be back when in Arizona!

Pl2NiD9qvFMWzlUZ4TkHUg.text: I am going to dream about the mushroom enchiladas...they were so delicious!  Friendly staff and Leo is fantastic. Going to be our first stop every time we visit Phoenix

FtNH8XXOmZBFmlB45DrNqw.text: This was one of the best Mexican restaurants that I have ever eaten at.   WOW!!!  The food was unique (wild mushroom enchiladas were to die for) and incredibly tasty.  Highly recommend!!!  The staff are very friendly and helpful - one looks like George Clooney. Was a wonderful experience!!!!

hxUJUPt9l1Jal8YFVkinuA.text: A quick pitstop in Phoenix for lunch and Yelp led me here. Food and service both were terrific. If I'm ever back in Phoenix, I'd come back.

Hckd2PuNmSiwjYZxxkwYCA.text: Fantastic food.  Wonderful service.  What a delightful surprise!  We just flew into phx and saw the reviews, and we were there!

5QpFRqKco3xK38EzJOpGKw.text: This restaurant is absolutely amazing. The staff is friendly and attentive. The food, is some of the best that I have had since I moved to Phoenix in 2006. From the complementary fresh chips and house made salsa(s), to the Diabla Chicken Pasta, to several other dishes I have tried...everything is designed by the chef to be perfectly balanced and prepared perfectly, and consistently. The menu is not a compilation of best hits, it was crafted with purpose. I intend to try every item available, more than once.  Special shout out to the bar/restaurant manager Eduardo! His drinks are as perfect as the food, and he uses only the best ingredients.  Definitely give this place a try!

1xREMnNFW_E6iE5NB90GqQ.text: Stopped at this place on the way to the airport. If I could give the food six stars I would. Amazing place...ate at the bar and service was on point. The bartender had only been there for 8 days and had all the answers. Worth the stop

y13k9C8paUfBULIbjG-msw.text: This restaurant is everything! The service, the food, the drinks, all of it. Zay was our waiter and He was great. I will definitely be back!!

lS94GPzYAG74vG6lmWgKjg.text: Looking for a good meal in this part of town, looked at Yelp and found the 5 star rating and positive reviews. This was a great find, fast friendly service and amazing food. It's a bit out of my way when I typically travel to the Valley, but it will be a place I visit as often as I can! Highly recommend if you like great Mexican food.

KSufAzOA93UIr1D9zWEshA.text: Just came because my wife and her niece wanted to go. I wasn't hungry. After I got there and had a Pizza Port beer I wished I was hungry. Good beer on tap. I wasn't hungry but I snacked on the chips and salsa and guacamole and tasted everyone's food. Really good. Can't wait to come back with an appetite. Service was great, friendly staff.

hkL5h16d_emYqOizSeSupA.text: The food here is great! The tenderloin steak tacos the mushroom enchiladas  make sure to try the guacamole with the pineapple  the prickly pear margarita.  I doubt you can be disappointed with anything you get here!!! I love this place! Definitely a place you need to check out!!!

3MRWRupx30vmNCvZy2lHVg.text: The Wild Mushroom Enchiladas are hands down the BEST Enchiladas I've ever tasted!  They are better than mine and my mom's and I our enchiladas are delicious!   Looked this place up as we were traveling and saw 5 star reviews, so decided to try it out.  Was not disappointed.  Eduardo greeted us with exceptional customer service. The guacamole, rice and black beans were also very flavorful.    Not sure when I'll be back in Phoenix but if I'm ever in the area again I will definately come back!

IDASuTf8HntO1twUwIISJQ.text: The hype is real, you guys. Cocina Madrigal truly is a 5 star establishment.   From the service, to the drinks, to the food. The owner/chef even took the time to stop at every single table to check in and to express thanks - even on a Sunday night at 6PM.   I dined with a party of 6 and everything that was dropped at the table was to perfection. The house margs are perfectly balanced, the grilled romaine salad was amazing, and I fell in love with the beef tenderloin tacos. Others at the table ordered enchiladas and loved them. Don't skip on the churros, either. :) Not a crumb was left from any of us, from any dish!   Best Mexican food I've had in Arizona. A must try

l9rrGr2hEVuGJPyoleBdxg.text: As with most of you, yelp brought us to this hidden gem. I ordered the chicken tacos and my husband had the wild mushroom enchilada. Both dishes were simple, yet delicious and packed with flavor. I told my husband that my food tastes like it was prepared by someone who genuinely cares. I was right. The chef himself came out and made sure to greet every table tonight and ask how everything was. Overall very attentive service, and fantastic authentic food. Make this your next stop now!

X1PYEE128y7asFrUnwWcJg.text: My husband and I were in the area and had some time to kill so we stopped here because it was super close and had great reviews. We shared the wild mushroom enchiladas and some chips and salsa. Loved all of it! Staff was very friendly and did their job well. Food was delicious! Definitely hope to make it back some day if we're in the area and try other things!

UimgUJvv17QcdAkOhn_zig.text: The food was delicious and our server was very helpful and understanding of my dietary restrictions (dairy and gluten allergy.) Definitely try the tacos-they were amazing!!

flsspeHuSc_uexqfsCKyPg.text: Boop bop bam!!! This place is the jam!! Not in the most nicest of neighborhoods but it doesn't matter it's worth it. Had the mushroom enchiladas and they were so good I forgot there was no meat in them!! My friends and I believe baby Jesus May be in the kitchen cooking the food

j3scX8h0qC0Dk9kugpOUEw.text: Best random Yelp suggestion I have ever found! The tacos are fantastic, especially the beef tenderloin. The staff are some of the coolest people I've ever talked with. Definitely coming back and suggesting this place to anyone who lives in or visits the Phoenix area. Oh, and the margaritas...amazing. Wish nothing but the best for this place

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jKYRq_L0-usPcUg6yRgreA.text: I don't review often, but omg this little hidden Gem is worth every star. Please don't be afraid to cross the river and visit this place. Friendliest staff ever including the owner himself. Ordered a steak burrito the size of a small baby, steak is soft, juicy and delicious, barbacoa enchiladas are to die for. Congratulations on your top 100 Yelp rating.

rgjI0REdx3JLy6KwTwYPhQ.text: This restaurant is seriously top notch!  It's so unassuming, which is why I loved that everything from the server/manager, to the drinks, appetizers and meal were so amazingly delicious!  The chef came out twice to see how we liked our food, he was so gracious.  The manager was our server and treated us like friends from the moment we walked in the door.  Everything was amazing at this place, you have to check it out!

ukFbny64JkA9lizYX7PDbQ.text: Best. Mexican. (In Phoenix) Ever.   Outstanding. The reviews don't lie. It's worth the drive. Hubby had mushroom and steak enchiladas. Both fantastic. I had three tacos, chicken, al pastor and fish. All amazing.  Great for vegetarians.

Zu_8X41fkzrqP79k37XwNg.text: What an amazing place!  In town for spring training and found this via Yelp!  The reviews do not lie!  Guacamole and salsa are addicting.  The mushroom enchiladas where probably the best Mexican dish I've ever had.  My husband had jerk chicken Mac n Cheese and said it was great.  My son raved about the tenderloin tacos.  At the end of our meal the owner brought out a plate of churros on the house.  He was a very nice man with great pride in his food and the customers experience !

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yVpDvAp3c3PTqMX0wstJ8Q.text: This is a great restaurant.  The food is amazing  and so is the wait staff.  They have outdoor seating and they make THE best frozen margaritas.

GmBR42pA-pHelump4Ga4ew.text: The most delicious chili verde ever and the steak burrito was very, very good. Didn't care for the beans and rice though so only 4 stars. Very nice staff. Would return on another visit to Phoenix for sure

VokmcIqLAkOi-wTGssdO6w.text: Not exaggerating when I say this is the best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to! From their food to their customer service, this restaurant has exceed my expectation when I thought I was just going into another random place to fill my belly. Serendipitous, indeed. Everything I ate was layered with flavor and depth. The owner even gave me a rose since I was sitting by myself on Mother's Day! I had a spicy margarita, beef tenderloin steak tacos, grilled elotes, and churros! I CLEANED the plates by myself...it was that good. I don't live in Arizona but next time I'm here I'll be back--and with some company!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled elotes, beef tenderloin steak tacos, al pastor tacos, with rice and veggies. Oh--and their habanero salsa!! All to die for.
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros....best churros I&#39;ve ever had. And that sauce is delicious!
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy margarita with tajín! BEST drink I&#39;ve had. Their tequila is infused with jalapeños in house!!!

rR6xuZclW26jJrbuwx2F5w.text: We came here on a whim after telling ourselves we needed to try a new place once a month and of course we were craving Mexican food.   We ordered the chips and salsa (1.95), a cup of chicken tortilla soup 3.95), wild mushroom enchiladas (12.95), the macho mucho (10.95),the churros (5.95) ,House margarita (8.95) and a frozen strawberry margarita (9.95); Bill was $60 without tip.  The location is on the side of 16st ave, near many commercial buildings, and we opted for the outdoor patio because we don't get many nice times to sit outside in Arizona. The only complaint about being outside is you're literally right next to 16st, only a sidewalk separates you and cars were flying down the street- like 60mph as you dine right next to the street.   The food was so great and so were the margaritas. It was a little expensive, the margaritas weren't huge (think of a margarita in a 3/4 full wine glass)- but the price tag of $10 for a frozen margarita seemed a little steep. Also why do we have to pay for chips and salsa, it's a Mexican restaurant- we ordered entrees, drinks and dessert, complimentary chips and salsa would be nice. The enchilada was very cheese, but super tasty i enjoyed all the mixes of mushrooms, and my boyfriend enjoyed the flavor of his burrito. They marinate the chicken all day, both entrees came with black beans and rice. The churros were fantastic. We didn't realized they were stuffed churros, but it was a pleasant surprise. It's two churros that are cut diagonally, stuffed with some cream cheese consistency blend and then has caramel drizzle. They were warm and tasted as if they were just made.   We were pleased that the owner or chef (he was wearing a black uniform), came around to the patio asking how everything was. We thought that was a nice touch!

MSKcqQXhM7wtJSCoV-SAbQ.text: Service was very friendly! We got guacamole, fish tacos on lettuce, barbacoa enchiladas, and churros were all delicious and tasted authentic!

YmwwrgTrlkn-Eeyh0zN44g.text: Read the reviews and we decided to give this place a try. The food and service were excellent and I do recommend giving it a try. The waiter was very attentive , positive and would make sure to check on us regularly. The food came quickly and was very tasty. We ordered an appetizer by the name of "Trio". It was very tasty and filling.  For the main course we had Beef Birria enchilada which was also tasty. The wild mushroom enchilada was excellent. For desert we had the churros with cream sauce. The location is a bit sketchy, lots of echo when people talk. Below I rated some more things.  Location 3/5 Sound level 2/5 Food Quality 4/5 Service 5/5  Ambiance 3/5 Cleanliness 4/5  Decor 3/5 Parking 4/5 Beef Birria Enchalada 4/5 Wild mushroom Enchalda 5/5 Appetizer Trio 5/5 Churro with cream sauce 5/5

vXnEVh71D5HiNB6Cr0fwQA.text: Over 500 reviews... 5 stars... Living up to the hype...  If you have not experienced this level of Mexican food...you need to  yo'self!   Yummmmm!!

4BE6UTDHNtL_JvwkQ9QMmw.text: This place is so unbelievably good. I'm really critical of Mexican food and rhis place is solid.

tqob4Muv118CwRP-M2Cs4A.text: I've never dinned somewhere that felt so much like a home away from home until I ate here. The staff was so kind, the service was so great and the food was so delicious that I'm already planning my next trip back. Thanks so much to the Cocina family for a great night! See you soon!!!!

mk5mH0HwHWSB5hUrvG1GaQ.text: I can see why they're rated 5 stars! The service was exceptional! Any server who passed us topped off our drinks. The food was delicious!  I'm a vegetarian and they were extremely accommodating. We were told Phoenix could give California a run for their money on Mexican food, but we were skeptical. But so happy to have put it to the test!

l3rRnEgsn5mdL7BihvmswQ.text: This is the type of place that changes ones state of mind, an unassuming building that misguidedly could be just another restaurant, but believe me, it is no mere restaurant. With outstanding service, a chef and a lovely bartender who explain and really believe in their food, you could get lost in one bite. The amount of care shown with each dish is palpable, a subtle flavor, a gentle hint of special hidden behind a veneer of traditional. Comfortable, mixed with a kick in the pants of outstanding. To say this is hands down the best Mexican food I have ever had would be telling the truth. To say this will be the best you have ever had, is an easy prediction. Many thanks to the staff for making us feel your passion for the food.  To the lovely couple who payed for our dessert without us knowing, we will be back, and hope to pay for yours next time. Thank you

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. To the couple that bought us this, what a treat, thank you for the dessert on the house. Next ones on us
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is what heaven probably tastes like

2ZJegdAIUdrGm6TwVgP0mw.text: I was blown away by the service and food. I lived in Phoenix for 10 years in the 80's, and now visit several times a year. I have a weakness for Mexican cuisine, and I must say this place was fantastic. It is my place of choice ....the service is the best!

v9-17MayONg6PP6UVrGWGQ.text: Best Tacos ever, bro there's blu cheese  So we can't say enough good things about this spot. We just flew in from NorCal and we helped a good spot close to the airport. This spot was off the hook. So much flavor in everything. Edwardo the manager suggested so many great choices for us, Briana the waitress was amazing and so friendly. Edwardo even brought us an extra drink  The chef/owner Leo ever came out and greeted us and made sure we were enjoying the food. If you're ever in Phoenix you have to stop by this gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best Tacos ever, bro there&#39;s blu cheese

SjaaVJx17zR-MLFAKi6Lug.text: Really, really, really good food.  Perfect portions.  I highly recommend the taco trio.  I was there with a business associate and we were met by the host, greeted by the owner who regained stories of Oaxaca, where I had spent a summer as a youth.  Salsa was served with traditional and habanero.   The shrimp taco was served with a cabbage slaw with a little apple in it.   It's not in the Beverly Hills of Phoenix, but the food and service sure is.

_hIJy0DkoNSVkxchl9Y8Aw.text: This place is amazing!!!! So good and authentic. Service was great too! Really felt like I was in my abuelita's kitchen. For all you crazies out there that have even had a negative experience- nooo way! Id look at you like "you crazy." This place so good. I will be back!

f6y3rRfZuPepolAgKhANLw.text: My wife found Cocina Madrigal on Yelp while on our way to a High School Football game and we couldn't be happier.  Such an amazing meal!     We started with the homemade corn tortilla chips and guacamole.  It was the best guacamole I've ever experienced.    Then we tried their signature wild mushroom enchiladas.  They just melt in your mouth.  My taste buds went nuts.    The dessert we got were some of the very best churros I've ever had.  The Churros were stuffed with a delicious sweet inside along with some dipping deliciousness.   I've lived in AZ for 25 years and this is one of the very best Mexican restaurants I've tried.    Already planning a trip back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zYAbmbdr3SIbrXb8v7G-qQ.text: I'm so glad I found this new Mexican spot in South Phoenix. The chef, owner, and wait staff are very nice. They really make you feel welcomed! We tried the guacamole which was made fresh. It was very tasty, I love their roasted tomato salsa. It has the perfect amount of spiciness! My companion and I ordered the tropical fish tacos, chicken enchiladas. The food was very flavorful, I really like the style of beans (not canned refried beans) here with cotija cheese. You can tell it is made fresh. Would love to see them add aguas frescas to their menu (horchata or jamaica). I will certainly be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1PbXY_M0AphiEIkXTidqMQ.text: Do not let the outside fool you.  The food in this place is the best I have had ever.  We started with the Trio appetizer, Oaxa con Queso, guacamole de casa, elite and chips and salsa.  It was delicious.  We ordered Chili Verde pork (mystery meat) enchilada, and a three mushroom enchilada with ancho mole cream. There is no description I can write that explains how exquisitely tasty they were.  Howie ordered the chicken enchilada with the Barbacoa green chili enchilada.  The taste was complex and so fulfilling.  The rice and beans were very tasty.  We ended the meal with churro, the best churro I have ever had.  The dipping sauce was lick the plate good.  Run don't walk to the this place.  If I am on my way in and tables are limited...sorry if I accidentally knock you down.  I am all in.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

A_pop4MOMH2m0QFWwGK5Xg.text: My friend recommended this...not just recommended...lost his mind when I told him I was hungry and loved Mexican food.  He sent me to this hole in the wall that was really a diamond in the rough!  We started with the three amigos (I don't know if that's what it's called) - salsa, guacamole, and queso.  This was almost a meal and SUPER delicious...every single item!  Word of caution: there were the most amazing Hatch Green Chili's hiding in the queso.  I ate one and the right side of my face went numb, my eyes were filled with tears and my mucus membranes were running like the Boston marathon!  The worst was the next morning...but I digress.  Our entree was Hatch Green Chile Pork Enchiladas and like the Tres Amigos...this did not disappoint!  Soft, deliciously seasoned pulled pork, wrapped in a soft corn tortilla and topped with green Chile sauce.  Both of us mopped our plate clean!  Desert had to be done so we grabbed some Churros.  Damn you for even having churros on the menu!!  Crime filled...and a beautiful design to boot!!!  Delicious and artistic!  You need to just go...eat...and have a churro!

x5rVotSuWMqFsW1ZGIHMNQ.text: One of my favorite Mexican food restaurants  GET THE MUSHROOM ENCHILADAS. I think about these enchiladas on the weekly and can't get enough of it. As a meat eater, I would trade these enchiladas over all the meat enchiladas.   Oh and their churros. OMG. I thought Disneyland had the best churros. NO. This place has the best churros. It's filled with cream and it comes out fresh and hot.   Also I need to mention their margaritas is STRONG but still very tasty. Worth every buck especially during Happy Hour. WHOO.   Also again. When it's not busy, the chef comes out to greet the diners. He is super friendly. Service is great here.  Anyway. Get the Wild Mushroom Enchiladas.

D6k3KfsEPJ6oEaUD9S8lNA.text: Tried this for the first time and loved it! My wife and I tried a mixture of a lot of things, and all were great. Favorite things we had: Steak tacos, al pastor tacos, and green chili chicken enchiladas were tops .   It's rare these days that anyone can make a solid margarita (and at an affordable price), they can here.   Look forward to coming back.

glgaGgdUnBtnJ9xEd8bzjw.text: We came in on a suggestion ... now I suggest it to everyone! Popping place especially for a Wednesday so we knew it had to be good food! Great service too ... our bartender/server was awesome: efficient and friendly.   Darn we missed happy hour ... but that's okay the margarita was bomb anyway!  The trio I can't say enough about those three amazing of stages of goodness. Watch out for that spice too, lots of zing.   The barbacoa pork enchiladas were the best though. Great sauce, tender meat, and even an egg on top! The rice had a fresh taste and consistency and I super appreciated the whole pinto beans (minus all the lard).  Haven't found a Mexican food place in Phx I liked better! Great experience all around!!  Ps ... they split plates like pros

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trio part 2: guacamole... obviously done up fresh
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trio Part 1: Chips and salsa ... oh and HOT sauce
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trio all three

Zz49qO8rkUc01skknhNv7A.text: Go to Cocina Madrigal, order the steak tacos, thank me later.   We were skeptical because this place is a little hole in the wall but I'm so glad we gave it a chance! We were greeted immediately as we walked in and seated right away. It's a pretty small restaurant with a good vibe and great, friendly service. Our server, Jenny, was really sweet and gave us great recommendations for food and drinks!  We ordered the bacon jalapeno guacamole (they have various flavors of guacamole to choose from). It was very fresh and delicious with the spicy salsa and warm chips. We also ordered the tacos (you pick 3 tacos with a side of rice and beans); we got a fish taco, el pastor taco and steak taco. They were all delicious, fresh and full of meat/toppings but the steak was hands down the best! The steak is so tender and flavorful and the fried onions and peppers on top are the perfect crunch. It was melt in your mouth, moan while you eat it good.   We also ordered the churros for dessert after we saw every single table in the restaurant with them, we couldn't resist! They are unlike any other churro. They are filled with custard and drizzled in caramel. I highly recommend them!   We'll be back for the steak tacos for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish taco, Steak taco (the BEST) and El Pastor taco.
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon jalapeño guacamole!

kB8PN28Pc7dbnYW4XtLs4g.text: After reading a Review of the Day on Cocina Madrigal, I had to give it a try! My family and I absolutely loved it! The waitress recommended the grilled pineapple guacamole, it was delicious! Next time I'm going to ask if they can make it spicy, but it's really good the way it comes too! (I just like spicy guacamole!.) we did ask for some lime wedges, and after a few squeezes and some additional salt, that seemed to bring it to life, and really help accent the grilled pineapple!  You'll also need to order chips and salsa, theses do not come complimentary to your table. However, I'm a chip and salsa girl, and the chips are thin and crispy with the right amount of salt, and the salsa is AMAZING!! Spicy and flavorful! Do order both these appetizers!   We all got house margaritas, they were perfectly balanced,and delightful! Love a good margarita!   We ordered the grilled Elote' it was fully dressed with all the goodies that grilled street corn should have! They offer it on the cob, and off!, we tried both ways! Both equally good, just a personal preference how you like to eat it.   For our entrees, our party ordered; chicken pasta, chicken enchiladas, steak burrito, and wild mushroom enchilada and a beef enchilada! If you remotely "like" mushrooms, this is a must! It was so tasty! All the entrees were flavorful and above average, the beans and rice, was some of the best I've had! I usually treat these two items as a garnish, and never touch it, but not here! The rice and beans are definitely house made, and so darn good! We all enjoyed everything!   Service was also above average, we were constantly checked on, taking more drink orders, or filling up our water, nothing got left unnoticed, even though this place was packed! (They do take reservations, so take advantage of that!) because this place is hopping!   I will be back!!! Probably too much, this place is legit!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken pasta
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken enchiladas
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak burrito! Humongous and Delicious

ZlaTrPkE99mA7mZTwQhqgg.text: The destination can be daunting. It is South Phoenix, after all.  We came because I had friends hyping this place almost every day. I had to see what the big deal was.  We were seated by Raudel at a table in the center of the action.  Their menu is small, but still has a good selection of dishes. We came with big appetites and they were steering our eyes and our mouths when we made our orders.  As such, we had to take home most of our dinner!  We started out with the homemade guacamole, the fundido, and their chips and salsa. The chips are crisp and well textured. They make them from scratch in the restaurant. The salsa has a nice bite, but it's not too fiery. We liked it a lot, but I'm partial to the salsa at La Pinata.  I don't have enough raves for the guacamole. I don't even like guacamole, but I scooped this up greedily. I believe they might have put something addictive into the mixture. My favorite from the appetizers had to be the Fundido. It's generous enough to be a meal.  It has smokey bits of sausages in a spicy chili sauce with enough cheese to daunt anyone with even the slightest hint of lactose intolerance.   The main dishes were outstanding. The steak in the burro was marinated and although tender tasted as though it had been grilled slightly. The marinade had a tangy bit of flavor to it. It really was enjoyable, as were the beans and rice. I don't normally like having a side of beans, but this restaurant does them correctly. The enchiladas were also a hit with me.  The only disappointment is that they don't serve flan. What! No Flan?!   The highlight of the evening was having Chef Leo come out and talk to me. He shook both our hands  and spent a long time talking to us. He chatted about his background. He grew his love for cooking by watching his grandmother. He grew his experience through his various to travels which included Mexico City and Houston. A couple years ago he started this restaurant and he felt very blessed that it was so well received.   One thing that hurt him, however, was a diner called him a clown to his face because he didn't serve a carnitas burro. He felt bad that someone   would be so unkind simply because of a lack of a menu item.   I, on the other hand, think Chef Leo is a genius and we'll be back. He told me that he will put flan on the menu since so many have asked for it and to make sure to call him in advance to see if it's available.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak Burro
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbacoa green enchiladas
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fundido (Yum)!

BhYkhsYtpN9GC2M7t-0veg.text: 4.5/5  Cocina Madrigal is cocina magical! This restaurant isn't in the most scenic nor magical part of town but the flavors and service here make up for the lack of neighborhood ambiance.  Reservations were easy to make on Yelp and we were seated right away when we got here. It was a bit too warm for me initially in the restaurant but I got used to it after a while.   The cuisine here is probably best described as Nuevo Latino, with unique twists on some Mexican food classics. The menu offers tacos, burritos, enchiladas, and various entree platters.   We started off with an incredible guacamole with salsa and chips. Usually when I have guacamole at a restaurant that touts itself as being made fresh to order at your table it's good, but nothing so special that I couldn't make it at home, but this guac had a nuanced depth of flavor that I absolutely loved. Whatever that special ingredient is, keep it coming it's so spectacular! It was served with a mountain of chips with a bowl of salsa. This was a good sized amount of guacamole too by the way, so well worth your money.  I was intrigued by the grilled romaine salad so I opted for that as my main dish with steak tenderloin. This was my first time having a grilled romaine salad and it won't be my last! I loved that grilled mesquite flavor permeating through the lettuce and it was cooked just enough that the lettuce still retained its crispness. The steak was very tender, well seasoned, and an ample portion.   I had a bite of the churros for dessert, and it was a fabulously heavenly bite! They were nice and warm with a custard center and the dipping sauce was amazing.   What also really sets this restaurant apart is the superb service. Drinks were refilled constantly, our server was excellent and the chef came by our table to make sure everything was OK. I really appreciate all the care that he places to make sure the diners at his restaurant are having the best experience possible.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They give you a generous amount of chips with your guacamole +salsa
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbacoa enchiladas

ymiFTR6XcHYDEqfsBXhlXQ.text: Cocina Madrigal was THE PLACE I had to try and was so very excited when it was the place picked for June's International Supper Club UYE. I could not wait!!  I arrived a little before 6pm to try to get some of the Happy Hour deals, only to learn happy hour ended at 6 and I had like 5 minutes to place my order, so I quickly ordered a house margarita and some chips and salsa!   The chips are homemade and so fresh and there are 2 salsas, a mild flavorful one and a habanero salsa, it was smoky & hot and soo good! Could not stop eating it!  After checking out the menu I went with the beef tenderloin steak tacos. It was three tacos on homemade corn tortillas with chipotle pomegranate marinated steak, fried peppers, Gorgonzola cheese on house made corn tortillas served with rice and beans. These are what taco dreams are made of!   A friend ordered the churro dessert and let me tell you, it was sweet bliss!  Even got to meet Chef Leo Madrigal, what a treat!   Cocina Madrigal was everything I hoped it to be and more! Can't wait to go back!

ZK3yI1C0F63fvsP7DimcCg.text: We are so happy we chose Madrigal to celebrate a bday. It was Mexican with a fresh twist. Literally very fresh and so delicious.  4 different entree's, 2 vegetarian and all worth ordering again.   Chef cane and and was super friendly.  Thanks for a great experience!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Tacos

IRuF7H2IR8IHXLf9TxRNpA.text: We were looking for place to eat before attending the George Clinton concert and my husband suggest this place! OMG! I'm so glad he did! This place is amazing! It doesn't look like much on the outside, but the inside is cute and quaint. But enough about that, let's talk about the food and service! I got the green chil enchiladas and they were outstanding! My husband had the fish tacos and he couldn't stop talking about them! All 8 of us thoroughly enjoyed our food and the service was stellar! Can't wait to go back!

h29KxETRLXERFu8LcWDlCQ.text: Overall, the food was above average (apart from the wild mushroom enchiladas - I'd come back for those). It was more like Mexican food with an American twist. Everyone was extremely friendly, and that personality definitely sets Cocina apart from other typical Mexican restaurants.  We ordered the guacamole with roasted pineapple, frozen prickly pear margarita ($10), wild mushroom enchiladas, and the taco trio (2 beef tenderloin, 1 fish).  Starters - The guac was okay, but unless you can't have a single meal without guac, I think the salsa sufficed. Margarita was delicious, but on the smaller side, a liiiiittle too small for $10 (sorry!).  The mushroom enchiladas were definitely worth the try. I was dubious because I thought "psh how good can mushrooms be". The enchiladas were covered in a creamy, tomatoey, sauce (reminded me of vodka sauce) and before that first bite of enchilada touches your tongue, you'll taste it because the strong aroma of the mushrooms emanates off your fork - such a fantastic flavor. Rice and beans were alright.  Beef tenderloin steak tacos were also great - the gorgonzola was weird at first, but I got used to it; fried peppers on top were a good addition. The fish taco was just okay - not sure what fish it was, but it was a tad dry and lacked seasoning.

OIpRhhQ-b2sNe3c4PJeAdQ.text: We were searching for awesome local Mexican food before we flew home. Cocina Madrigal is little off the beaten path and super close to the airport rental car return center.  Perfect for us.   The food did not disappoint. We enjoyed the trio appetizer, Madrigal burger, beef enchiladas, chicken burrito, the al pastor tacos, a few margaritas and the must order churros to share to finish our meal. Everything was  made fresh and came out piping hot.   Excellent service. The owner/manager came to our table to greet us and thank us for coming in shortly after we arrived. Our waitress was friendly and expedited the food when she knew we had a plane to catch. Fairly busy on a Sunday night but still no wait to be seated or served.   Great meal to end our adventure in the Scottsdale area. We would definitely recommend this place and would come back if in the area again.

dl96e5EsrMRU0nXLhEA5Rg.text: Some of the best tacos ever! I started with chips and guacamole which they make fresh in the back. Very fresh with jalapenos but it wasn't too spicy. For the entree I had the 3 tacos. I chose the Beef Tenderloin Steak (my favorite) Al Pastor, and the Tropical Fish Taco. All were very good but my favorite by far was the steak. It was also nice having the chef stop by the table to ask how everything was. I can't wait to go back and get some more.

nJbYXSOwhQSm7JqfVC95QQ.text: Delicious!  The mushroom enchiladas were the best I've ever had and the corn and the fresh guacamole were superb.  Of course having the authors coke (aka Mexican Coke) was a super bonus.  The owner/chef came by and said hello and was super friendly.  The entire experience was fabulous!  Then we had the churros!  Super yum with the crepe filled and dipping sauce.

o4E-2klSb30HcgddIK76Xg.text: I really wanted to absolutely fall in love with this restaurant because of the great reviews and the proximity to my house but it wasn't anything special! The guacamole and salsa were good but not different or unique in anyway!   We got the barbacoa, chicken, beef, and mushroom enchiladas! The mushroom was by far the best and the most unique! The beef and chicken were a bit disappointing though. The beef was watery and the green sauce on the chicken didn't have much flavor at all!  Overall a good dinner and good experience but not a new favorite!

8DwCIpA1WPZX5UdSa0Usbg.text: You go to this place with High Expectations given their ratings and recent notoriety (voted 5th best Taco's in the NATION!).  I was not in the mood for Taco's and got a two Enchilada plate (shame on me, but at least I did not get the Jamaican Chicken Sandwich that was on the  Menu!).  They did not disappoint. Decent portion size, tasty food and good service. The rating was not too good to be True!!

Xmk7bagYmlaHvRCAsLEVhQ.text: Wow!  What a truly wonderful experience!  Food was so delicious and the service perfect.  We are going back today.  There are lighter fare options, house salad, grilled fresh vegetables and a grilled romaine salad.  But the wild mushroom enchilada was incredible!  Also, the steak burrito - meat well marinated and tender.  An exceptional restaurant, clearly the chef has a vision!  Thank you!

wVRiCZaqDi-77is3l67WXg.text: This is my first time here and it was awesome and delicious. Our server Jose was on point with his attentiveness and recommendations. He made the visit here very memorable with his upbeat personality. The chef came to talk to us and made us feel very welcomed. My mom and I are visiting from Hawai'i so the service here was like the Spanish word for aloha. Lots of aloha here. The food was great even the side dish of beans and rice! The main courses were to die for and the guac appetizer was so fresh, we ended up eating it with our forks! I loved the bloody marry, but we are obsessed with the he lemon cello marg! Highly recommend this place. The mushroom enchiladas were excellent and of the three tacos I got I loved the beef and blue cheese taco! Also, best churro I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa, guacamole w/ bacon and the best lemon cello margarita and Bloody Mary to pair this. Sooo good!

OxCQ-l0YsnD3FiNxMZUtJg.text: WOW! I now understand the hype behind this place. My boyfriend and I came in on a Saturday night from Scottsdale. Luckily, we made a reservation through yelp because it was extremely busy!  It's rather unassuming from the outside and a little hard to park. But it was SO WORTH IT.   We wanted to sit near a tv to watch nba conference finals and they were happy to accommodate us! Once we were seated our server came over and we ordered guacamole, which you must do. If you come in here you MUST get it, best I've had outside Mexico (maybe even ever).  I don't care even if you "don't like guacamole" this will change your mind I promise.   They bring you chips and salsa by default and those are amazing too. The chips are light but don't break on a big scoop of guac. The salsa had some heat but was very bearable and tasty.   I ordered the steak burrito and my boyfriend got the tenderloin tacos. Both were out of this world. My burrito had so much steak and great ratio of fillings. The only thing I would change next time is not get lettuce inside. It wilts inside the warm burrito and I really have a dislike for wilted lettuce.   The tacos are unreal. I see why they are so popular. The textures the flavors and the substantial meat proportion is great.   The owner came by as we were finishing up and watching the game. He thanked us for coming in, asked how we liked our food, etc. After chatting with him a bit he told us all about the margs and how we need to try them. So we did!  The blended margaritas are SO GOOD. Not too syrupy or sweet and not too icy and not skimping on the tequila!   I would love to come back and would suggest it to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak burrito
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tenderloin tacos

xxEoHcamrmDfu1hmSX2qIg.text: First off, the staff is amazing! Everyone from the hostess, to the bartender (we sat at the bar) to the kitchen staff was friendly and very attentive. The chips and salsa include a habanero salsa that is smoky and HOT! Yummy!! We ordered margaritas and easily drank two. The guac was fresh and full of flavor. We shared the chicken enchilada, which was pretty good....a bit too much chicken (which tasted great)...I almost wanted some more cheese or something inside the burrito. The beans were the best I've ever had. I could've eaten a bowl of them! Definitely worth the stop!

qPRcN7h7P4ZdYFJ-nzSpvg.text: I am not impressed with Cocina Madrigal's food. My wife and I went for a quick to-go dinner. We ordered chicken tacos and seasonal vegetables tacos (tacos comes with side of rice and beans). The vegetarian tacos had roasted vegetables with no spice or flavor, I can understand the blandness (as you can always add the hot sauce) but the lack of flavor was very disappointing. Now the chicken tacos, it's supposed to be flavored with achiote(a spice) but there is no sign of any spice. The cost of the food, not really sure why it's so high. Very disappointed as we were hoping to find a good Mexican place in the neighborhood.

gygTfvd5JVsl_6ZVuIIEoQ.text: What can I say? Another wonderful experience from Chef Madrigal and his staff.   After plans for my birthday had to be rescheduled at the last minute, my family and I decided to return for another long-awaited visit to Cocina Madrigal. It was an extraordinarily busy Tuesday night, with two very large parties seated on the patio and in the front room, but we were quickly seated and attended to.   I had been looking forward to trying their guacamole and we ordered one right away, along with the queso fundido and chips and salsa. The guac was fresh and very flavorful with the addition of jalapenos and onions. Their salsa is some of the best in the valley. Queso fundido with sausage was a favorite of the table, containing sausage, fresh melty cheddar cheeses (none of the processed nacho cheese you normally see on menus) as well as marinated mushrooms and caramelized onion.   The one mis-step of the evening was that our drink order was mixed up at the bar (this seems to be their one area for improvement as it also happened during our first visit) but it was quickly remedied and the cocktails were strong and tasty.   For my entree I was torn between revisiting the excellent mushroom enchiladas of my first enjoyable visit, and trying something new. At the server's recommendation I opted to try the stuffed chicken and artichoke stack with mashed potatoes and fresh steamed veggies. The chicken was smoky and moist and the potatoes were fine but the standout was actually the side of veg. They were cooked in loads of butter and were mouth-wateringly good.   My family enjoyed the tenderloin tacos and birria enchilada plate they ordered. We were also told the corn tortillas are made-to-order. (I'll make sure to get some to go next time.) For the finishing touch, Chef came out to check on us and a large slice of coconut cream pie was delivered to our table on the house with a candle for me. (My request preempted their complimentary birthday churros.)   We took home plenty of leftovers because our stomachs could not handle the portions after indulging in too much guacamole and queso. I also ordered a pint of their fresh salsa to go which I will enjoy having with chips today.   I can't let the review go by without props to our server, who was attentive to our (many) requests and good natured without being obtrusive. The service was quick and we didn't even notice they were also taking care of two large parties at the same time as us, despite the jovial celebration that was going on in the next room. The service didn't suffer at all due to their busyness.   This has become our favorite local stop and we can't wait to bring put of town guests to show them what great service and dining South Phoenix has to offer!

ENXPQnFi6FmNU78AzpLYJQ.text: We've been hearing a lot about this place from our neighborhood, so we had to check it out. Everything we heard and you see in these reviews is True - great food and passionate service.   Both my husband and I are a little wimpy when it comes to heat, but everything was great for us. We had the beef and chicken enchiladas. When I asked the server about the heat for the green sauce, she thoughtfully suggested I take it on the side - just in case. It was just fine and I bathed the enchiladas with it!  No room for dessert and too early for margaritas that day. Glad we have an excuse to come.back again soon.

3RXHdOWq_2qTvR1OWpnRYA.text: Wow!  Wild Mushroom Enchiladas & Green Chili Enchiladas were amazing.  So happy we depend on Yelp when out of town.  Top notch service too.   We will definitely return!!

48x2xqKcvXS_FyQMpmxRqA.text: A hidden gem! First time here...food was amazing. Had enchiladas and Elote. So good - we will be back!!

JovWJRiI3_nKb84Kkil10g.text: Best Mexican food in Phoenix. The food was amazing, service was exceptional. Great atmosphere. I'll be back soon.

lTej5LfxeC-ys90vBbxcgw.text: The food is wonderful! We ordered the Trio appetizers and they hit the spot! Then we had a burrito, the Oaxaca tacos, and the wild mushroom enchiladas! Holy  &$@" they were delicious! This place kicks ass and I highly recommend it!

AD9iSR9gEdDSVTWNmKVq9Q.text: We had dinner here the evening prior to getting on our flight back to New York. Fantastic food and service. We really enjoyed everything we tried. The owner & chef came out to see how we were doing and if they could improve anything. We're foodies and will definitely make this a part of our future pre-flight when leaving Phoenix in the future. Job well done!  Have the Tacos, Al Pastor and Beef Tenderloin!!

xHROcUlwVmHwy3A01yAwsQ.text: My gf and I searched for a random place for taco Tuesday and this place had 5 stars so we gave it a shot.  The service was very good, John was attentive and courteous.  The burrito tasted good but the burrito did not have a ton of meat.  The Green Chile Barbacoa enchilada had enough meat with some spice but needed a bit more flavor. Overall it was a great experience and we would recommend it to everyone.

7a-AxVB4_-fQLWDU91UHGg.text: Outstanding food and genuinely attentive service. A great find in Phoenix!  Get there.

mZGTLTKDNkpx9BhCo61K_g.text: I'm a very hard person to impress with tacos but wow. Amazing. I Had pastor and fish.  Sooo good. I would highly recommend this place.

OYB3I4A70kTpIFYs2KnyGQ.text: This is my new favorite place in Phoenix!  We've dined there three times now and every time has been a super experience. Service is 5-star as are the Margaritas. Salsa is fresh and not to mild, not too spicy. (For spicy, try the habanero hot, my hubby loves it!). The food...OMG. Mushroom enchiladas are out of this world. The fish and beef tacos are yummy. Chicken enchilada are also a great choice. For desert we've tried the coconut pie and the chipotle chocolate cake. Both are fab!  I can go on, but why?  Get yourself there...you'll love it!

uWAEcZO120sJMivHXwtf3A.text: This was the best Mexican food we have ever had. The trio sampler was perfect. We ordered the beef tacos and wild mushroom enchiladas. I don't have anything I could even complain about. The chef came out and explained and dishes and everything was made to order fresh. The service was above any high end restaurant we visit. This will be the last place I get Mexican food at.

Gz-Zm8ol0oq66nUu9SsgEw.text: Superb! Four of us visiting from out-of-town continued our regular search for excellent Mexican food and found a jewel this time. The menu is familiar, but with vital additions/changes and refined flavors. The elotes were a great start. The mushroom enchiladas were a draw since one of our crowd is a vegetarian. They turned out to be one of the highlights, with a terrific ancho mole. The restaurant is off the beaten path, south of downtown in a warehouse district. The dining room is pleasant, and the outdoor patio looked nice, too, with good shading. Service was great.

CAgFF0iHSDIXnVoQ7FxUIw.text: Go straight to the mushroom enchiladas.  Don't fear the neighborhood.  You can have a margarita and the handmade guacamole too.  My tastebuds are still impressed!!!!  What a wonderful find.

CYK1Ep-4fwJaQTiNMjRiHg.text: The food is amazing. I've been here a few times. The owner of the restaurant is a very nice, attentive and very humble. The servers are always great. I highly recommend this restaurant !!!

W2WcZwJCeyZOgjkQG7duYA.text: We made a return visit in August with the whole family, and the food was again amazing! We had tacos, burritos and enchiladas. This is the kind of  excellently and thoughtfully prepared food that you enjoy immensely, think about afterwards, and make your gold standard for superior Mexican cuisine.

CqrK_KFiKcypIqu4wDywlg.text: Food was great! Came across this place as I was driving around. I had the tacos (fish, pastor, shrimp) they were delicious! Also ordered a mango margarita which was fairly delicious as well a little too heavy on the tequila but overall a great experience. The waiter was extremely friendly and very attentive. I would definitely go back.

NXK2IDGV-D3lKuicXPapjQ.text: The service was fabulous! Our waitress recommended the her favorites and the most popular items! Next, you're able to mix the tacos to your preference. They didn't disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole with pineapple, salsa, chips and mango margarita on the rocks!

EMnNp6F4HOquSqCjszOQzA.text: Love this place! Great service and food. Owner and chef will make the rounds to make sure you are happy.  Not cheap Mexican food, a bit upscale but very relaxed casual atmosphere. Get the trio appetizer!!

_rESUvYkXaS7OE9TOEhlvg.text: Dont let the location or the outside fool you.  This is a 5 star place.  Some of the best Mexican food I have ever had and I lived in Houston.  You have to get the trio appetizer it's to die for.  Service was over the top good to match the food.  I cant say enough good things about this place.  If you are in the Phoenix area and want quality Mexican at a good price this is a must.

rTqPtJ1cU96mgU5HqSaFxA.text: Wowwww!!! Best enchiladas I've ever had hands down! Get the mushroom enchiladas, sounds weird but you will be amazed. Service was outstanding. Everything about this place is 5 star!

2EuTn-90LjMFdDh_12a4zA.text: If you drive too fast - you'll miss it!  So slow your roll and stop on in!  I was in town for my every other week visit and went with some girlfriends on a quiet Monday night....  Margaritas are on point (don't miss the frozen - usually I drink rocks margs but they have the fancy frozen machine that doesn't water the frozen margs down) and the chips and salsa are  delicious to start.  I had the mushroom enchiladas (like everyone else) and the truth is real!  They are superb!  Try them!    There was free entertainment too - a man on a horse rode by on 16th Street! Only in AZ

Ht9vqYIOG_FHF98svvWA4A.text: 1st I must say that customer service is exceptional at this establishment, as soon as I walked in I was greeted with a smiling face and a prompt how are you today! The lady's here try there hardest to keep you happy the entire time! I also want to note at the end of the meal the owner of this establishment came out to personally ask me how my meal was because we did have a little issue with cheese since I am vegan and lactose intolerant but they quickly fixed this and honestly I will most definitely be coming back! THANK YOU GUYS FOR BEING SO AWESOME!!!  Mucho mucho mucho bueno!!!!

TJRi4ziRK84HHzRd3rAR3w.text: This food was amazing !! And the staff was so nice and owner even came out to introduce himself! Highly recommend the Oaxaca fundido and mushroom enchiladas

KzNHc95LDeObq8TW5IpqPg.text: Where do I begin?  Fantastic, start to finish. The wild mushroom and the chicken enchiladas were probably the best we have ever had and we've had our share. The service is outstanding and our table side visit with the owner was a very nice touch. Don't miss the Churros!!!!  We'll be back........tomorrow.

bM_W7B1vJnt7uYSZA8l0Og.text: The fresh housemade tortilla with the shrimp tacos was very good as well as the chips and salsa.  The staff was friendly and accommodating especially Thomas who was our server.  I will return.  Highly recommended!

Rqv0wqf1PcvHsC-UyUl60Q.text: Great enchiladas and friendly staff. We appreciated the extra attention they gave us and made us feel at home.   Suggestions: Temperature was a little warm, especially in the bathrooms  Bathroom layout could use some attention to include the light switch, as it was hard to locate in the dark.

l94TTz4dE7O8O-KybngUhw.text: Had dinner at this new gem tonight.  It was fantastic.  Servers were polite and friendly and attentive, and Chef Madrigal came out to visit the guests which is always a nice touch.    Most importantly, the food was delicious, starting with the guacamole and chips & salsa, the queso fundido, fish tacos, Wild Mushroom Enchiladas and Beef Birria Enchiladas.  The restaurant also has a full bar!  Great Job Chef Madrigal and crew!    We look forward to going back.

F3OSTpMLwe0blBeqZyvPAg.text: Don't let the outside dissuade you from trying this out. You might think it's a biker bar but it's nice inside and the food is fantastic. I had the mushroom enchilada. Kids had the Al pastor, steak, and fish tacos. All super good. Also try the queso appetizer. It was mixed with carmelized onions. Deliscious! Great hidden gem

2JD6BfGISaukwH7c-dBggQ.text: Great food and service. Amazing tacos and apps, salsa was spot on. Very casual good prices.

UqR7P7EB6JxyAoThiPgpAA.text: Cocina Madrigal  Amazing Amazing Amazing food!! We were greeted by Jason, the manager. He shared the story of this location.  What once was a thriving restaurant, now sold and abandoned for 4 years.  They've renovated and have done a pheoenomal job of this place. There is soft ranchera and cumbia music playing in the background.  We were spoiled with an selection of they amazing dishes. Everything, everything and I mean everything was absolutely and amazingly delicious.   The owner Leo came out to great us and was so hospitable which made for a warm welcoming.   Don't be fooled by the surrounding neighborhood. This place is a GEM.  TRY IT ALL. YOU WON'T GO WRONG!!  Signed, sealed .and delivered, Laura Montes

TvHhq4eDsUl5G3Ph2wbxFQ.text: Nice locally owned restaurant in South Phoenix. My favorite part was the spicy habanero salsa ! I hate going to a Mexican restaurant and it lacks spicy! But with this salsa I was extremely satisfied it kept you wanting more. Tried the taco trio ;veggie, al pastor and shrimp taco, It came with a side of rice and whole beans. This is a fairly new restaurant and there was not many customers which was nice since we were able to talk with the owner and his son, they were very nice ,friendly and open to feedback. Thank you for making us feel welcomed. I would go back to give some other dishes a try and definitely going back for more spicy salsa!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

X40QAv1-YrzqqGbKYKGK0g.text: The food is seriously good!  We just arrived from Seattle and this restaurant is the first place we go to. Their mushroom enchiladas are terrific. Other people seem to appreciate the great food and excellent service because on a Wednesday night it was crowded. The owner is an experienced chef and it shows. You will not be disappointed.

w5PAn6YXj28oBn7GqR7iaQ.text: Very happy we came.  Steak taco's were unreal.  Best hospitality we've maybe ever had and the place had such A nice feel to it.   Very relaxed.  We'll be coming back regularly

-bSCpVGMwHRfH52ZLR2O-Q.text: Guacamole is available off the menu as a half order if only one wants to partake and it's very good. My second favorite part was the tortillas. They were so fresh, it really made the meal.

A1QyQQZHwDRrmNexUu_o6Q.text: We stopped in today for lunch and everything was delicious! The fundido is terrific: hot melty cheese, chorizo, plump mushrooms, caramelized onions, and some heat. I ordered the Tacos al Pastor, which were very flavorful. Don't skip the churros!

67F1eB9x2vLeDP9HIP6_Pw.text: I found my new favorite Mexican restaurant. The tequila selection here is excellent and the food is exceptionally outstanding. Senor Madrigal absolutely knows what he is doing in his kitchen. The hospitality and service was well above bar here, despite visiting during the busy lunch rush. We were served by the manager who made sure we were well taken care of, while he also helped everyone else on his staff pick up their slack due to the busy inrush of customers. That is the sign of a True restautranteur. After our meal we were greeted by Chef Madrigal who wanted to make sure everything was perfect, which it was, before he cleared our table for us. Thank you for an outstanding meal and above and beyond service.

Egb346nHWJ-jSGwxvlbbag.text: Visiting Phoenix for business and found this place thanks to Yelp. Fantastic meal, great service, reasonable price. Reviews do not lie!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak tacos
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken enchiladas
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros

rW59ONGpQaYEwPUo-aPT6w.text: Totally unique quinine from a special chef / owner who is detail oriented and has incredible respect for the ingredients and the process of doing everything from scratch every day. All of his dishes are elevated unique recipes and flavors spot on.

UWWcU5Ov8WCCQr2HpyJGbQ.text: The wife and I saw this place over a month ago when we first visited the south Phoenix area. It really stands out from the other Mexican spots in the area just by it's name alone. We went last week looking to find great Mexican food; there are so many 24 hour drive through Mexican food places in the area but they all start to sound the same i.e. "Filibertos", "Lilibertos", "Fredericos". Their menus are standard fare. Cocina Madrigal has excellent guacamole, fresh ingredients, and a menu that while not huge, has something for everyone. I was surprised to see jerk chicken and Mac and cheese on the menu! I'm coming back soon. I'm getting the guacamole. I'm getting a margarita. And yeah, I'll try the burger next time.

b7irBvSX2EpFMxX2uqevMg.text: Best Mexican food we have ever had.  Wife had mushroom enchiladas and I had chicken enchiladas.  The best ever.  Mushroom enchiladas  we so unique that's what I'm getting next time.  Do not pass this place over.  Chef was super nice and thanked us.  Drinks were also amazing.

PaUdyqBbqsobAl72kFu_VA.text: The reviews raved about Cocina Madrigal so we decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed! Oh my delicious goodness! We tried the chicken enchilada and pork enchilada and mushroom enchilada. All was delicious and devoured but the mushroom enchilada was divine and out of this world! Chips and salsa and guacamole were yummy. But be warned the habanero salsa is hot! Finished it off with churros with Bavarian creme. What a great meal with great customer service! This is a restaurant we will return to often!

R7vju54YC2q5EyJnSezc9w.text: Good food. Excellent service. Everyone was very accommodating. We really recommend the mushroom dishes

HsTtn19psdVlUfHxQt16kw.text: The food is absolutely fantastic here, try the pineapple guacamole, OMG! Food is fresh fresh fresh everything made on premise from scratch!  We will be back again!

ifI5NdO03NbVl9hJiTJMDg.text: Truly a hidden gem! The incredible food is only surpassed by the excellent service.  Well-worth the visit! The mushroom enchiladas and fresh guacamole are a must!!

5FmnE3tcGk2oqeBz_iCONw.text: This is definitely one of my favorite places in town to eat. I've been there twice now, both for lunch and I've been happy each time.
