It's an unassuming little place, on 16th st north of Broadway. Super clean and cute.  You'd never expect to find what you find on the inside, but what you find is incredible. First time there, i tried an enchilada plate with one barbacoa green chili and one wild mushroom. Omg it was a flavor explosion in my mouth!  Truly incredible!  Today i encouraged more of my coworkers to join me, and we all raved throughout the meal. We started with the trio with salsa, guacamole, and queso fundido. The salsa had a perfect amount of spice, the guacamole was perfect with no element overwhelming another, and the queso was different, but delicious! If you don't like mushrooms, don't eat it and save it for the rest of us!  Most of us ordered various versions of the taco plate, another a salad, and another an enchilada plate. The beef tenderloin tacos...AMAZING!  But the al pastor and shrimp weren't far behind. Everything was beautiful and perfect and we are all excited to head back another day. One of these days, we will splurge on that churro dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbacoa green chili enchilada and wild mushroom enchilada surrounded by rice and beans.
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco plate: al pastor, beef tenderloin, and shrimp all wrapped in house-made corn tortillas.

SKMrk0mdABkgM2h7bxuYxw.text: Oh my! We aren't from around here but all the awesome reviews made us want to try it. Our Uber driver was like "WHERE are you going??" So glad we gave this place a try! It was AMAZING! The food was delicious and inventive. The guac was fantastic and so were the margaritas!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oQu53hLrDyZQnV0qRQt39Q.text: This family restaurant is doing everything right. From the welcoming environment to the service to the food, then the owner, Leo come and personally greets you. I have tried their tacos, their beans, Tortilla soup. Everything is delicious. The restaurant is clean, restrooms remodeled and clean. The bartender, servers and hostess amazing. Will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XSYOVBKyl4-e0JIGfoFnMQ.text: OMG.  My husband and I are foodies.  We eat out alot.  This is Chef prepared Mexican food.  It's awesome! This place is as good as any San Francisco restaurant!

rX9Ep37tTPRNX0v3rjXbYw.text: Amazing service, incredible food! So enjoyable. We highly recommend trying this place. We had enchiladas and tacos, you can't go wrong with any of it. Have a margarita while you're at it!

mRHfOv0VdfyHR4CmZDwsCw.text: By far the best burrito I've ever had! Not only was the staff amazingly kind, but the food was incredible. My mom and I thoroughly enjoyed our time here and would definitely recommend it!

8y4nmDc-NgC3c84OJu5cDQ.text: Wonderful food and the Chef is so proud of his work.  Bravo !!!

q8OVjZjUY9R_6a8EwUCP1g.text: This is a special place, not only in South Phoenix (where we are hard up for restaurants) but anywhere. The word of mouth on this place was not lying. It did not disappoint. My husband and I went here for lunch on a Friday afternoon. The outside may seem suspect but you quickly realize that this family-owned restaurant is cozy, inviting with a dynamic menu. The place was full of folks enjoying themselves. We even saw police officers eating and you know if they are there then it's tasty . The house margarita was smooth. My husband had the steak taco with blue cheese, jalapeno crunchies and he swore it was the best taco he has ever eaten. The corn tortillas are freshly made and the pork appetizer was fantastic. I had the chicken enchiladas which were so good. We got the churros to go to bring home to our kids but only 1 1/2 made it to the house. I highly recommend this restaurant and give kudos to the Chef who introduced himself to us!!! Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tphs8QTTSZq14e7gPjMQWw.text: First time here and it's now one of my favs. Great service, wonderful staff, nice clean atmosphere, and delicious food! We had the beef biarre enchilada and Jamaican salad. Omg the enchilada was to die for and the sesame ginger dressing was awesome Was starving and even when I realized after the first bite that I hadn't taken a pic yet...the food was so good I didn't want to put my fork down and take a pic. Lol so sorry no pics this time  #Stuffed

YkxVEB4YQWxpWmMvinlMXw.text: Leo came out and spoke with us personally, after preparing our meal. My enchiladas reminded me of growing up in West Texas; as well as, family vacations in Mexico. I will always come back when in the area. Have not had a more pleasant experience in a long time. Thank you for the amazing food and making it feel more like family than just eating out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zlvV8HZzFZTfPLgSmBqHYw.text: This place is really good and the service amazing and friendly. The mushroom enchiladas and the barbacoa enchiladas are to die for. True mexican food, loved it!

WyFTUrjMhCtJAJoUfxhskw.text: Did a quick yelp search and boy did this place live up to the reviews.  Had a great dinner with a special lady that My wife and I adore.  If you are ever in Phoenix and want a True from scratch meal....is is he place!!!  We shared the caramelized pineapple guacamole.  Which was probably the best guacamole I've had.  Anne had the Wild Mushroom Enchiladas with a Oaxaca Mole (no chocolate in the mole). I had two steak tacos and one fish.   The fish was my favorite out of my dish but the winner tonight was the wild mushroom enchilada.  The intense flavor of the mole and the sauteed mushroom made you feel like you weren't eating a vegetarian dish.  The beans and rice did not disappoint either.  It is good we don't live here because we would be poor if we were here.  This is a True Mexican restaurant that will be consistent with every bite!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CDQqOoSMeAfvHxRU1Ts6Ig.text: I took my girls here last night for dinner.  The staff was incredibly friendly and the chef even came out to talk to us.  My daughter said it was the best salsa she's ever had.  Chips were fresh.  Great corn elote and loved the mushroom enchiladas.   So happy to have a great new restaurant in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom enchiladas! Yummy!
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn Elote

P-Ihb-Y4uzdfxgJ6TJJSWQ.text: Great service, delicious food!  Everything was fresh and good.  The only missing star is for ambiance - it was extremely busy and very NOISY.  Even pictures or something on the walls (which, I think, were bare) would absorb some of the loudness - not that I like talking a lot while having a meal (things get cold) but it would have been nice to hear the people across the table from me.  Otherwise that was the best Mexican food I've had in a long, long time.  I also had to explain what a Silver Coin cocktail was, which is very similar to a margarita, but maybe others will pick up the order now and make it as popular here as it is in Santa Fe.  I loved the spiciness of the food - it was just right and not 'watered down' for the typically cowardly American palate.  Good job Cocina Madrigal!

v4d_X9O2O-y1NPrk26HPSg.text: Great food and very good at treating their customers with respect. The chef is really talkative and cares about the food he makes and how it impacts the people.

Sy5flHIr3MTg2Eet6SsjqQ.text: Amazing food super hot fresh plates food stays super warm for a long time excellent service we all loved everything we ate especially the guacamole and the enchilada sauce the red one is amazing just like the way I love it

dR49pNlAqPwk7YLz5G0n1w.text: This place was a pleasant surprise.  Their mushroom enchiladas are awesome, as well as the guacamole. This will be a regular stop for us now.  Our waitress Diana was so nice as well as the rest of the staff.

jMqLxqTTO6nDkz4m72jNuw.text: Don't let the area fool you. The food is good and service is even better, micheladas do need some improvement, authentic flavors and the salsa and chips are fantastic. The owner came around and asked us how we liked it? I was impressed as not many will do the same. MUST GET THE CHURROS THEY ARE TO DIE FOR

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dp9u6Yx9Mq5VrJlhJCGr4g.text: This is only thing about San Carlos Hotel that I liked. Delicious breakfast and fast service for a good price.

dU7RkDpgsDLW0FJi1GiJNQ.text: My husband, son and I went to Cocina Madrigal last week while on vacation.  I wish we would have tried this restaurant sooner, as we would have returned for another treat. The food was extremely fresh and very authentic...the best guacamole I've ever tasted at a restaurant. I had tacos on lettuce wraps with some veggies on the side. They were delicious and I didn't have to worry about too many carbs. Of course there were plenty of other options for anyone who wanted the traditional wraps. The server was extremely friendly and accommodating. Overall the experience was great and we got plenty of delicious food for the $.

bvAMX7DGlaRiMGbfgZLJOA.text: We were looking for a place to eat before we dropped off a family member at the airport, and we found this gem! Everything and more we were expecting from a Mom-n-Pop restaurant.  **Great food and great service**. Talking about friendliness and customer service... EVERY business, restaurant, company needs to take a page from this place's playbook.  What an amazing experience.  I wish those folks all the best.  Try the mushroom enchiladas!

9gtz5C2XMgRAcdX0GGKQxg.text: Everything was phenomonal. The steak taco was off the charts. Probably top 5 things of the best u have ever eaten. The beans and elotes were so flavoral. I am sad we dont live here so getting back will be tough. But I would borderline come to Phoenix again just to visit Cocina Madrigal. Oh, and the owner is so nice and great.

IKm-V63VIj4MN_xUNkUa5Q.text: Excellent food, reasonable prices, and a very gracious owner/chef. What more can you ask? The mix-and-match tacos on house-made tortillas were great, and the churros were even better.

6iMo8PXNF0FJvdV9N3lv4w.text: When in town a must try!  Had the mushroom enchiladas and I was impressed!  Staff was amazing and even got a visit from the chef!  Definitely will be coming back.

Rdw4VP0SpDdZY-kSgsaVbw.text: We were greeted at the door which I loved. Menu is original with local, fresh ingredients. Everything is made to order including guacamole. Authentic Mexican dishes with a few Mexican-American and Mexican-Italian dishes. Bartender made a custom margarita, and both the manager in the chef came back to make sure that we enjoyed our meal. The desserts were delicious! This place reminds me of the type of place Guy Fieri from Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives would visit. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pO6BgwFsoJEw3cXlJ24XOA.text: A new must stop when we are in the Phoenix area! So delicious, and the prices were reasonable! $38 for me an my hubby to eat and get a beer, you can't beat that. Don't be dissuaded by the fact it's in a residential area, it's worth the drive!

h3mxu6U0eVDh4X4Vih3Jng.text: Although we didn't have a full meal, we had Margaritas and beer and appetizers. It was amazing. Service was super. Can't wait to go back for a full night of eats and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CSzEKHM8eD0uR2Kr_lGBsw.text: Excellent cuisine and service.  Beef tenderloin tacos were the BEST I have ever had.  All three entrees that we tried were so flavorful and a joy to eat.  We savored our meals.  If I ever return to Phoenix,  I will go here again.  I have had Michelin rated Mexican food in the SF Bay Area - Cocina Madrigal is as good.  Fresh flavorful salsas.  Fresh Passionfruit Tea that is unsweetened.  Really a memorable meal.  The server was perfect too and happy to explain items on the menu and offered us samples to try items that we were unfamiliar with.  Clearly he enjoys the cuisine and described it well.

6JzLz7mm9i7ZeXYNaOCN2w.text: Amazing food! The service was great too. Oh and did I say the food was amazing? It was so good that we passed our plates around so everyone could take a taste. We will be back!!

J6rWDmkZIKUFvF4lTYBHCQ.text: We stopped in for a late lunch and had an incredible experience at Cocina Madrigal. The margaritas were the best I've ever had out of a machine and there was no trace of sweetener or sweet and sour mix. The service was on point and super friendly. We started with the chips and salsa which was very fresh and the chips were crisp and thin. We followed that up with the barbacoa enchiladas which were all meat and had a delicious sauce on top. We got to meet the owner who takes a lot of pride in his work and I can't say enough about how great of a time we had there.

Xybil7xTZXMwr53CQIiKVw.text: Cocina Madrigal has become my favorite Mexican Restaurant since moving to Phoenix.  I've had the opportunity to eat the their Green Chile, pork based, Chicken Tortilla Soup, amongst other dishes.  The Green Chile is flavorful, but not to spicy for those who don't like heat.  The Chicken Tortilla Soup also is a little different in its texture but has a great flavor.  They also make their own corn tortillas and everything on the menu is made from scratch.  This is definitely a good mine for food!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Chile Chicken Enchiladas
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Tortilla Soup

4hSy-p-zGhWoc5qWsJjU3w.text: This place has more than great food, they've got great employees and the owner Leo is genuinely a great person. The fact that I now know Leo goes to show how friendly this restaurant is. We came here because of the help reviews and because it was close to the airport and what a great decision. We liked it so much we had dinner and then came back the next day for lunch. The table next to us was contemplating also returning for another meal. The food was as if I had a Mexican dad and he cooked with love, everything was amazing. Although we were about to burst, Leo offered us the churros and I can say, coming from Miami where we are no strangers to them, that they were the best churros I've had in my life. Anyways this is now a must-do when I'm in Phoenix. Thanks Leo and staff!

PTU-YVwWFNHZbar6GnJYEQ.text: This place is amazing!!! There is a flavor explosion in every bite. The food is super fresh and well prepared. All the staff are so friendly and attentive and the chef came out a couple times to talk to us. I had the wild mushroom enchiladas and guacamole. Sooooooo good! My son ordered churros at the end and they were awesome - a nice touch with the crew filing and sauce. They also have a couple options for kids. Very reasonably priced, especially given the quality of food.

4ZLDMyWa4Ptj3jkr8AbwQQ.text: This  little restaurant is amazing the guacamole is glorious and the margaritas are fantastic. The tacos delicious . It is pricy for tacos but the tacos are worth the price. Will return

6xVVWBIVHOVwIwQYWjm7Cw.text: Yes. Yes. And yes. To all of it.   Had the chips and salsa, enchiladas, and tacos. Literally couldn't stop ordering because it was all so good!  yummy yummy in my tummy!

8Dfp-ITxb0gQF18Vt0CU_w.text: This was my first time at this restaurant... and it was amazing! Everything was incredible!  I had the steak tacos and they were literally out of this world.   The guacamole was to die for...   And the desserts were also incredible.   Everything was made from scratch... and it was the best meal I have had in a long time. We will definitely be back.

2CRX30G58wGRrvTcuilHGg.text: WOW! Everything we tried here was amazing. Now I see why all the 5-star reviews. We started with grilled corn. Awesome! Then some Tortilla Soup. Delicious! Followed by the Barbacoa green Chile enchiladas,  Beef tenderloin steak tacos and mushroom stuffed chicken. To die for! And wrapped it up with the churros. Forget about it!  Yeah... you'll be seeing us here again. And again.   Treat yourself and come try this place out. You've earned it ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros!!!!

19a_Ql3FLNVhgHqlS1MGEA.text: Finally made it to Cocina Madrigal this weekend, WOW!!! All the 5 star reviews are on point. Don't let the location keep you away from this jewel. Everything we ordered was outstanding. Margaritas, trio appetizer, wild mushroom enchiladas, tried all the tacos, and a chicken dish from their dinner options. I didn't eat all this by myself but I would've if I had a few hours to spare and just sit there and savor all the flavors and textures from all the items. Good job, Cocina Madrigal!

GifUNferWSzkFjfTuul49Q.text: Just stumbled across this place. What a gem! The wild mushroom enchiladas and beef tenderloin tacos were out of this world. Best Mexican food I've had in the US.

Bu1BfcZqYJEN5aqbOV1Ttg.text: I've lived in Phoenix for 2.5 years and have FINALLY found my go-to for Mexican food! The first time my fiance and I came here, we both took one bite and looked at each other in shock/excitement. He got the beef tenderloin tacos and argues they're the best tacos he's ever had. I've only tried the mushroom enchiladas, but they're so incredible I can't bring myself to try anything else despite the menu looking amazing. They have delicious house margaritas too! This place is an absolute must.

AuElZGd1hIn2MwcfUwBAkQ.text: I'm not from these parts, so I chose Madrigal based on the reviews. I can now see why they've received so many 5-star reviews in the short 9 months they've been open.    We ordered the guacamole and it was fabulous. I ordered the enchiladas - one chicken and one green chili pork - both were excellent.    While coconut cream pie is not your typical Mexican dessert, I'm a sucker for for it. It is house-made and delicious.  Our service and server were top-notch; thank you, Raudel!

oiyxOHCQ2JoGJUCDhxw5ug.text: This place is really good. The fondue is super. The tacos are awesome. The enchiladas are tasty. The salsa is so good I just want to drink it.

KRLwfSneU0UiRwQSy6HGgw.text: Came for a work lunch and the food was amazing!! I ordered tacos and they let you choose 3 of any tacos you want from the menu. The service was also amazing - the server forgot which tacos I ordered and wanted to make sure he got it correctly and offered me a free drink on the house for the inconvenience. Really wasn't much of an inconvenience since all our food still came out at the same time but it was nice of him to do that. I would definitely come again the next time I'm in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lBJlRgRjzXc1QybTzfxA9Q.text: Mexican food does not required cheese in every single dish. Sadly not an automatic place to go to

XEEMRYxBtqTZNE8GVJZEwA.text: Ok so traveling to Arizona I was jonesing for some delicious Mexican food you just can't find in upstate New York.  This place totally fits the bill.   You can tell everything is homemade.  I had the barbacoa and beef berria enchiladas and they were delicious.  Our server was fantastic, the chef checked on us twice and we even ordered dessert! My margaritas were perfect.  Definitely a can't miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

o1SYGk9GGiath7bxVAp5pQ.text: We live in SoCal so authentic Mexican food is pretty common-or so I thought. From the moment we entered, the hostess made us feel apart of their family. In my entire life, I haven't found people in the food industry who are as caring. The food tasted as if cooked by a cute little grandma,but still had exquisite taste. The portions were very very reasonable and they are more than willing to adjust anything if need be! The food didn't feel hard on our stomachs afterwards but kept us full for a four hour drive. afterwards.   If you're wondering if you should try it,please do!!! You will NOT regret it!

Vol59dYR0xkvh9xa1CIVjQ.text: Wow! What a delicious treat before our flight. So glad that we dropped our rental car early and took an Uber to this homestyle Mexican restaurant. The place was packed and for a good reason. The service was great and the food was delicious. They split all our plates for us and brought them at just the right time. We took an Uber back to PHX for our flight. Next time I have a long layover I'm going here!

ODXqv5nEi5gwhMDcRa0nEA.text: My family and I love this place. Authentic cuisine and the staff is so helpful. Definitely recommend this place for date night!

-i31W5pfKYM5QLPWiqYn9g.text: This might be the best Mexican food I have ever had and the service is great as well. Everyone is very welcoming and our server Jose is the best.   Oaxacan fundito is off the chart.   We also loved the corn and tried the fish and beef tacos that were delicious.   And the beans, yumm.  Top it all off with thin homemade tortillas.   They clearly take great care in their preparation.   We took leftovers and are already planning our return visit. :)

21LvdTgaxzD0J_d1v7N_BA.text: This place is great! The food was fresh and well seasoned and reasonably priced. The service was prompt and courteous. I will go back next time I visit Phoenix.

UJNc2sl_b5j7MCl8HMSBHw.text: This by far the best Mexican food I have had in the valley. The staff and owner are amazing and the love in the food speaks for itself. Will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

O26XhGyZitrvy2Kq5rx_zQ.text: Amazing!  Best steak tacos and grilled romaine with steak ever!  The wild mushroom enchilada rules!  The frozen and on the rocks margaritas are the best!  Don't forget the churros delicious cream and pudding!  Leo the owner is so friendly and comes out to speak to all of his guests! Great service and bar tenders, wow!!!

_jSnq2sUmhNgDxI2ROHnXA.text: I am so impressed with the food from appetizer to the entree! I would definitely recommend Oaxaca fundido and the tacos! Thank you Raudel for the great customer service! I'm new to the Phoenix area and I highly recommend this place !!

OkoVYxoiE_iyR93IQXzX-w.text: Went for the first time last night after seeing the reviews and the food and service lives up to them. We got the steak quesadilla, guacamole and taco plate with a shrimp, fish, and chicken taco. Everything was so fresh. We decided to get the churro and they were so delicious. We will definitely be going back.

CEVk6EnIom0rj5M7EzmDZQ.text: Excellent service. Great guacamole. I'm not usually a fan of frozen margaritas but they are banging here. Food was excellent. Green enchiladas were perfect topped with chipotle sour cream

I7XbFheD7qgDaRSsvfgf4Q.text: We have been looking for our "go-to" mexican restaurant close enough to Tempe to go regularly.  After tonight, we found it.  Excellent service and delicious food.

RANxvNGVJNOMN0VykLsOiw.text: I ordered wild  mushroom enchiladas and a margarita , it was really good ! Loved the mushrooms ! And the waiter was awesome , he was very helpful and super friends ! Definitely  Recommend this place !

JPyeXvyVqgkM_XlnLtR01Q.text: Wow! A hidden gem. I got the mushroom enchiladas and could not believe how good they were. Chips and Salsa and fresh Guacamole were perfect too. The master chef even came out afterwards to greet us. If you are a foodie and like going off the beaten path then it's a must try.

Y3FFNGzThNv0WrNeX7WXkA.text: This was a great surprise during our buddy golf trip last week. The menu is fairly simple, but the flavors divine.  Great tortilla soup, enchiladas, street tacos and a spicy fire chicken pasta. We all loved the minimalist (not touristy) feel of the restaurant in an old house. Covered outdoor seating is available. The house Margaritas were also well made. I did not eat it, but the chocolate pie was apparently to die for. We liked Madrigal so much we went a second timeout the last night of our trip. They are still working through minor service issue as they are dealing with their newfound popularity. I would definitely call for a reservation even if you are going mid-week. They were packed on the Monday and Thursday that we went. Eduardo and the rest of the staff and made us feel very welcome.

csNXxc7mU5Nevmea5tkaHw.text: Found this restaurant because it was the number 1 on Yelp. The food was very flavorful and delicious. We had the veggie tacos and al pastor tacos, highly recommend. The beef enchalada was also very good. The service was great and fast.

BO3irQwkJQFydNb7TiHJ6g.text: We started at the bar of this quaint restaurant where, Tom, the bartender made an incredible sangria frozen margarita. The quesadilla we shared was delicious so we stayed for dinner. Each of us sampled a different enchilada dish they were scrumptious!

h28ltS4prWIHWpw5CBbLzg.text: First off, please don't tell others about this place!!  LoL. I read the reviews of it and thought I'd give it a try, why would people lie about it, the food is amazing, the management is super friendly and like it's been said in other reviews the margaritas are awesome!!  I'm not a coconut fan, but I tried their coconut pie because of other reviews and it's incredible as well.  As I said, if you love good, spicy Mexican then try this place, but don't tell anyone else cuz we'll be calling in for reservations too soon in the future!!

9fnHBABGUH1yxAxLz9GqGg.text: This was by far the best Mexican food we have had in a long time. Two of our children are vegan and the meals prepared for them were delicious. I highly recommend the hatch green Chile pork appetizer. Wonderful food and staff.

1x78Yg5LfpwdB_DF7B1jfQ.text: Awesome traditional Mexican food!!  Originally we are from the EL Paso/Juarez MX border.  Currently we live in the Chandler area and there is nothing comparable in terms of excellent, excellent Mexican food.  Keep up the gr8 work!!

NygSnC4dqkuy4eGKK45dTA.text: If there was a 10 Star point method, Cocina would be getting 20 Starts. Nothing like this ever in my experience, from food to service to people, chef, warm and friendly atmosphere. OMG...absolutely the best ever. You Must try it. Fantastic food.

pPihr-_D4E4YX4PNQhK_gw.text: Super tasty enchiladas, soup, salsa and excellent customer service!  We were trying to do a quick meal cause we had plans and they were wonderful at getting us in and out :)

LasySys7WxQM7o_IehuzkQ.text: The food was awesome, drinks were awesome, churros were awesome, service was awesome. Highly recommend, will be back next year during spring training. Party had chips, guac, salsa, barbacoa enchiladas, shrimp tacos, and green Chile pork appetizer all delicious.

zi9x3ofOSLuHtrnrS2nE1g.text: This is one of the best Mexican restaurants I've eaten in. Very friendly staff, the food was so good from the appetizer to the dessert, fantastic.  Music was great and easy to find. We will be back there for sure!

W39F_LoAmgQVF5TdKt-RNw.text: Checked this place out after seeing some rave reviews on the Nextdoor app.  A little back story - my kids and I just loved to SoPhx from Chandler a few months ago. We always lived in the East valley and it has been so much fun checking out local flavors...and Cocina Madrigal did NOT disappoint.  My son and I visited Cocina Madrigal the other day. We actually missed it because the signage isn't great, but we were able to quickly get back on path. Small parking lot, so be aware of that if you go during happy hour/dinner. Also, it gets a little hard to hear across the table as the dining room fills up.  We entered through an unmarked door near the patio & saw a hostess stand between the dining room and the bar area. The hostess was friendly & we were seated immediately. Our server, Zay, was helpful and energetic.  We started with chips and salsa. The salsa was a little more heat than I can usually take, but I powered through because it was delicious!  For our entrees...He had the tacos (Al Pastor, Anchiote Braised Chicken & Beef Tenderloin Steak) and I had the Barbacoa Green Chile Enchiladas + a house margarita (rocks, no salt).  My son doesn't usually try new things and was questioning the pickled red onions on the Al Pastor taco, but he went for it and had nothing but good things to say!  The enchiladas were so tasty, but I was full from the chips &  salsa. Ended up taking some home...of course, my son ate the leftovers the next day  The margarita was excellent as well - glad I gave it a try!   Will definitely be back to try more things on the menu.

idLV1inBrj-x496VtDoe1Q.text: What a hidden gem this place is! Food is amazing and great service to match! Eduardo was our server but also the GM. He was very knowledgeable and helpful. The trio appetizer was great, the queso fondido was delicious and guacamole was on point! I had the mushroom enchiladas and they were amazing! My husband had 3 different tacos and they were great. We finished our meal with the churros and it did not disappoint. We will definitely be back!

T9Ydx2Ir_rTN8mrWnjBwnA.text: This is probably my new favorite Mexican restaurant, and I eat a LOT of Mexican food at a lot of restaurants. The guacamole was fresh and chunky, the salsa was just the right amount of spicy, and the queso was an interesting mix of chorizo and peppers. The queso wasn't my favorite though, but I'm glad I tried it. What was my favorite were the steak tenderloin tacos... OMG. There was some sort of a sauce on them that was out of this world, plus crispy onions (the kind your mama puts on green bean casserole, but fresh), and peppers/cheese. Omg. I miss those tacos already. Also, we met the owner, Leo, and he said this was his lifelong dream, so I must obviously continue to support him by buying his delicious tacos once a week.

GU-2o2aN6FU5f3IdzhtgNA.text: Amazing food, amazing service, amazing drinks!!! The chef came out to say hi and everyone was so nice. The food came out really quickly and it was delicious. Can't wait to come back!

H0m0i8c_XomDx2WON8RMrQ.text: Owner works the place and the food is one of a kind. The guacamole for example has roasted peppers cut up and put on top, super delicious. Will be coming back with my family.

75uW6We5kwWoS9DKYSSPqw.text: Friendly service and DELICIOUS food. Guac with bacon and pineapple to die for - warm homemade chips and salsa were delicious too. Tacos are mix-n-match which is great so you can try a few. The Al Pastor has ruined them for me from any other place. The steak taco was just layers of amazing flavors, wonderful textures with the skinny fries peppers on top. The fish taco was the best I've ever had, even off a pier in Sausalito. My daughter had the churros for dessert and they were incredible - crispy on the outside, soft and light as air inside and with a lovely cream filling.... Will definitely come back next time we're in Phoenix!

M_xBZECDQEV7I1FxlUUUJw.text: This was the best food I've ate anywhere in the Southwest. I was blown away by all he layers of flavor and the service here.

AB4zYmSIfJS0Jdmcc8QREg.text: The reviews are correct - we followed the suggestions and had the guacamole and chips as well as the wild mushroom enchiladas - we were both so full by the end but these were the best enchiladas I've ever had - it's a good thing we are from out of town or I'd be there all to often - this is a must return spot for us next spring training!!!  Thank you for great food and great service

fyLUXV6f--84fWD0-a9jsw.text: This is a great spot to enjoy fantastic mexican food.  Everything fresh and delicious.  The tropical fish tacos, birria and chicken enchiladas, and shimp tacos that melt in your mouth. Friendly atmosphere and very nice poeple.

hix-napEyB0B2iHexnJRww.text: I landed in Phoenix and surprisingly was hungry. I chose this spot because it was close and highly rated. It did NOT disappoint. When it's slow, the kitchens is open to mix-and-match the enchilada plates. I tried the Barbacoa Green Chile and Wild Mushroom. Both were good, but I think I enjoyed the Barbacoa the best. My peach margarita was perfect for this hot night. Note: they use peach schnapps.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Freshly made guacamole with chili&#39;s and pineapple.
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbacoa Green Chili and Wild Mushroom enchiladas. The rice and beans were VERY good.
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tropical Fish Tacos.

aTNElKMPCP5lmu428UCVHA.text: After reading the reviews and hearing about the hype from other people, my wife and I had every high expectations for this restaurant. To get right to the point, we were not impressed and have had better Mexican food at other nearby restaurants. One thing they did well was with the guacamole which was made fresh and was truly delicious. Pricing for the guacamole was a little high but it's fresh so we understood. My wife and I had the enchiladas and weren't impressed.. the meat portions were skimpy and the meal lacked flavor overall. The margaritas had close to no alcohol in them and after 3 drinks each hardly felt a buzz. Great guacamole, not impressed with the meal itself or the drinks.

8Y4HM7WsJ3Q5Yv2bqx-wBg.text: Went here on a whim on a weeknight for happy hour. It was amazing!  I will definitely be back!!!  We stuck with appetizers only this time around but now want to try out the other items on the menu!  Service was great - friendly server and clean establishment. Highly recommend!

ZKCkB7eZ6kt8nBF3unoLNA.text: I am Mexican. I warn you, all Mexican people...don't come to this place. It's not even authentic Mexican food at all. Not even close. Nada. It's a trap. If you want to waste 40ish dollars for two people, help yourself. My boyfriend ordered a burrito because it said it would come with steak, lettuce, and other stuff. But he got a burrito that had Spinach and steak with no seasonings. that steak tasted like Korean meat. So horrible. the only one good thing about this place is server. That server was really sweet and nice.

JsN-mHapCymEDYm5dcVwWg.text: Went here with my girlfriend a few weeks ago and we can't stop thinking about it, so good. Heading back very soon. Just like every other review, the food and service was amazing.

OeNpoGAel3f4fgJoA-zOZA.text: Wow! This place is amazing! Great food and wonderful service! Chef Leo has created a fantastic menu. The mushroom enchiladas are delicious with well balanced flavors. We also ordered the tropical fish, chicken and beef tacos. All of which were delicious. Yummy rice, beans, margarita, chips and salsa! I love that you can get the elote off the cob, it was so tasty! Chef Leo stopped by our table to drop off the Churros for dessert. Oh my... I didn't think I had any more room on my belly, but suddenly the plate was clean. Everything here was great, I can't wait to try more when we come back!

8ihfk-dPB7iuTRqdpCtYZA.text: This was out first stop before heading out on a road trip. We first got our drinks, 2 prickly pear margaritas (frozen) and a bloody Maria. All were delicious!  As an appetizer we got the trio, fresh made guac, Oaxaca fundido and salsa. All ingredients were very fresh and flavor. We also mixed and matched tacos, and they did not disappoint. All of the tacos were amazing! Be sure to have your tacos on corn tortillas. They make them in house, and they melt in your mouth!  Service was impeccable, and they chef even came out and spoke with us! You just don't see that often. The entire experience was amazing. Definitely check this place out if you've never been here!

tdOukautPLYt6E0y9OWWWQ.text: Don't miss this. It's off the beaten path, but was the highlight of our trip to Phoenix. Fresh food, great service!  We WILL be back.

LyKSeMFb0MJhzeFeixCMpg.text: SOOO GOOD and DELICIOUS!!! (Grilled elote, Green Chile barbacoa enchiladas, Pastor tacos and churros)  My favorite restaurant in Arizona by far. We live North Phoenix and the drive to this awesome restaurant was very worth it, food is authentic Mexican!!  finally I found a place that makes me feel at home (Mexico), staff was very attentive, service and personal attention from Chef and owner was 1st class!!! Definitely coming back as often as possible and recommending it to  everyone. Looking forward to bring family and friends. Thank you so much for delicious food and amazing service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Filled churros accompanied with warm authentic natilla, so delicious!!!
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious!!! I&#39;ve been missing to eat corn prepared like this and finally I found it in Phoenix, I&#39;m so happy!!!

toq43quu_ck669wkLuSfuw.text: All I can say is WOW! Everything from the food to the service was spectacular. Highly recommend the mushroom enchilada. Probably the best enchilada I've ever had and I'm not even vegetarian.

sE7h7KucWTPOhwjQ9mD7JQ.text: Eww! My hubby and I ate here because some people were raving about it. My beans came with a dead fly in them and even though we told them about it they didn't offer a discount or anything but a simple apology. Then, I cut into my burrito and this big leaf popped out with big black beans. It was the weirdest looking Mexican food I ever saw or tasted. After all that, they didn't even bring us hot sauce; we had to ask for it and the hot sauce was weird too. We were very disappointed and will never go back.

9DiUu74DxTC1Q_zYysZRwg.text: I should've left when the manager yelled at me for sitting at the bar because they don't accept the photo of my ID on my phone. I explained to him I'd just driven down from LA and was too exhausted to go all the way to the car I didn't even care to drink but my fiance wanted to sit at the bar. In LA it's not a big deal. So my fiance went to get my iD and we ordered food, dessert, and drinks and then I was projectile vomiting all night. It must have been E. coli from bad food handling because I haven't had this type of stomach pain since I was a kid and ate at a food truck. I am very disappointed with my experience since this is ranked one of the top places in the US. The bartender was lovely but the manager customer service skills were awful.

DjKE16b2JaPf3s54ZtCocw.text: Last night we finally tried Cocina Madrigal. It had been on the list of 'must try's' since opening. Five stars HANDS DOWN! It's a cute little place in the not the cutest of neighborhood's. We were greeted and sat almost immediately. Everyone here was smiling; I notice these types of things right away and I liked that cheerful vibe. The menu is simple but with more than just tacos and burritos. There were also some specialty items too like pastas and steak. We started with drinks. Our waitress didn't present us with a drink menu rather she verbalized the different margaritas and they have Four Peaks beer too. I got the Sangrita , a sangria swirled frozen margarita and it was refreshing and perfect... also. Strong without your 'knowing' it until you possibly order another and it 'hits you'! For an app , we got the trio of Chips/Salsa; Queso Fundido ; and Guacamole. I LOVED this salsa! It was fresh and the way I love salsa .. Not too overwhelming with heat but good! The queso was served in a sizzling skillet with hot peppers and didn't end up all thick in a few minutes like some queso's. Guacamole was good but loaded with peppers! My main was the Wild Mushroom Enchilada with Ancho Chile Cream ; Avocado Relish and Sour Cream. I loved this flavor combo which had a taste of mole without being overwhelming 'too mole' for the rest of the flavors in the dish. This dish was a good portion sized of enchiladas and I brought one home. It was served with beans and rice. My daughter had the Chicken Green Chile Enchiladas and it had a kick of heat! It was loaded with chicken and very good. At dessert we decided to share the Churros that were warm and filled with a cream served with a swirl of caramel and bowl of more vanilla cream! Best churros out of Madrid ! I ordered the Coconut Pie and it was very rich and good! I saved it for coffee the next morning! The manager was walking around the entire night delivering drinks and talking to guests and the chef was also! The waitress we had was also very happy and engaging; the service was great! I am a fan of all things Mexican; Southwest or Spanish! I am ESPECIALLY a fan of all those things when they are local and amazing .. Cocina Madrigal is all those things wrapped in a cool little building in what some may call 'the hood of South Phoenix'; Well. Great things are sometimes born out of places one would not expect and this is very likely..  one of them!

-DmzKxCUhXi4Hl_UGphsQA.text: Guacamole is fantastic, the chips/salsas packed with flavor. One to try is the Habanero Salsa fantastic on their delicious tacos. Definitely a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp, Carne Asada, &amp; Al Pastor taco with Rice/Beans. 10/10

cI95sYrv5FXPFUPqJvnq0Q.text: Fantastic food, great service. You absolutely get what you pay for and more.  The crew is great. They work together to keep the service excellent. The owner, Mr. Madrigal is a really nice gentleman.  They're relatively new so they do ask for feedback and that is just fine.   Awesome bar too. You could come here for Margaritas and chips & salsa. I'd come here every weekend until I got sick of it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild Mushroom Enchilada &amp; Beef Enchilada

PflTGIYJUg9YaVd2lUCbwg.text: The food was so great. I had the beef tenderloin Tacos. They are hands down the best tacos I've ever had. I highly recommend this place if your staying in Phoenix. The service was great and attentive. Definitely try the Strawberry Margarita you won't be disappointed.

-e3e0H5U-KVHlg5tvPOFGQ.text: This place is delicious. The churro desert in unbelievable. Nice and cozy too. We got to meet the owner who was very friendly. Highly recommend.

BHR0wCGQnoFIqt4odwsSEw.text: Great food. Great staff. Visiting from Jersey and found this gem. Enchiladas,  fundido,  tacos all delicious.  Our server Eduardo was incredibly helpful and polite. Definitely recommend.

z4j93ik97dR5jGIkUaPD9w.text: Ate here for the first time ever with the hubby last week. Showed up at 9:25 pm (feeling lame to show so close to closing time) and it was pretty full still even though they closed at 10 pm. While the ambiance is nothing to write home about (Leo needs my decorating expertise lol) and baby blue paint with bare walls, the food was OUTSTANDING! Best Mexican food I've had while living in the valley in over 38 years and the hubby agrees! Everything we tried was hot, fresh and flavorful. Their Oaxaca grilled shrimp taco (lettuce wrapped) made your mouth water, and the melt in your mouth beef tenderloin tacos with chipotle pomegranate marinade was to die for! Homemade everything. Their tortilla chips are fresh made, thin as can be and hot and tasty. Our server was fast, friendly and knowledgable of every dish on the menu. He recommended the Barbacoa beef enchiladas, mix and match tacos and Oaxaca Fundido and Guacamole de Casa appetizers. SO GOOD! Guacamole is exceptional! Salsa has just the right kick. Even better, Leo, the chef/owner, personally came over to our table to welcome us and thank us for coming. I have to agree with him. South Phoenix neighbors are the friendliest people in the valley, and I've lived in the east, north, west and now south. We plan on being regulars here. Nowhere better, and next time I'll be sure to post pictures!

aEbXcUnb6MfilOgh4OUmSA.text: Best  Enchilada i have had.  This is a must try place.  Bartender is great.  The atmosphere is light and a nice place.

J9g16UhpPHw6Z6n1f18nLw.text: The service was AWESOME. The food was AMAZING! On a visit to Phoenix, my friend suggested we try out this new restaurant. Let me tell you! The food was amazing! The drinks were well worth the trip! Zay was our knowledgeable server. Very friendly and accommodating. His food suggestion were on point! I ordered the Beef Birria Enchilada and the Barbacoa Green Chile Enchilada. VERY MUCH satisfied with my choice!! On my next visit, I will definitely make this a regular stop!

NC1ZGGuFEWePWeEC3lx9Ig.text: Wow! This place was amazing. I had the chicken enchiladas with green Chile. There was so much flavor packed inside of them. The parking lot was full on a Sunday night so we had to park on the street but well worth it. Will come here again and again now that I've found it.

mgHM7PRo7C2HH3OmfiQ3lQ.text: Phenomenal place with the friendliest people you'll ever find. A bit above the normal price point for the area, but the fresh ingredients and authentic tastes are well worth it. Make sure you try the made to order guacamole, which is hand delivered by the chef/owner.  Shrimp tacos are the best, as was the humongous chicken burrito. Give this place a try!

zuS8uzyRcf9auFNzTeAMAg.text: I want to shout it from the mountain tops: THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!!! Leo Madrigal, the chef and owner really takes pride in his work. He served us excellent food with the freshest ingredients- even the tortillas are freshly made to order. This guy would impress Gordon Ramsay with his simple menu, great staff, clean and comfortable dining room, and delicious food. We ordered the mushroom enchiladas and beef enchiladas and some house guacamole. I would've taken pictures of it but we devoured it all too quickly! Erin, our server was excited to share her favorites on the menu and she was really friendly and gracious with us. Chef Madrigal personally delivered our guacamole to us and checked in to make sure everything was going well. Plus he told us a little about himself and that was really cool. I love this community and that Chef Madrigal is part of it! Definitely coming back here again! I came for the guacamole and I'll stay for all the rest being so amazing! Thanks guys!! Muchas gracias!

HZzOodfS-zjJ2L2CTlmFpA.text: We have eaten here twice and both were fantastic experiences. No negatives; which is unheard of for a new restaurant. The owner/chef, GM and staff are fantastic. The food is superb!  We had the Wild Mushroom Enchiladas, combo taco plate (beef tenderloin, shrimp, chicken), Chicken Artichoke & Mushroom Stack, Barbacoa Green Chili Enchiladas & Chicken Enchiladas. Everything is fresh and spiced perfectly. It's obvious they take pride in the quality of their food and thei service. We will return!    We have now dined here 7 times and the only miss was an over cooked hamburger, flavor was good and fries were great. This meal was comped even though the burger was consumed and we didn't want it comped. Service and food is still outstanding.

m8U_uXiuUw_eRmVk9fKx2A.text: What an excellent experience. Cool vibe, great service and the food lives up to the 5 star Yelp rating. I had a couple beef tacos and a shrimp taco, and ordered the guac app. All of it was delicious and I will try and make it back there before my work assignment in Phoenix is over.

ncVm61m_Z2wioBUmC5Ep2Q.text: Oh my...found this little gem by asking Siri for good Mexican food near the airport. What a fantastic surprise. If you are any where near here check this place out. We got the trio for our appetizer and shared Mushroom enchiladas. The guacamole and salsa were fresh and wonderful. Wish this place was near us in Va!

bgA0wZO-6EF-Y-MrvlIzyQ.text: best mexican restaurant....Excellent service...A must to come here...No wonder they have 5 stars...Here is 5 more

KQttknoLFvucbCt5cWWcLA.text: Dude, this place has the best veggie tacos EVER. Plus, everyone is super nice, and the hot sauce is pretty bomb. Also, HOMEMADE COCONUT CREAM PIE. Seriously, just take my money.

HqY8T3OKWhkd6oQRbTogmQ.text: Just got in from Medford, Oregon and wanted some True Mexican food so my daughter found this place on yelp. It was awesome, extremely fresh food. Our favorite was the guacamole, truly some of the best I have ever had. The mushroom enchiladas and pork green chili enchiladas here where also amazing. Outside neighborhood a little foreboding but a full parking lot tells you what's in store on the inside. Super friendly staff and the owner/cook comes over to check to see if your satisfied. Check it out.

awoIOYnMnUHFhRYFEBswag.text: The food was pretty good the service and attention to detail was outstanding.  I can't remember the last time anyone paid that much attention to us and made sure that we were happy.  I believe everyone at the restaurant came out to greet us and thank us for taking the time to eat there. The location is a bit sketchy but the food was pretty good but the service was something that you would find at a five-star restaurant.

RppWh9TLwvFZ5y8S8rmbKw.text: We went to this restaurant based on some recommendations. We ordered guacamole with our chips and salsa. The guacamole was very fresh and was very well prepared. We ordered tacos, mushroom enchiladas and chicken enchiladas. All the dishes were cooked to order and very fresh. Food tasted heavenly and the margaritas were potent and excellent. Overall our dining experience was excellent.

BGzvgoVTaTrzlw9EF6IcxQ.text: Brand new restaurant but you would never know other than just a few reviews. Great service, amazing food, cold beer. I had the chicken enchiladas and they were delicious. The chips and salsa were even fantastic. The Chef came out and visited with me which was a nice touch. Come support these nice people.

J-jhR9RcLzU97Ao0NxEd9A.text: We came in on a saturday evening. First of all, we ordered margaritas AND water. For some reason, the bartender could not handle both. Our 9 dollar margaritas arrived just fine, but i had to go to the bar and request the water. That set me off the wrong way. Then a couple of girls at the bar left, and came back. We had no idea, we just know that we  got to look at what appeared to be dirty dishes, not picked up. That looked terrible. Also, i could see  the cleaning supplies behind the hostess stand. Might be a good place for a little curtain. Not appetizing. Just details with service that need to be worked out. The food however!  The food is terrific. I had the chicken enchiladas, my husband had something beef. Very interesting, spicy and the rice and beans sides were just as good, not a boring sidenote. We were quite pleased. The afore mentioned margaritas were great as well. We hope to be back soon.

Amu1zSZZpmbKBhaJRPdKSw.text: We waited for the restaurant to open and it did not disappoint. Great service as soon as we walked in the door. The place was nice and cool for our summer weather. Everyone said hello as we were greeted. There's a bar with seating for about 10 people. The place holds about 70 people. We had Zoey as our server. Very nice and personable. We tried the margarita and beer, ice cold yum yum. Ordered chips and salsa. Salsa was fresh with fresh chips. The owner and Chef Leo came by and said hi. Very nice touch. We ordered three tacos with beans and rice. Also a grilled romaine salad with grape tomatoes, bacon bits and a yummy dressing. Overall experience was great! We will definitely go there again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pQKbb8vnDNytfO-76M-5Kw.text: Came to Tucson for work for a week and still managed to come here twice. Made that 2 hr ride down the I 10 totally worth it. Tenderloin Tacos were unreal. The chef came out and offered us his homemade habenero hotsauce which was also bangin. He then proceeded to check on us regularly and actually walked outside as we were getting in our car to make sure everything was enjoyable. Love this place!

PfL26NCg6RtDFNKZoRulJg.text: An absolute amazing experience! The food was delicious! Do not judge by the exterior...the server Bria was attentive and provided suggestions! We ordered the appetizer trio, the shrimp and fish tacos, and churros. The food was hot, fresh, the corn tortilla was made in house. I would highly recommend visiting this restaurant if you are in Arizona.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EK-xDKzxnGJKMGdMBZMONw.text: This was our first stop after we left the airport. Some of the best Mexican we have ever had. We started with $6 happy hour margaritas and the trio appetizer which was their homeade tortilla chips and salsa and made to order guac and queso (happy hour is $2 off appetizers and the $6 margs until 6pm). Definitely do the trio app and margs. I had the taco platter that comes with 3 tacos and you can mix and match them. I chose 2 fish tacos and 1 shrimp and did 2 on their homeade corn tortillas and 1 on a lettuce cup and it comes with beans and rice. My parents had the beef tenderloin steak tacos which were my favorite, then the shrimp were our 2nd favorite and then the fish. They were all fantastic and fresh though. We also had a wild mushroom enchilada which is their most popular item and the best enchilada we have ever had and a beef enchilada. Great service and the food came out fast and fresh. We might have to stop here on our way back to the airport in a few days  It's off a busier road but they have a big parking lot and a sign out front with their name.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild mushroom enchilada

lTPC0awkSxB8OET7bwPKoQ.text: What an unexpected delight! After travel filled with delays we wanted a bite to eat before heading to Sedona during rush hour traffic. Turned to trusty Yelp and found a highly rated Mexican restaurant less than two miles from the airport. We approached with some trepidation.  The building is unassuming in an industrial area. Not much activity at 3:30 on a Thursday afternoon. We were pondering our options when Eduardo, the GM, invited us in and said he would take care of us - and did he ever! We started with the trio appetizer. Freshly made guacamole, chips and salsa and the to die for mushroom fondue served with fresh hand made tortillas. Everything was so good we decided to share our entrees. Beef tenderloin tacos with fried onion, peppers and Gorgonzola, three mushroom enchiladas and Barbacoa enchiladas. A couple of ice cold margaritas and a spicy nut chocolate pie rounded out the meal. We were enchanted to meet Chef Leo who curated the menu and the service was on point. We talked about our experience all weekend and had to leave Sedona early so our friend could taste for herself. We were not disappointed!  Finished the meal with the most delectable churros. I am not one to photograph my food, but here you go!  Do yourself a favor if you are ever remotely near the Phoenix airport - give this place a try. Tell Eduardo and Leo the ladies from San Francisco say hi!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7DO2vluY_nlf8c6TB8qPfQ.text: Amazing food!!! We ordered chicken enchilada and jamaican sandwitch. Perfectly made! And the service was good.

kQEiKJfwp4mHP-L-00cfVw.text: This place is awesome. I was in Phoenix for and afternoon and wanted to get some good tacos before heading back to Tucson. Found this place on Yelp, and was very happy to find that the reviews are spot-on. I got three different types of tacos, Beef Tenderloin Steak, Al Pastor, and Achiote Braised Chicken. All three were delicious, but next time I'm getting all three Beef Tenderloin Steak. It was out of sight! The beef was tender and seasoned just right, not too salty or dry. There were carmelized onions on it that I was not expecting, but totally fit right in with the personality of the taco. I chose flour tortillas, but next time I'll probably get corn. The waitress recommended them because they make them fresh there, but I foolishly went with flour. And regretted it as I watched other tacos come out with the corn. Service was excellent. Everyone was attentive and I must have had 4 different people approach me to ask how I was enjoying my meal. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Tenderloin Steak, Al Pastor, and Achiote Braised Chicken tacos

9xlhIA2A96yW2kiFt2UDnQ.text: Portions were small, food smelled like latex gloves and it was not even close to be authentic cuisine. Eat at your own risk because you will definitely feel sick after an hour.

TocFDSDJWN7R3kdQg0zPAQ.text: Talk about don't judge a book by it's cover.   Great food, Service, and the owner talked to us for about 10 minutes on his journey toward opening Cocina Madrigal.   The chicken enchilada was the most tender I have ever had.  Guacamole was fresh and freshly mixed by hand,  El Pastor tacos were on point, and then I finish it off with one of the best coconut cream pies (never knew a Mexican restaurant known for this).  5 stars.  I would say 6 stars if they could be a bit closer of a drive :)

nAVdhhICx1NOCFEqXfyopQ.text: This place is amazing! My food was very good and the customer service was great. So many beautiful and tasty surprises. The one hour dinner just flew by. I recommend others to come try this place out.

hZ2W0pAFLKYDrg-tVP_bnw.text: Do not miss this authentic homage to Mexican food. Homemade prickly pear frozen marg was light, sweet (but not sugary) and smooth. Enchiladas made with fresh tortillas. Barbacoa green Chile ones were so full of flavor but equally light on oil. Simple straightforward clean Mexican food. Sit on the porch and experience authentic food and Phoenix. Yaassss

IN0PlVjkenFbhrHOKh_P2A.text: Excellent... I was nervous but it was really great.  Excellent service!! The beef tacos and green chili pork was so delicious.  One of my new favorites.

dX5RY2Rwp8krVOt7GoucDg.text: Loved this place! The food is delicious and service is excellent. Margaritas are very good! Friendly staff. We went there twice during our 4days stay in Phoenix. Highly recommended.

gQQJZoYLq5aoAgukebalEQ.text: We flew into Arizona for spring training and wanted some good Mexican food. This place definitely hit the spot. They open at 11am, but we arrived at 10:40 and waited in the parking lot for it to open. At 10:45 they waved us to come in. The waiter was very nice. And we had 2 cold beer and our appetizer before the time the restaurant was supposed to open!  The food was amazing, the service was great! The chef even came out and made sure everything was good. I would definitely recommend this place and come back when ever we are in town!

FGkP_p6t3QQ0uO0WGqoyJQ.text: The chef here knows what's up.      Nothing against 'bertos and all but this isn't that kind of a restaurant.     The recipes have depth and character - full on Mexican style comfort food for what ails you.     Come hungry and thirsty.

eYQSMVIN0-e7qdMKHfiTQQ.text: Fresh off a flight from New York this little jewel was an oasis to a couple of weary travellers. The staff was welcoming and warm. The food is very well thought out and executed, Fresh and clean on the palate. The churros are a dessert must have. Thank you Cocina Madrigal, we will be back soon.

fnGePzrrAtdRbr_REHQpVA.text: Firts time delicious tacos friendly people waitress best services margaritas the best

c40cdo0x8GguowW1JgYZ6Q.text: Great food at this place. We heard about it from some friends  and decided to try it. So happy we did . The mushroom enchiladas was incredible!

MQ0qXIJSs-J53eKnUX9oAw.text: Excellent!! Had 1 barbacoa & 1 wild mushroom enchilada plate..  met the chef, humble & appreciative, this place is definitely on our return list!!

mkAzj3CazIriRd7ht-P93Q.text: Very good food Guacamole among the best I've ever had. Very good salsa as well. Had enchiladas and grilled romaine. The grilled to Maine was awesome the enchiladas were good also.  The staff is very friendly and nice. Our waiter specifically forgot to bring us an extra side of salsa which turned out ok since we had more than we realized.. Anyway he apologized later for it and felt so bad he brought us salsa to take home! It was a very sweet gesture. It's stuff like this that really makes me want to come back to a restaurant.

s5wcw6EHD3N36LJzMC1nZQ.text: We believed the hype and we were really glad.  We had business across the valley from our home today, and decided the slight detour to the south would be worth it based on the reviews.  We arrived just after opening and were welcomed at the door.  The very personable team here is exceptional.  Our server, Nallely, graciously transitioned our original "guacamole only" order to the Trio.  Don't miss this trio! Fundido and guacamole and both salsas (we especially liked the hotter salsa) are fantastic.  Chips and corn tortillas part of the deal.  Then came the entrees.  My wife had the Grilled Romaine and I had the steak tacos.  We were left with mouthfuls of flavor!  We had always been fans of the past Z Tejas menu and it seems like Chef gets to do everything here corporate probably wouldn't allow at the larger company.  We remarked to Nallely that it looked like someone was having fun in the kitchen!      Impeccable and unobtrusive service coupled with such a warm welcome from the first hello makes you feel right at home.   We already reached out to our lunch buddies to join us next time. Go Here Now!

Crb8yI7SpxMa-CZ2g9b9Lw.text: Excellent food and service. We like it each time we go. As long as we live in South Phoenix (until November) we will continue eating here.

BZjZBbzECk_woozDo5f15g.text: Everything is so delicious. It's not your typical greasy, heavy, Americanized Mexican food. This is gourmet, absolutely amazing food.

bCrLr2TmtG1Nf7j0_gQAxQ.text: We moved to Phoenix few years back from the east coast. Coming from NYC which has some amazing restaurants and also having traveled across the globe has made us rather experimental... esp. in our pursuit of culture and food, so yes we admittedly crave authentic food and amazing experiences. Moving to Phoenix we quickly discovered the valleys many restaurants serving amazing Mexican cuisine and since then have been on a search for the best tacos. Being a pescatarian we have always had a hard time to find alternates that match the quality, enthusiasm, perfect balance of protein and flavors in something that are not carne asada. Till date La Santisima was hands down our go to place for its salsa bar and Mexican food. Looks like today we have found another gem to add to our growing list of favorite restaurants.  I am glad today we felt like trying something new and hence skipped our planned trip to barrios cafe and ventured south to this wonderful lil gem that opened few months back. We tried a combination of different tacos one of each fish, shrimp, braised chicken and veggi taco. Along with our serves recommendation of mushroom enchiladas with mole sauce. I don't think the mole sauce was authentic or similar to what I have had before none the less it was still amazing and we thoroughly enjoyed it.  The star of the evening though were the prickly pear margarita and the shrimp tacos. The shrimp taco was perfectly done and had generous amount of shrimp. No fillers there. We thought may be it was a fluke that someone got the shrimp cooked so perfectly hence we ordered another helping. But it was still bang on ... I think out of all the tacos we had that was our favorite ... we will be coming back just for this. Keep up the amazing work !

4lkwo_v3eWmYwnyHp_4uug.text: Hands down the best Mexican food I have ever had. Get anything that has there mushrooms in it. Eduardo is the most amazing general manager ever and you will devour anything he tells you about and not regret it. Telling everyone I know about this place. Also the jalapeno margarita is amazing

FV3x02zfnsNilqqvKvsfRA.text: Probably one of the best lunches I've had in memory. My colleagues and I landed in Phoenix after flying in from Indianapolis. Maybe it was the beautiful weather in early spring in Arizona that's affecting my judgement... but I think that was just an added bonus. We were all blown away. Our food was incredible and the service was simply amazing.  Leo, the chef came out to greet us twice. He was so kind and it made the whole experience special. I definitely can't recommend the enchiladas, or this beautiful restaurant enough.

4_N42Kvt9aMvP1JrtEeXeg.text: We'd been restaurant hopping all day and stumbled upon Cocina Madrigal. I was craving elote all day and at $3.95 found the price to be very reasonable.  The salsa was amazing and the elote was delicious. My pineapple cilantro margarita (not on the menu yet) needed some additional pineapple juice for sweetness.   However, the customer service and overall friendliness of the staff can not be matched. These people obvious love what they do and we will be back.

lKIljpyscOa-jO8IKP0pTg.text: Hands down the best Mexican food I have EVER eaten. Just wow! I had the Barbacoa enchiladas and my husband had a steak burrito and both were amazing. The hatch Chile sauce was really good, the meat was tender and super flavorful. Even the beans and rice were amazing. Margaritas were really good as well, although a little on the  small side. Will go out of our way to make sure we eat here every time we are in Phoenix!

Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbacoa enchiladas and Steak burrito.

henyB0FLdT0EWz1HyIfQMA.text: My co worker and I found this restaurant on yelp and we are impressed.  We ordered the trio chips which comes with guacamole, salsa, a homemade hot sauce, and queso.  The queso was sooo good, it came with mushroom and chillis.   I am absolutely sure it was made from scratch.  I have never had such a unique queso.   For our meals we both ordered the chicken enchiladas; which were excellent.     When we finished our meal the chef walked over to our table and told us that he hoped we enjoyed our meal.  What a special touch that you do not see that much anymore.  I will be going back to this summer notice Mexican restaurant.    This restaurant is not fancy, it is authentic, but won't break the bank.

aCxFt6E75adzMMMwW0zEQw.text: The food was AMAZING. I found this place on yelp and definitely plan on going back again. The tacos are delicious and they have the most amazing mushroom enchiladas.

IO_mMNkQJ4aQre1lfv5V-g.text: Amazing! It's hard to find a good fish taco but they did it! We also loved the mushroom enchilada! The wait staff was very friendly and the owner stopped by our table, very humble and kind. We will be back!

8mTbZjPDcucQEX5cINTtBA.text: My go to for finding good eats while vacationing is Yelp. It has been extremely successful while visiting Phoenix for the 1st time. Just left Cocina Madrigal and it was delicious! I ordered the yelp fav Wild Mushroom Enchiladas loved it. Also ordered Grilled Elote beautiful taste.   Friendly staff, clean environment, definitely worth checking out. Planning to go back before leaving town to try out more of the menu.  I ate the Wild Mushroom Enchiladas too fast for a pic but snagged one of the churros.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious cream filled churros

iFshCds8v3m7FS6QItIq_w.text: After hearing good things recently, we decided to check Cocina Madrigal out on Tuesday night.  Moderately busy, we were seated immediately by a polite and friendly hostess.  I had their house marg / rocks / salt and it was well made and refreshing, not overly sweet.   Clearly from fresh ingredients.     Next we ordered the Trio - Oaxaca Fundido, house guacamole, salsa and chips.  All were ample and delicious.  The Fundido was my favorite, nice level of spice, very tasty.  The guac is not simply mashed up avocado - it has lots of goodies mixed into it and was a huge portion to dip chips in.  Their house salsa is amazing.  Really good flavor on the mild-medium heat level.  Tried the habanero salsa as well and it wasn't as hot as I expected (which is a good thing) but was also bursting with flavor.     I then had the barbacoa enchiladas with rice & beans.   Simply amazing, huge flavor, very satisfying.     Then we moved on to the coconut pie and churros for dessert.  I am not a coconut fan but actually liked this stuff.   The churros had some sort of cheese or custard filling in them that was a little savory, and dipping them in the provided sweet vanilla caramel sauce blew me away. They were so good!    Finally, the service was fantastic.   Waters were kept full, other drinks and food were brought out expediently, and every employee we interacted with was friendly.    We will 100% definitely go back.  Very happy to have Cocina Madrigal in south Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. These churros were filled with some sort of cheese or custard, out of this world dipped in the vanilla caramel sauce.  So so good.
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Pie.  I&#39;m not a big coconut fan, and I still liked this stuff.
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbacoa Enchiladas totally wowed me.

9hGVSv7GDTlX4qAVTi6Z4w.text: Make sure to place this restaurant on your must try list! I tried their green enchiladas with rice and beans. Hands down the best green enchiladas in town!    Cocina Madrigal makes it easy to support local business. I've been here twice after my first visit. Don't be surprised if you meet the owner, such a nice and welcoming gentleman.   From their drinks to street style elote. This is a truly a hidden gem - great addition to the valley. I do admit the area is a little rough but the food and drinks are amazing so don't be scared okurrr.   P.S. Make sure you don't leave the restaurant without having their tasty churros!

Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Old Fashioned

S6fn4oSQm3qFE17iVUOqpw.text: Can't say enough you will never go wrong. Love the food appreciate the amazing service. Location is nice too

Aw0xo4n8sNzyIqa63Ldbmg.text: Very good! I'm not a mushroom fan, and I ordered the queso ( my fault for not reading the ingredients ), and without hesitation, the waiter brought me a new order with no mushroom.  My main entrees were the Tacos Al Pastor, and they had a lot of flavors! I will be back to try the other tacos!  Great service as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al pastor, steak, fish
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al pastor tacos

LpEQTJwoUMVlQDOcwkjnJw.text: Soooooo awesome! Mushroom enchiladas are amazing!!! Beet tenderloin tacos are awesome too! Can't wait to go back and try more!

DQlmp-TJqujwBtO0pf7l7Q.text: Hands down the best tacos/Mexican good I've ever had. Everything from the appetizers, tacos and burritos exceeded my expectations. It's not your typical Mexican restaurant, it's truly a hidden gem

OXsBZT4x7YvNWPu3rjPGaA.text: Met my brother and his wonderful family at Cocina Madrigal for dinner, a day after he went there for the first time. Yes, he liked it that much.  Given my brother's good taste in food, I knew we were in for some good eats.    For starters, we went with the caramelized pineapple guacamole and their Oaxaca con Queso. The guacamole was on point. The pineapple gave the dish a real nice, refreshingly sweet flavor. As for the Oaxaca, oh my gosh, it was awesome. You have to try it to appreciate how darn good it is.  Dinner continued with some great entrees.  I ordered the Artichoke and Mushroom Stuffed Chicken. I was planning on sticking with a more common Mexican Dish but the thought of cilantro pesto chicken with artichoke, mushroom, and pepita seeds sounded uncommon and tasty.  The dish ended being as good as it sounded and popular with everyone who tried it.   Lastly, even though I think our entire table was full, we had to have their churros and coconut pie. The warm churros and dipping sauce were a hit and the good old fashioned coconut pie was as good as any grandma could make.  As you have read, the food was divine but just as special was the service.  From the hostess, to the waitress, to the chef and owner, all greeted us and made sure we were happy.  They went out of their way to make us feel at home and that is just what Cocina Madrigal was to us that night.  We will be back soon and I already have my mind set on my next order.

Y3TU-XR-7ZgnWxPWg0anAQ.text: We came here on a whim after reading all these great reviews about this place. I have to be honest, I was a little skeptical at first but I'm always open to try out new restaurant so we decided to give this place a try. Wow! I was not disappointed. All these reviews are accurate. This place is awesome. The food is top notch. I have to say that so far, this place is the best Mexican restaurant I have ever had since I moved to Arizona 5 years ago. My husband loves Mexican food and he has always tried to bring me to all these different Mexican restaurants and get me into liking Mexican food but I wasn't impressed and was really into it. After today, this place has changed my mind. We ordered Hatch Green Chile pork as a starter. I then had chicken and wild mushroom enchiladas as an entree. My husband had a burrito. Everything was delicious. They weren't overly seasoned, or overly slapped with cheese to try to make the dish taste better. The amount of seasoning and cheese and everything were just right. They were flavorful and delectable. I also had a house margarita and oh boy! That thing was strong and good. Don't expect this place to be fancy and all. It's just a little shabby little place, like a little hole in the wall (or in the neighborhood) but it's totally worth your visit and your business. I live quite far from this place but I definitely won't mind driving all the way down here for some food Mexican food.

5ejQCbr5ymbwhbOvFaNjBw.text: My husband and I went there last night as it is so close to his work! I am so happy I found this place through the Yelp reviews. Everyone was so nice and our waiter answered all my questions. My husband and I both had the tacos and you get to choose 3. He loved the fish one! I loved the beef and the chicken. We highly recommend this place!

hs79sx-IxMRtPg-Fyjg3Ow.text: Having lived all over AZ, Southern CA and Austin, TX, I'm extremely particular when it comes to excellent authentic Mexican food and let me say, THIS IS IT! From the salsa, to the homemade, made to order tortillas to the Bavarian cream filled churros, the food here is as elevated as the service! The chef Leo makes you feel like family and you want to keep coming back.  I'd give this place 6 stars if I could and wish they could from to Austin!

IrtgTMJhPomI_8JtGbHh7w.text: What if you had achieved elite status as a corporate chef for a well known nationwide restaurant empire?  You'd probably stick with that gig for awhile I suspect.  But what if you left all of that behind to start your own place?  I can well imagine myself being pretty terrified, but Chef Leo Madrigal seems like he's had a plan all along.  As of my visit here on a Friday during happy hour, Cocina Madrigal is the #2 restaurant in all of the valley on Yelp.  Given the abundance of Mexican food spots in the valley, that's really saying something.  So it was with curiosity (and hunger) that I made the journey to south Phoenix.  It's easy to miss Cocina Madrigal, located in a nondescript beige building on the northwest corner of 16th Street and Wood (about a 5 minute drive south of Downtown Phoenix in the South Mountain neighborhood).  There's outdoor patio seating for probably 20 or so, but as mentioned the outside doesn't look like much.  The interior however is a super relaxed almost cantina style Mexican restaurant.  The interior can probably cram in up to 80 with the room pretty much equally split in two.  One side has a dining room, the other side has the bar and some overflow dining seating.  Arriving just after 4pm, I saddled up to the bar itself which can seat about a dozen patrons (and did by 4:30).  Chef Leo Madrigal is the man behind the menu at Z'Tejas, part of the Paul Fleming restaurant empire (which includes Flemings Steakhouse, Paul Martin's, Pei Wei, and PF Chang's) that at one point had dozens of locations around the country including the valley.  But before Z'Tejas' eventual demise, Leo decided it was time to move on and do his own thing.  And Leo is largely keeping his menu approachable while also feeling slightly upscale.  Traditional Mexican favorites abound but there's also some Italian, Jamaican, and even Mediterranean notes here and there.  For my first spin here I kept it pretty traditional.  The mantra according to the menu is Tacos & Tequila.  Well alright then, let's start with a house margarita on the rocks.  A little salt on the rim, the right mix of citrus and tequila, and you've got a winner to start things off.  Now for the food.  I skipped the chips and salsa.  I wanted room for other good stuff.  So I began with a cup (which is basically a bowl) of chicken tortilla soup.  Roasted and pulled chicken, slices of avocado, fried tortilla strings, and even some cotija cheese in a savory broth.  They'd whipped up their first batch for the dinner crowd so I got it fresh.  And boy was it.  Tender chunks of chicken, mixed with a great crunch from the strings and plenty of avocado and cheese to smooth it out.  One of the best tortilla soups I've had (right up there with Roaring Fork's).  For my main entree, it was taco time.  Basically you get a three taco platter with rice and beans.  I opted for a chicken, pork, and steak taco.  The chicken taco includes avocado, cheese, red beans, and pico de gallo.  The pork taco includes roasted pineapple, bacon, red onion and cilantro.  The steak taco includes fried peppers, gorgonzola cheese, and a chipotle pomegranate marinade.  A glorious trio.  I got them all with corn tortillas (the only way to go in my book) and the flavors of the marinades and cheeses popped in every one of them.  They're also bigger than your average street tacos.  Finally, there's just one dessert here, but apparently they only need one.  Their churros dessert is accompanied by a cup of cream and doused in caramel.  Easily sharable, but I demolished this thing.  The main reason?  The creamy center of the churros.  Mix that in with the cinnamon crunch of the exterior plus the cream and caramel?  A perfect bookend.  Total cost for all the food, margarita, tax and tip came to about $38.  Fans longing for the flavors and creativity of Z'Tejas' glory days will no doubt find some of the menu familiar, but without the elegance or pretentiousness of a corporate restaurant.  In fact Chef Leo himself came out to shake my hand and ask me for feedback on my experience at the end of my meal.  Talking to Leo, there's little doubt he's thrilled to have a place to call his own.  And its clear the valley has responded, giving the South Mountain neighborhood a food destination.  Z'Tejas may be long gone, but Leo Madrigal is clearly not going anywhere.  Lucky us.
