YTOihd0z2B2UDBeLo-wUvA.text: Excellent service and great authentic Mexican food! Waitstaff was great, helpful, and had plenty of recommendations, even made a custom salsa on request for us because we were looking for something spicier! EiZVaHzlP3GIxAjcbfCI6w.text: The other day, an outsider scolded me on Yelp, claiming that because I'm from Phoenix and Phoenix food lacks flavor, that my opinions are irrelevant when reviewing any establishment outside of the city (i.e. San Diego, Los Angeles, etc).  After giving this insult more thought than I probably should have, I regret not following up with the individual to find out just exactly what restaurants they are basing their opinion on. Because while we're definitely guilty of a lot of crap restaurants, especially Mexican ones that give the cuisine a horrid reputation, Cocina Madrigal definitely isn't one of them.  If you read up a little bit on chef Leo Madrigal, you'll find that the guy has some respectable "food cred" in both the corporate world with Z'Tejas, as well as playing a role in developing menus at a few other popular joints like Hopdoddy and Taco Guild.   In short, there's a lot of great stuff to be found here, most notably with their enchiladas and guacamole. We've visited on two separate occasions and despite some initial hiccups with service screw-ups, have been mostly pleased with their offerings.  Madrigal offers some very good guacamole, but despite their affinity for adding things like pineapple or jalapeno bacon, we've found that it works best in its purest form. Excellent flavor depth, without being guilty of overkill. Additionally, the fundido packs a bit of spice, but is also very good. Their grilled elote is a bit unusual, exhibiting a subtle sweetness to it, almost like a caramel of sorts. It is good, but kind of threw us both off a bit.   During our first visit, both of our orders were completely screwed up. My girlfriend ordered the chicken enchiladas, but received the mushroom variant. Since she was pleased with the taste, she opted not to say anything. But after finally getting to try the chicken during our return, she actually was surprised to find that she preferred the mushrooms.  I've tried a variety of their tacos, which are all executed very well - even if I've always been partial to street-size. They clearly know what they're doing in this department.  In a rather bizarre choice, I actually ordered their Madrigal Burger as well, which is much better than I expected at a place like this. Meat was juicy, flavorful, and the additional ingredients balanced everything out nicely.   As for their sides, the beans are good, while we both agree that the rice is more on the bland side. Fortunately, this seemed a bit improved during the second visit, which might have just been an inconsistency issue.  Now, for dessert, we decided to go with their coconut pie, despite many Yelp recommendations for the churros. The pie was just okay, as parts were good, while others tasted buttery (and not in a good way), but more like you're biting into a stick of margarine. We opted to skip dessert during on our second visit, but their chipotle chocolate pie sounds promising.   I wouldn't quite call them the five-star experience that others might be claiming, but I've always been a bit stingy with my ratings. However, I think that as this place grows, you'll be hearing a lot of great things about what's offered here. Some have claimed it's more upscale, but given the environment, menu choices, and presentation, I'd call it more along the lines of reasonably priced Mexican cuisine done with a modern flare by someone who has the skills to execute far better than most competitors.  For this, I see no reason to not give them a strong recommendation.

qLiCEY3MApHw_iydU4VH2g.text: What a great new restaurant!  From the time you arrive you're greeted and feel very welcomed. The inside actually reminded me of being in Mexico inside of a restaurant.   I went during their Happy Hour time (2:30pm-6pm). There were quite a few beer specials, margaritas were $6, and the majority of appetizers were $2 off.   I decided on the frozen raspberry margarita... definitely a great choice!  There margaritas are quite strong so there is a 3 count limit.   Chips and salsa were served and there's also a house-made habanero sauce you can get on the side. Both the salsa and sauce were flavorful!  The habanero sauce wasn't too spicy but still had a great bite too it.   You can order the tacos as is or you can request to do a combination of 3 different tacos. You'll want to get them on the corn tortilla since they are made fresh to order. (Thank me later!)  I tried the fish, shrimp, and al pastor tacos. All were full of flavor and the tacos were authentic, packed with food, and extremely messy!  I feel like tacos are supposed to be messy so it made the experience even better.. make sure you have napkins handy.   All-in-all great experience!  I was told they have only been around for 10 weeks so I wish this great success!

V0B6nyv7KwttTXiSde-bvA.text: Ok.   I've been going here since they opened... So this place is the best darn taco, enchilada, tequila place in the valley period.  Authentic upscale Oaxacan flavors with premium ingredients, and family style service.  Every time I'm there the staff and owners welcome me back as if I were family. When I bite into the food.. magic happens!

jpqmrabUz2gJwjGo_rvr_w.text: Hands down the best Mexican restaurant I've been to. I didn't feel like an outsider because of my ethnicity or language spoken, it was such a welcoming place. I had the BYO burrito and a coconut cream pie which had a lining of caramel under the coconut cream, peach margarita on the rocks, and my mom had a grilled romaine with steak. We shared the house guac- which by the way was the best guacamole and the freshest tasting I've ever had. The food is presented so well.. worth coming, don't let the outside look of the restaurant fool you, or the location.. there's flat screens on the wall and people were watching the Sunday game. Also, the peach margarita was the best margarita I've ever had.

EZ7b9MRFuQFhTGNXMVAhzA.text: Seriously though - the South Mountain part of town was in desperate need of an upscale and deliciouso Mexican restaurant.  EVERYTHING I have had here is to die for from the homemade tortillas, the fresh guac, the steak tacos, the veggie tacos, and the grilled romaine salad (add shrimp).  After you have all that, you absolutely need to try the churros, which you dip in a creme sauce with caramel swirls.  All of this should be washed down with the mango margarita with tejin dipped rim!  I literally eat my weight in food every time I'm there.  Tom, the bartender is great, all of the wait staff has been incredible, and the owner is super friendly and will often come out and personally check on you.  I promise, you won't leave hungry.  As you can tell, I'm a big fan and a repeat customer!  ENJOY!

N1L_22Pgn2_7C0BfY9CsZw.text: Came here with a group of girlfriends after we landed in Phoenix and were on our way to Sedona for a girls trip. We just went off of good Yelp reviews and knew nothing else. Soo glad we ended up here! The food and margs were delicious and the atmosphere on the patio was the perfect way to kick off our trip. The owner, Leo came out after our meal was over and talked for awhile. He is so sweet and so was our server!! Highly recommend for the food and quant, intimate atmosphere! Get the guac for sure. 4cTsg6wlB7OTMrWFidtmyg.text: Eduardo was very hospitable. We were a party of 10 and he had our table all ready for us before we arrived. We will be back for sure. Thanks, Eduardo!  Our family dinner was memorable and we will never forget our wonderful evening.

hzzfPpAquG0tBZrq95fjfg.text: Fantastic food and nice homey ambiance! We are in Phoenix for my sister's graduation. They sat 7 of us immediately. We started off with chips, salsa and of course guacamole. We tried the grilled corn on the cob along with a bowl of it off. So yummy! The grilled romaine salad was plentiful with tomatoes, bacon and blue cheese. The cilantro dressing complimented the flavors. Half of us got the house specialty of enchiladas. The others tacos. The mushroom enchilada was stupendous. The portions are generous. We were so full that we had to decline churros for dessert. What a great find and glad to recommend.

ET_-JNmFq1gvmd02GMqXVw.text: Take my money. This place is unreal. My only problem is that this was my first time here. The gauc, enchiladas, Queso, tacos, pasta, and churro are out of this world. Hopefully you will get Eduardo he deserves 6 stars

gofyZVdqio0Mch6M7ANyGA.text: I really liked this place. The menu is simple but everything is gourmet and delicious. The chef "Leo" is very nice and attentive. He comes out to greet you and makes sure everything is satisfactory. Awesome service!!!

S41FnUPPZzyW0VXyBiVi1g.text: I love the idea of a loungy modern Mexican restaurant but I wasn't impressed with this place. I really like that their menu is simple and has both traditional and fusion food options. Yet, I give it 3 stars bc the place is relatively small and can be very loud with larger crowds. The food is good but not great and prices are slightly higher than other Mexican restaurants with the same type of food.

bdOtQU3nEDQIqgRgMA2w7g.text: Cocina madrigal is an awesome additional to south Phoenix! I've been a couple of times since they opened and I've been mostly impressed by their food and service. The best item hands down is the green chili pork.... You have to get it, either as an appetizer or in your meal. It's delicious! The first time I visited, I had the tortilla soup and it was amazing, it had chunks of grilled chicken in it and avocado....the broth was flavorful... It was great.... So the next time I went in and tried it again, not nearly as good! They used shredded chicken instead of grilled and it made a big difference. If you're reading this, go back to grilled! It was so different and tasty. I always have to get the salsa (which costs money, but is really good) and last time got the trio which includes salsa, guac, and cheesy chorizo and mushrooms. This thing could have been a meal for 2 for 12$, for real. It was a lot of food. The salsa was awesome (as per usual) and I liked the cheesy chorizo thing. I didn't love the guac, it had a lot of raw onion that was somewhat overpowering, but it wasn't bad. I've also had their chicken enchiladas which were fine, but didn't hold up to the pork.   Lastly.... Do yourself a favor and get a slice of their pie.... Oh em gee is that pie good. It's so rich and creamy, I usually take a couple bites and then take the rest home and eat a little everyday until it's gone....so good.

3WSNCP_zSbBF364BNdrw2g.text: We love love love this restaurant! Modern twist on Mexican food, which is nice.   We always order the fundido appetizer which is amazing! A standout dish was the mushroom enchilada, so good. I also like that you can order the tacos on lettuce cups for a lower carb option.  The highlight of this place is the service. Everyone is so kind and attentive. They've even brought my 15 month old son small sides of rice, beans and mash potatoes for a meal without us ordering it.   Don't let the exterior or location detour you from trying this hidden gem. The people and food are amazing!!! On of my favs in the valley.

e_FUwup5jM3yHKqqlPulcQ.text: The food is excellent as is the service.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  The mushroom enchiladas are to die for.  I can not wait to try other things on the menu.

VsNX8sokOvDaSz_goPudLg.text: Yes. Just yes. Amazing tacos! Fish and steak were my favorites. Amazing service. They even shook my Michelada half way through so it would taste right!!! Chef Madrigal is fantastic.

Y-bcFjnLWyqDwSqZ65q09w.text: Hands down the best blend of trend and traditional Mexican food I've ever had. Leo is a cultural chef who completely understands the trends of modern day Mexican but incorporates family recipes to the T. The hospitality in incredible and the food is above top notch. Get a margarita to start, made with an incredible house tequila, then absolutely get the Oaxaca fundido. House made tortillas, and incredibly fresh beans. Support this family ran business and give them the staple they deserve in South Phoenix.

th0-HQlzqN2BN1xQ_NofRw.text: One would think that with such a rich vibrant Hispanic culture in Phoenix Arizona that excellent Mexican food restaurants would be less than a dime a dozen. I'm a transplanted native. My parents moved us out here 40+ years ago when I was 6 months old from Chicago. In all the years I've been here I can name a very small number of Mexican food restaurants that even deserve to be called good; even less great or excellent. Most of those are actually still operating some have plummeted in quality but are still ok at least. Until today I only had 2 good or great or even better Mexican Restaurants to go to in all of the Phoenix area. Now I can happily and exuberantly say that there is a third and it is absolutely fantastic. Please go to Cocina Madrigal and enjoy the best Mexican food in all of Phoenix. When I enjoyed my first visit to Cocina Madrigal; I asked for the Chef's favorite; what ever is on the menu that is his favorite dish. I love the surprise when a good Chef or even a Good cook will make for you when you ask them to make their favorites. What the Cheff prepared and served to me was amazing. He provided a delicious sample of his favorites from the menu. A fish taco, a steak taco and the most surprising and absolutely delicious mushroom enchilada. Although I give the enchilada high praise it was the steak taco that was my favorite. And yes being a carnivore that is also a balanced omnivore; I absolutely would order the mushroom enchilada again especially if I wanted to eat light. Congratulations Cocina Madrigal for surpassing my long standing top two Mexican Restaurants in all of Phoenix with one fantastic dinner. Thank you. We will be back.

b1brUEKC-BkN0teanpAgfA.text: wasn't fond of the service, the food was pretty bland, but the enchiladas were good!

nGM-wvEc-6Ge-iKIu1LtDg.text: Amazing food and service. Also have a few options for vegan/vegetarians. Staff was accommodating and super friendly.

QWXJaCnzN_Y0MBpb2WjAkg.text: food here was great. it's upscale mexican food at an affordable price. similar to barrio queen but without the modern decor.

869EOm-GrtnOlHzeqW9ovw.text: This is such a good Mexican restaurant the food prices are a little high but the food is amazing I had the chicken enchiladas  is with fried eggs on top which was amazing girlfriend the wild mushroom enchiladas and It was even better. Two margaritas that were equally as good as the food and the service was amazing they asked us how we were doing several times and food orders to specifications. I highly recommend this place! The waiter was also really nice !

jQypq6myw_ykygvVBUNBdg.text: Excellent food, excellent service. Very friendly staff. Owner/Chef always comes out to check on quality. Love it here!

ViQZwUQgk-Oquj_yhqz85A.text: We had the hatch green chile pork and it was fabulous.  The staff was friendly and kept our drinks full.  I'll definitely be back!

QsQAYcQDwpvsRtlc7tG97g.text: Great mix of Mexican American contemporary fusion. Fresh ingredients and friendly service.

VjCBoWBdAL85OIa0xn15mg.text: Cannot speak more highly about the whole experience you'll get here. The food is amazing - from the different types of guacamole to the insane wild mushroom enchiladas, you really can't go wrong. The staff is wonderful and so helpful and you will absolutely meet the owner who couldn't be more lovely and welcoming. This is a MUST visit if you are in the Phoenix area!!

T8cTVt209ugGnRGnYD70PQ.text: This place is so yummy... the chips and salsa and guacamole even sets a high bar!  The ancho mole sauce is worth the drive!  The owner is so friendly.  Great place!

Z5aNzhDGeUZXtX6pE6TqAg.text: This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant. I was happy to see they just opened this restaurant and the reviews were great on yelp and google. I stopped in for a bite and OMG the food is soooooo good. The service is great. They're margaritas are the best I've had. This will definitely be the new spot to bring my family and friends for some GREAT Mexican food.

GcWVlyllUZ4Pm9bBUwcsPg.text: The food is fantastic at this little restaurant. The jalepeno bacon in the Guacamole and the Diabla pasta..... Out of this world!

XCugBelGng_WKzpClCwO0w.text: I had the chicken enchiladas. They had a good amount of chicken in them and had a nice flavor.  I also tried their churro and cream dessert and it was very satisfying. I could see coffee going well with it. I found the prices to be reasonable. I'll be back here to try some more items. The staff was very friendly and attentive also!

QYiwbPsSdcLJzdySJBNsDw.text: Had a great lunch today at Corina Madrigal. My we had three different tacos and I had two different beef enchiladas. Definitely not Tex-Mex. Refined, and muy sabroso. Stared with guac made to order. Great Margaritas, rocks or frozen. Gary highlighted the menu offerings and the service was friendly and attentive. Afterwards we had a chance to meet owner/chef Leo Madrigal. This place is a winner. In an area that is currently pretty industrial, it is quick shot from Sky Harbor and south of 17 on S.16th. Give it a try. Chef's efforts should be both rewarding and rewarded.

eQhg56cUAmrosK8BYYIZ9w.text: My Yelpers did not disappoint.   This is now my favorite Mexican food restaurant!  I'm going to probably sound like all the other reviews.... the owner and staff were so lovely and welcoming.      The food was a little adventuresome in a really good way.   The guacamole was delicious,  their salsas spicy and yummy and the steak in the burritos and tacos marinated to perfection and delicious.   A must try.

Byt-kFxNHIAevJtMbr3k1g.text: I had the veggie enchiladas with Mole de Achiote and mushrooms. The tortillas looked like they were homemade and the mushrooms were not earthy at all. They were very flavorful. The sauce was not overwhelming and had multiple layers of flavors. It was worth the drive coming from North Central Phoenix and I can't wait to go back.

XDvzitXY_R0qEy_1rcUwCQ.text: This place was lackluster in general, but especially where it counts: the food. One would hope, with such a small, focused menu, that everything on there it was delicious, but it simply wasn't. It's hard for a Mexican food place to screw up Mexican food in my experience, but this place has found a way to do so.  Everything was lacking in flavor, there was no real cohesion, and in general it felt like all the offerings had been "cleaned up" to look nice. The problem is that Mexican food is supposed to be home cooked, with fat and salt, and blending together in one beautiful, glorious, delicious plateful.  They seem to have taken all of that magic and thrown it away, without providing any reason to do so. There are so many Mexican food places in Phoenix, and I believe you can do better at just about any one of them.

nsiw-pOoIuo7irarJmwjvA.text: Worth it!  Best Mexican food we had in ages! Guacamole and salsa were amazing! Husband had mushroom enchiladas and swore they were the best enchiladas he ever had (he's from TX so definitely had his fill of them). Leave room for desert: their chocolate pie and coconut pie are to die for! PS. We almost missed the place - it looks like a house with a covered terrace, nothing fancy. The sign is small and the trees obscure it. Drive slow and swing into the parking lot right before the terrace.

_PHEVbzhaP1XeJCz6up-iQ.text: I highly highly recommend this place. Original Mexican food with an amazing service. I love it to because the owner Leo Madrigal takes his time to stop by your table to see if you are happy with your food!!!  I wish I could give 10 stars  instead of just 5

ihjJdj7wyE_buVj76XxA0A.text: Great food and awesome customer service. Plates were hot and large portions. Guacamole was stellar and the owner came out and greeted us. Nice touch.

CZXvdtLz0t_j5FUgEqxITA.text: There is no wonder why this place has such a high rating.  The service was excellent and our food was delivered quickly and had amazing flavor.

3J_6iAWO0C659TVc73JVFw.text: I don't have enough words to describe how awesome this place is.   Get the mushroom enchiladas- you will NOT be disappointed!

xSfashLGo56TlN6XoKk-Ug.text: Tacos were amazing! Service was first rate! Can't say enough about this place. Everybody was super nice and attentive. My glass was never empty before they asked if I wanted a refill. Oh... and the Churros...

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

b7vHawqCy1NKFMx8jWnICg.text: What a great find! Stopped in for lunch with a coworker. First impressions are huge. First we were impressed by the cleanliness of the place. The staff was very cheerful and attentive.  Chips were warm and not too salty. Salsa had excellent flavor and was not too hot so most people should like it. We were given a sample of their habanero salsa that definitely was hot but also had that great habanero flavor.  For lunch, I had chicken enchiladas and my friend had barbacoa enchiladas. These dishes were executed perfectly and had lots of flavor. The beans were amazing. Perfect texture and just the right amount of heat. For the area you don't expect this much attention to detail. This is a special place in an area that's been lacking.  Welcome to the neighborhood Cocina Madrigal. I look forward to being a regular.

DZ4S_q4a8Ko3tr9HAhJK0g.text: Love this place!! Vibrant, friendly staff. As far as drinks I only had the limoncello margarita and I love it. Frozen margaritas on par with Kona or Z'Tejas. Bartender Tom is excellent and very knowledgeable. I had the vegetable taco and loved it. Today had the mushroom enchiladas and like those too! Chips and salsa addictive and i recommend the elote it's bomb

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5bmqE5Ctsj2lxlMJ7DcSKQ.text: You must go try the wild mushroom enchilada.  Ifa you luva the fungi, you gotta try it. Also one of the best moscow mules ive had, nice and spicy

LXPsPUbf8Godify0NVKsnw.text: The only issue with Cocina Madrigal is that I didn't know about this gem until recently! Service: the staff is attentive and friendly. Chef came out to introduce himself before we ordered and returned later to check-in after our food arrived. It was easy to see that he cares about his patrons. This family-run authentic restaurant is a great example of what Phoenix's community is all about. Food: So, I love tacos. I love finding new, fresh tasting tacos. This is the place. Handmade corn tortillas are made-to-order. They are light and thin but enough to deliver the goods. I tried the shrimp and fish tacos. Both tacos were amazing. They were perfect explosions of taste in your mouth, with obviously fresh ingredients. The sauce in the fish tacos made you longing for more bites. Even the iced tea was top-notch (not kidding). After the first sip, my friend and I both said: "Whoa that's really good tea". I haven't stopped thinking about our experience since dining there last Friday. We will be back - and I'm hoping it's within the next 7 days :)

rIM2-EsBhTE7kANy5odiOA.text: Amazing! You could taste the passion in the chef's cooking with every ingredient! Met the owner and he was so nice, he came to our table and talked with us fOur waitress was awesome and so sweet, bartender awesome guy! Amazing food, people and atmosphere. This place is a diamond in the rough! Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips &amp; salsa with mango margaritas with chamoy and tajin rims and guacamole

zXXWeB1Gayor-uRayPXRTQ.text: Been here twice in under a week.   Their home made chips are perfect, both of the salsas are amazing.  Their steak tacos are not traditional Mexican steak tacos. They are like some sort of Mexican/American fusion taco. They are incredible. It's a taste you'll only get here and it's great.  Only gave 5 stars because 6 isnt possible.

CF2eO31y0CO0LK4Dor7qew.text: 3 tacos for $13 dollars the chef tries to give the tacos a twist but honestly i love tacos and they are ridicoulus for charging so much for tacos that are so cheap to make do not waste your money here i feel this restaurant is trying to jip people of their money i am mexican and know how much it cost to make mexican food and the prices here are ridiculous especially for being in the south side

Bv6Plyg-Lr9Yrwk9yC9X6A.text: Coming from someone who is use to Mexican food in Los Angeles, it's very hard to find good Mexican food in AZ in comparison but this place easily made it to my favorites list.  Walking in at first there is a 'homey' feel. Everyone was eager to seat us and was super friendly. The bar is stocked with some of the best tequila, all the good domestic Mexican beer. I stuck with my favorite strawberry jarritos.  My dad had already been here 3 times and was itching to take us for his birthday. Immediately he ordered us the made to order guacamole with pina & jalapeno bacon. Despite the pineapple not coming out the first time with the dish, the chef was quick to fix the issue. He brought out a second batch with the pineapple and it was on the house. He even brought out my little brothers burrito first. You could tell he really cared to have a lasting impression on each table in the restaurant and took pride in his dishes. Everything was delicious. All the meats in the tacos & enchiladas are marinated and seasoned so well. The churros were amazing and you can't skip getting those! I'd go back just for those. I'm excited to recommend this place to all my customers, these guys deserve it. It's customer service yes, but these guys are serving hospitality.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xJHU036TzNkqD2JG-MZEJA.text: Loved the food it was amazing!!! Here from out town wanted somewhere good to eat. This place excited our expectations. Had a great waitress loved the attention that Liz provided. The owner was super sweet as well taking the time to greet his customers and share a little of him. Great experience!!!

Fz6exYcg0WXGgEqR0U5vwA.text: Cocina Madrigal is going to take Phoenix by storm. Get ahead of the wave by checking out this local restaurant out before all your friends are talking about it and the line is out the door. Everything is made fresh to order, from the guacamole to the corn tortillas. And trust me, it makes a difference. Their taco selection is great, and if you can't decide on one, try up to three different kinds! Highly recommend the Al Pastor, Oaxaca Shrimp, and Achioye Braised Chicken. While you wait for your food, let the chips and salsa hold you over. Just make sure to save room for the main course (and desert) because you'll want to finish every bite of everything that's in front of you!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dJkUyaLFH0c7zECQh85Q5A.text: If you're picky about Mexican food like I am, you will love this place. You know you're at the right place when the tortillas are house made. The night we had dinner there they were short staffed and the place was packed. The owner worked hard to make sure we were served timely. The food was great, margaritas were great all around great experience.

7J2An4C5dKD2F4RGm4-Vqw.text: A friend flew in to PHX at dinner time so we tried it because of all the great reviews.   It was OK.  The Trio was good but the entrees were so unmemorable that I don't recall what we ate.  Our server took a break but others tried to fill in and were enthusiastic but also busy so service was just OK.  Personally my wife and I both think there are at least a few better Mexican around.

f0vqVGw2piVeUnuel-8dRQ.text: Just get here.. you can probably order anything, but I've had both the Steak and Al Pastor tacos and they were righteous.  The pastor is not exactly traditional, but the flavors are amazing.

4Kn8r74wWPKVQ7mTYq7SPg.text: Best Mexican Food that I've had. Extremely excited that it's in South Phoenix; where it's hard to find the mix of quality, great tasting, consistently good food. This is my new all time favorite spot. The trio off the appetizer menu is my go to. I usually go to Cocina Madrigal just for the trio and some margaritas. The mushroom enchilada has such a great blend of flavors, not spicy at all. I've had the tacos as well, favorite is the pork (the flavor the meat holds is so good.) The service is spot on. The workers constantly hustle cause it's always so busy, but they're extremely kind and attentive. Love keeping my money in South Phoenix at this restaurant!! Although it's popularity has grown as quick as it has, I'm so happy their customer service and quality of food remains amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margaritas, Chips &amp; Salsa
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa &amp; chips, part of the trio appetizer
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

UGkpl4BPMTGGhHHdvIJ6uA.text: Great food, friendly staff.  We are from out of town, but we'd definitely return.  We had a variety of enchiladas and they were all delicious.  We had someone get the fish tacos and they were enjoyed as well.

8BTlUTZNXyuAv6dPwG7aGg.text: WOW.... all I can say is WOW!  It you like Mexican Food, It's time you stop by and try this restaurant!  Food was great,  service was excellent, the place was busy and has a great vibe!

w5-y7VD7DvsO8oC58aUJ5Q.text: This place is a hidden gem. After reading rave reviews on Nextdoor, we checked it out on a Friday night. The parking was a little tight, but we found a spot easily enough. Walking through the door we were greeted by a near roar of happy patrons. The host was friendly and we were seated immediately.  The menu was approachable (not overwhelming), with plenty of options. Everything sounded amazing! Chips and salsa weren't free, but they were less than $2 for a very generous portion which was refilled as needed.  I got a margarita and the steak tacos, and my husband got a chicken burrito. The tacos were PHENOMENAL-- I couldn't believe the complexity of flavor and beautiful visual presentation. The server was friendly and helpful, and the owner came to check on us. We will 100% be back, soon, and often.

lMaAnGGPtzLVUNkWh8z9NA.text: Tonight was our first time visiting this fine establishment. "The guacamole was devine." A direct quote from my husband who does not like guacamole and couldn't stop himself. I had three tacos the chicken, the steak, and the fish to get a variety. They let you mix and match. The chicken and the steak were amazing. The flavors were incredible. The steak taco had fried battered onion and pepper strings (the chef is probably cringing at my attempt to explain this) that were so flavorful and added a nice light crunchy texture. I really enjoyed them. The fish taco was also good it was just outshown by the flavors in the other two. We will definitely be coming back. I need to leave room for the coconut pie next time.

vXaA6dPrAS5h_FkGVkXDvA.text: Mushroom enchiladas were on point. Something we had not tasted before. Small parking lot that was full on a weekday, much to our surprise. The restaurant is only 9 wks old and the owner came out and greeted us too. The waitress and service was fabulous. Food is really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole with chips is worth it

U8MLRBjICvAKh5YmbLomvg.text: Omg! We are back again, for round two! This place is fantastic! We tried the grilled romaine salad and churros tonight... Out of this world!

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churros are fantastic! The best in the valley!!!

L1W2XqJKW2re09m7o3FFvg.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant that I have tried so far (outside Mexico :). I live in Austin, TX so I have a high comparison base. We ate tortilla soup and wild mushrooms enchilada, complex smooth flavors. Leave room for desert- totally worth it. $3 Churros with creme brulee type souce are flaky. Everything freshly made

ZuaLaK4SJIsUqeM3FGEPtQ.text: Great food and excellent customer service.  The owner greeted me and was very kind.    The server Briana S.  was wonderful.

aXRapXxwLhYoSmmhdIP0kg.text: Seriously just had the best experience here! They apologized ahead of time for being busy and short staffed, but I honestly didn't notice. Our server was great and she helped my indecisive self decide on the mushroom enchiladas, soooo good. And the churros are a must have. Ask for a spoon to finish off the sauce!!!

piD6aoc9Vl7Veom1p3Piaw.text: Awesome food. Atmosphere is causal and easy going. Service was prompt and friendly. Prices reasonable as well.   Highly recommend the guacamole, the romaine salad, the mushroom enchiladas and the beef tenderloin. Also, try the margaritas.  Neighborhood is up and coming and could use more restaurants like this! I will be coming back.

A_1BGJq_oYlPvF3AFiph7Q.text: Small menu, but well though out ingredients for each selection.  My wife told me if she seen the menu online, she wouldn't have come here. She was pleasantly surprised by the flavors.  I suggest you give it a chance.  I will be dining here on any future phoenix visits.

T5TOfBw84zgXdRr2QyY92Q.text: Our fourth time here in two weeks. Food is on point and the frozen margaritas are amazing!! Leo's special habanero salsa rocks! Give this place a try - you'll thank me!

qlpGmDJ_xqFnhHDdSQCaPA.text: We live in Prescott. I had a business meeting in Phoenix and afterwards, my girlfriend and I were ready to eat. Found this on Apple maps and the reviews were all excellent so we literally drove out of another restaurant's parking lot to check it out. It's not five star dining. But it is a five star yelp review. It's casual and they're super friendly. Best frozen marg I've ever had. I got the steak burrito and she got the pork barbacoa enchiladas. Both were sublime. Guacamole made fresh to order and was perfect. I like heat so I asked if they have any sauces and the bartender brought out all the usuals and then went back and got me a fresh made habanero salsa. Sooooo good. Excellent service, excellent food. Came out as ordered and timely. Cannot give a restaurant a better review in my opinion.  10/10 would recommend.

Bjcyw-LFtAykPn5F066GZQ.text: Food and service is outstanding! Highly recommend this restaurant to anyone that likes Mexican cuisine tied with a hint of southwest culinary. Decor was great and seating was comfortable. Hats off to the chef and his son Brian for great tasting food.

uPucKFamPjACtbqtEfNd1g.text: Absolutely did not disappoint! From the Mexican mule, guacamole to the enchiladas and burritos! We ended with the churros and chipotle pie. So yummy!

NZ14F-JTCDRx95qHBtxaEA.text: Omg!  Wonderful find!  Absolutely delicious food. Had a combination of fish, shrimp and pork tacos. Best fish tacos I've ever had. Server, Barbie, was amazing. Great knowledge of menu and wonderful service. Highly recommend!!

REwghcN3t2sh-H81Qn_dpQ.text: Fantastic family owned atmosphere, great neighborhood feel with FANTASTIC tacos to boot. Incredibly welcoming staff- the owner/chef made a point to come out and ask how our meal was. 10/10 will be coming here again!

pBHpbg10DkNuRVGxzHEBrg.text: We had to try this place out after seeing the segment on 3TV. My mouth was salivating after seeing some of their food platters. ... Boy was it good. I had the mushroom enchiladas. My husband had the chicken burrito enchilada style, & we shared the x fundido appetizer. We also shared the churro dessert, yummm!! We traveled all the way from Fountain Hills, & well worth it!! ..We plan on returning real soon with our out of state colleagues. The waitress & the owner were very warm & welcoming. Hats off to the chef/owner!!  I highly recommend!!

mHwg0dnlvROzhv_qVNa9xw.text: FINALLY it only took us one year to find a GREAT Mexican Restaurant. They've only been open for a short time so hoping everyone comes to try them out. You won't be disappointed. The staff is very friendly and outgoing. They are very interested in making sure every aspect of your experience is taken care of.  We are worried they will become to famous that when we want to go it will be too busy. The beer is cold and the raspberry margarita is refreshing too strong for my wife so that was good for me. I thought it was perfect. We had the Oaxaca Fundido appetizer, perfect spice sausage and grilled onions awesome. We split three mushroom enchiladas so delicious and three plate tacos two fish and one vegetable. Everything was so fresh from the fish to the cilantro very tasty. Rice and beans complimented the dish as well. Not refried beans, just beans with sprinkles of cheese. Also tasted great. Wanted to have dessert but to full glad the portions are large so we got left overs too. I warned our son that those left overs are off limits for sure. Sorry so long of a review but I'm excited for finding this gem. Good luck to them..

photos.caption: Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cocina Madrigal - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kXNpAbYGw7YPih8zy-cs6A.text: The food is delicious and service friendly. Tortillas made to order. I absolutely recommend this restaurant.
